loans.name: Bertha Claudia

texts.es: Bertha Claudia tiene 44 años, soltera, con un hijo menor de edad, su actividad es la venta de hot dog, hamburguesa, gaseosas y cosméticos, tiene seis años de tener el negocio, La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a disfrutar de sus diferentes productos, inicio este negocio por su esposo que fue quien le ayudo con el poco capital de trabajo compraron ciertos productos y fue así que lograron observar que establecer este tipo de negocios es muy rentable. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de bolsas, pan, carne, salchichas, sopas, gaseosas, jugos, entre otras cosas.  Desea que su hijo sea un profesional y logre obtener un buen trabajo
texts.en:
Bertha Claudia is 44 years old.  She is single and has one dependent child.  Bertha Claudia's business is selling hot dogs, burgers, soda and cosmetics.  She has been in this business for six years.  Her customers enjoy the different products that she offers.

Bertha Claudia started this business with some working capital that her husband provided.  They bought some products and realized that this type of business is very profitable.  The loan that Bertha Claudia is requesting will be used to buy bags, bread, meat, sausages, soups, soda, juice and other products.  She would like her son to become a professional and secure a good job.

loans.use: to buy bags, bread, meat, sausages, soup, soda, juice, etc.

loans.name: Rosseli Glend

texts.es:
Rosseli tiene 30 años, es madre de un pequeño de 7 años de edad a quien cría sola con mucho amor y esfuerzo ya que ella quiere que su hijo sea mejor que ella. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, así como también podemos encontrar a las Líneas de Nazca las cuales son jeroglifos que se encuentra en medio de un gran campo árido y las cuales eran usadas como calendarios Astronómicos por la antigua cultura Nazca según algunos estudios, reciben a muchos turistas durante todo el año los cuales quedan maravillados. Cuando Rosseli tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho dibujar, ya que cuando ella dibuja se distrae mucho y le ayuda a pensar mucho mejor y a reflexionar, también en ocasiones le gusta mucho preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Ella logro estudiar la carrera de Diseño Grafico y con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo logro iniciar su negocio de impresiones en papel, estampados y bordados de polos.

Día a Día Roselli trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 7 horas diarias, puede llegar a atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy creativa y sobre todo es muy cumplida con sus clientes y por ello siempre la recomiendan.

Rosseli está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar moldes para serigrafía para poder realizar los estampados de sus polos, de esta manera ella podrá tener los implementos necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando y trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y tener una imprenta y un taller de serigrafía”.
texts.en:
Rosseli, 30, is the mother of a 7 year old son who she has raised alone with a lot of love and hard work. She wants her son to be better than she is. She lives in the city of Nazca, which is known for a warm and inviting climate, as well as for the Nazca lines which are symbols in a huge dry field that were used as an astronomical calendar for the ancient Nazca culture, according to studies. They receive a lot of tourists year round who are astonished. When Rosseli has free time she likes to draw, because when she draws she is distracted and it helps her to think better and reflect. She also sometimes likes to make one of her favorite dishes, arroz con pollo [rice and chicken]. She studied graphic design and with a lot of enthusiasm and effort started her own business of printing on paper, stamps and t-shirts. 

Rosseli works in her business around 7 hours a day and tends to as many as 15 customers a day. She thinks that it's going well because she's very creative and above all is very courteous to her customers and so they recommend her.

Rosseli is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she has been able to buy molds for silk-screen printing to make the stamps on her t-shirts. That way she'll have the tools that she needs to be able to do her work, which will let her continue fighting and working to realize her biggest dream: "To give her son a good education and to have a printing house and a silk screen workshop."

loans.use: to buy molds for silk-screen printing.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra, actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleada por más de ocho horas en un a entidad pública de la ciudad de La Paz.Todavia vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Sopocachi de La Paz.
Ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar  es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que debe comprar los útiles escolares para sus dos hijos y pagar la góndola para que los recoja ya que no tiene alguien que le ayude a llevarlos y recogerlos.
Sandra vive en una casa en anticretico ocupando seis habitaciones, también cuenta con el sueldo de su esposo ya que ambos deben cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y servicios básicos de su familia.
El sueño de Sandra es tener una casa propia para dar seguridad y comodidad a su familia.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Sandra currently gets income working over eight hours a day as an employee of a public entity in La Paz.  She still lives in her parents’ house in the Sopocachi area of La Paz.

She is married and has two school age children.  This is why she is requesting the loan.  She needs to buy school supplies for her two children, and she needs to pay for their transportation because she does not have anyone to help her take them and pick them up.

Sandra lives in a house under an “anticretico” (a contract to rent property whereby the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period in lieu of paying monthly rent; at the end of the rental period, the tenant receives the sum back, in full, from the landlord, thus resulting in rent-free living), occupying six rooms.  She also has her husband’s salary because they both need to cover their family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.

Sandra’s dream is to have her own house in order to make her family safer and more comfortable.

This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children and to pay for their school transportation.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José Luís es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Santiago I (El Alto) ocupando cuatro habitaciones pequeñas con paredes de ladrillo y piso de tierra.
Estudió solo hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como conductor de transporte público en la ciudad de La Paz. Ya que ayuda en los gastos de alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia siendo sus padres son mayores de edad, es por eso que solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de José Luís, es independizarse para mejorar su calidad de vida y sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
José Luís is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Santiago I area of El Alto.  He occupies four small rooms with brick walls and dirt floors.  He only attended school up until high school. 

He currently works as a public transportation driver in the city of La Paz.  As his parents are elderly, he helps with his family’s expenses for food and basic services.

That is why he is requesting the loan for maintenance on his vehicle.  This is the only source of work that he has to support his family.

José Luís’s dream is to become independent in order to improve his quality of life and his income.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his vehicle, which is his source of income.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl es casado y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en la casa de su hermano ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona San Roque de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente trabaja como albañil constructor ya que realiza diferentes trabajos a contrato en el área de la construcción, trabaja por más de doce horas para terminar sus contratos ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y gastos médicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de otra habitación en la casa de su hermano ya que necesita darle comodidad a su hijo.
El sueño de Raúl es mejorar sus ingresos para obtener un anticretico y poder pagar los estudios de su hijo.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Raúl is married and has a child.  They live in his brother’s house, occupying only one room.  The house is located in the San Roque area of the city of El Alto.

He currently works as a construction bricklayer.  He does different contract construction jobs.  He works over twelve hours a day in order to finish his contracts.  This is the only income he has to cover his family’s food, education, and medical expenses.

He needs the loan to build another room onto his brother’s house.  He needs it to make his son more comfortable.

Raúl’s dream is to improve his income in order to get an “anticretico”  (a contract to rent property whereby the renter pays the landlord a fixed sum at the start of the rental period in lieu of paying monthly rent; at the end of the rental period, the tenant receives the sum back, in full, from the landlord, thus resulting in rent-free living) and to be able to pay for his son’s education.

It is the first time that he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to build another room for his son.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio, es casado y tiene tres hijos, viven en casa propia con dos habitaciones pequeñas con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la misma ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente trabaja como chofer por más de diez horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para alimentar, educar y pagar los servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de la fachada de su casa  ya que las paredes son de adobe y el desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
El sueño de Patricio, es construir más habitaciones ya que tiene tres hijos quiere darles más comodidad y seguridad.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Patricio is married and has three children.  They live in their own house with two small rooms that have brick walls and dirt floors.  The house is located in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto.

He currently works as a driver.  He works over ten hours a day until the late hours of the night.  He does this because it is the only source of work that he has to cover the family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.

He needs the loan to repair the front of his house.  The walls are adobe, and he wishes to improve his family’s quality of life.

Patricio’s dream is to build more rooms.  He has three children, and he wants to make them more comfortable and safer.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to repair the front of his house.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de insumos agrícolas, los cuales serán aplicados al cultivo de maíz y frijol que actualmente está iniciando, comprará específicamente abono y herbicidas, los cuales le protegen y le fortalecen al mismo tiempo la plantación esperando tener una buena cosecha, en esta temporada trabajará en una manzana y media de terreno.
Con el préstamo anterior logró incrementar la producción en la granja de pollos y con la buena ganancias ha podido ayudar a su familia el préstamo anterior ha sido un gran aporte para mejorar sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan to buy agricultural supplies which will be used for the crop of corn and beans which he is currently starting. He will buy manure and herbicides to protect and strengthen the crops in the hope that he will have a good harvest. This season he will work with one and a half manzanas (1 manzana = around 1.740 acres) of land.
With the previous loan he managed to increase the production of chickens on his farm and with his higher income he was able to help his family. The previous loan made a great contribution to improving his economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides.

loans.name: Fabricio Edgardo

texts.es:
Fabricio, se dedica al trabajo agrícola, tiene 20 años de edad, vive con su madre y dos hermanos, su padre murió hace tres años, en la vivienda en la que está es propia, él aprendió a trabajar la agricultura por su padre y desde que él falleció se encuentra realizando el trabajo propio para poder darle el sostenimiento su familia.
Actualmente inicia la siembra de la temporada para esto solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en cinco sacos de abono y herbicidas, este préstamo ayudará a brindar el dinero propio, y poder  invertir en la siembra de granos básicos con el objetivo de sacar una buena cosecha.
La aspiración de él es ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición de vida ya que él trabaja por todos y espera poder salir adelante con esta responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Fabricio makes a living working the land, he is 20 and lives with his mother and two brothers, his father died 3 years ago. They live in their own house.
He learned how to work the land from his father and since he died he has worked on his own to be able to support his family. 
This is the time for the seasonal sowing, that is why he requests a loan, to invest it in 5 sacks of fertilizer and weed-killer, this loan will help to get him his own money and to be able to invest in the purchase of basic grains so he can get a good crop.
His aspiration is to offer his family better living conditions because he works for all of them and he hopes to get ahead in life with that responsibility.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of fertilizer and weed-killer

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Carlos a sus 59 años le gusta mantener a su familia por lo que realiza varios trabajos. Vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil con su esposa Blanca quien le ayuda con la atención al público. En su casa por motivación de su esposa abrió una tienda pequeña donde vende colas, jugos y frutas por trozos. Fue una gran idea porque no tiene competencia en esta área y le va bien. Abre desde  las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. También se ayuda en la economía haciendo carreras como taxi informal, esto lo realiza por las tardes pagando un valor por el auto y realizando carreras a personas conocidas. Carlos dice que solo les hace carreras a personas que lo llaman por teléfono, nos comenta que así es más seguro para él y la persona que lleva. Su mayor problema es que a su edad se enferme y entonces deje de laborar ya que es él quien mantiene el hogar. Con el crédito comprara frutas frescas para la venta. Espera en un futuro poder adquirir un auto propio para no pagar alquiler y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: At 59 years old, Carlos enjoys providing for his family, which is why he does several kinds of work.  He lives in the suburb of Guayaquil with his wife, Blanca, who helps him serve customers.  Because of his wife's motivation, he opened a small store in his home where he sells colas, juices, and sliced fruit.  It was a great idea because he does not have any competition in the area and it is going well for him.  He is open from eight in the morning until ten at night.  He also helps himself out financially by working as an informal taxi.  He does this in the afternoons by paying for a car and giving rides to people he knows.  Carlos says that he only gives rides to people who call him on the phone, which he tells us is safer for both him and the person he is driving.  His greatest problem, since he is the one who provides for his household, is that, at his age, he gets sick and has to stop working.  He will buy dried fruit to sell with this loan.  He hopes to be able to get his own car in the future so he will not have to pay rental fees and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy colas, juices, and fruits

loans.name: Mzimuni Group

texts.en:
Shomari, who is in his mid 30s, is married with one child who goes to school. He has several businesses. He sells charcoal and he has a shop for selling used items such as radios and TV sets, and he's been selling children's games on TVs for six years now.  He works from 6.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.
This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. His dream is to one day be able to buy spare parts for motorcycles.
He will share this loan with his loan group "Mzimuni" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Miguel De Los Santos

texts.es:
Don Muguel continua con sus planes de mejorar de vida, junto a su esposa quien lo apoya en todos los gastos para el hogar han sabido mejorar sus ingresos. cultivan la tierra y vendiendo frutas. con este nuevo credito adquirido en Afodenic podra darle mantenimiento a dos manzanas de piñas que por las lluvias sufren mucho por las inundaciones y las plagas que las asechan. comprara insumos necesarios como completa, urea para que la piña sea de mejor calidad y asi venderla a buen precio.
don Miguel quien confia mucho en Afodenic y agradece espera poder crecer en un futuro con sus cultivos.
texts.en: Miguel continues with his plans to improve his life.  He lives together with his wife who supports him in covering their household expenses.  Together they have figured out how to improve their income, cultivate their land and sell their fruit.  Miguel will use this new loan from Afodenic to maintain his pineapple crop because, as a result of the rain, they are suffering from floods and pests.  He will buy the supplies he needs, such as urea, so that he produces better quality pineapples and is able to sell them for a good price.  Miguel trusts in Afodenic and is grateful for their help.  He hopes to be able to grow in his work in the future.

loans.use: to maintain his crops

loans.name: Eleodora

texts.en:
Eleodora is an artisan who specializes in the traditional Andean patchwork art of arpillería, shaping diminutive fabric figures in three dimensions, embroidering them by hand, and creating elaborate scenes with them. She would like to invest in fabrics and materials for her craft work.

Eleodora has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

"Art is within us all, we just need to express it. I've been making arpilleria applique designs since I was in school, and this helped me finish high school. My husband learned how to embroider and now he is my best assistant! I love my country and want to show the rest of the world the beauty of our landscapes and our customs. Every colorful thread I use transmits the reality of my community and my people."

"Thank you for your confidence in me. Thank you for supporting women artisans like me who want to get ahead on our own, even though we sometimes have to ask for help. Everyone needs assistance at some time in our lives, and I'm grateful for your support."

View Eleodora's arpilleria on the Novica website.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and other materials for her craft work

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro, es casado y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz,.
Ramiro estudio mecánica automotriz hasta técnico medio, actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como chofer por más de diez horas y hasta altas horas de la noche ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo solicita para compra de ladrillos, cemento y arena para el amurallado de su terreno para la  instalación de servicios básicos ya que desea dar más comodidad y seguridad a su familia y de alguna forma  mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Ramiro is married and has one child.  He lives in his parents’ house, occupying only one small room with adobe walls and a dirt floor.  The house is located in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz.

Ramiro studied to be an auto mechanic technician.  He currently gets income because he works has a driver.  He works over ten hours a day until the late hours of the night.  This is his only way of covering food expenses and basic services for his family.

He is requesting the loan to buy bricks, cement, and sand to wall in his land for the installation of basic services.  He wants to make his family more comfortable, to make them safer, and, in some way, improve their quality of life.

This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sand to raise a wall around his land.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo es casado y con tres hijos actualmente esta viviendo con sus suegros, trabaja como operador de tracto camión para una empresa pequeña. Esta pagando su casa pero quiere ampliarla para irse a vivir, con su familia, pues sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan mas espacio ya que su casa es muy pequeña. Con ello le daría más valor a su patrimonio y así brindarles comodidad y mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Eduardo is married and has three children.  He is currently living with his in-laws and works as a truck driver for a small company.  He is paying to improve his home as he would like to expand it.  His children are growing up and they need more space because his home is very small.  This will enable Eduardo to add to the value of his home and to provide his family with more comfort and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build a wall in order to close off a room

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es: Desde Paraíso sector sur urbano de Guayaquil conocemos a Flor de 44 años. Nos cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba en una fábrica pero fue despedida y con la liquidación que recibió decidió invertirla. Fue así como inicio hace año y medio su tienda de víveres, dice que fue la mejor decisión ya que por su edad se le complicaba encontrar trabajo y necesitaba poder cubrir los gastos de sus hijos. La atención la realiza sola desde las 7:30 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche todos los días. De momento nos informa no tener ningún inconveniente ya que la tienda está ubicada en su casa y el sector donde vive es tranquilo. El crédito que esta solicitando Flor lo empleara en la compra de arroz, azúcar, víveres, productos de limpieza etc. esperando incrementar su negocio.
texts.en: In Paraíso, in the south of Guayaquil, we meet 44-year-old Flor.  She tells us that she used to work in a factory but lost her job and decided to use her severance pay to invest in her own business.  One and a half years ago she opened her own grocery store.  She says that this was the best decision she ever made because, owing to her age, it was difficult to find work and she needed to be able to cover her children's expenses.  Flor serves in her store from 7.30am to 7.00pm every day.  Right now she tells us that she doesn't experience any problems because her store is located in her home and the area in which she lives is very quiet.  Flor is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, food products, cleaning products, etc.  She hopes to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, food products and cleaning products

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es: Maria tiene un bazar ubicado en su domicilio en el Suburbio de Guayaquil. Tiene 57 años e inicio el negocio hace 10 años con $ 80.00 dólares producto de un regalo que le hizo su hijo, nos menciona que en aquellos tiempos era mucho dinero. Comenzó haciendo amigos para tener clientes y de ahí poco a poco empezó a organizar su bazar. Primero compro unas vitrinas, luego adquirió algunos productos para ver si tenía acogida. Desde aquel entonces y hasta la fecha se a mantenido. El negocio lo maneja ella sola desde muy temprano en la mañana y cierra a las 10 de la noche, su mayor problema es cuando se enferma ya que se le complica la compra de sus productos. Con el préstamo que solicita Maria comprara cuadernos, plumas, peluches, papeles de regalo etc. espera poder continuar con el negocio por mucho tiempo mas y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: Maria has a bazaar located in her home in the suburb of Guayaquil.  She is 57 years old and started her business 10 years ago with a gift of $80 from her son, which in those days was a lot of money.  She started making friends to acquire customers and then slowly started to organize her bazaar. First she bought some windows, and later she bought other products to see if they were in demand.  She has been in business since that time.  She is open very early in the morning and closes at 10 p.m.  Her biggest problem is when she gets sick because it complicates the purchase of her products.  Maria will buy notebooks, pens, stuffed animals, gift wrap, etc., with the loan.  She hopes to be able to continue on for a long time and to keep growing the business.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, stuffed animals and gift wrap.

loans.name: Gema Patricia

texts.es: Gema comenzó la venta de ropa hace 7 años por una amiga quien se dedicaba a esto y le dijo que dejaba buenas ganancias. Adicional a eso en la compañía que trabaja le daban premios cuando llegaba a la meta de ventas, le pareció interesante y decidió empezar este negocio. Lo realiza sola recorriendo diversos sectores de la ciudad llevando consigo los productos y los catálogos. Tiene a la venta perfumes, ropa, crema, ropa unisex los cuales vende por unidad. Gema nos comenta que los sectores son peligrosos pero cuando realiza la cobranza va acompañada de su esposo. Su esposo Jacinto se dedica a la venta de legumbres y hortalizas recorriendo todo Portoviejo. Tienen un hijo de 2 años de edad quien se queda en el maternal. El crédito que está solicitando Gema es para comprar arena, cemento y ladrillo que lo empleara en mejorar su vivienda para darle un mejor hogar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Gema started selling clothing 7 years ago because a friend was doing it and told her that she made good money. In addition, in the company where she works they give prizes when you met your sales goals, which seemed interesting so she decided to start this business. She works alone, going out to different parts of the city taking her products and catalogs. She sells perfume, clothing, lotion, and unisex clothing which she sells individually. 

Gema tells us that the neighborhoods are dangerous but when she collects payment her husband accompanies her. Her spouse, Jacinto, sells beans and vegetables all over Portoviejo. They have a two-year-old son who goes to daycare. 

This loan will be used to buy sand, cement and bricks to improve their home so their son has a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old and single. He supports two members of his family. He runs a motorcycle transport business (locally known as bodaboda) and he has been in this business for eight years. He earns a monthly income of 13,500 shillings.

This will be his first loan with KADET. He plans to use it for purchasing motorcycle spare parts and to carry out a service to improve the business. He also plans to use the anticipated profits to save and be able to buy another motorbike. 

He hopes to provide effective and efficient transport services and expand to motor vehicle services.

loans.use: To purchase motorcyle spare parts to improve his transport business.

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children to school. She takes care of one additional family member (her sister's child).  

Yudaya sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last two years. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. 

Yudaya is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she earns enough profit to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house and  the family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Tierra Blanca  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tierra Blanca está formado por 9 socias quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por ser de clima frió, por su situación geográfica que tienen varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza, es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta ciudad tiene una gran riqueza cultural y natural. Su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, son personas amables, gentiles quienes les ofrecen una buena hospitalidad a sus visitantes. Las socias laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permite solventar los gastos de sus hogares.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Eugenia, vive por el sector de la ciudadela Católica en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de  una niña de 8 años de edad que estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña María Eugenia es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de varios productos como electrodomésticos y ropa, vende recorriendo por las afueras de la ciudad y trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir comprando ropa y algunos electrodomésticos.

Su sueño es tener un local donde vender sus productos. 

La foto pequeña es de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Tierra Blanca comunal bank is comprised of nine members who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. This city is characterized by its cold climate due to its geographic location. There are various places to enjoy nature, and in 1999 it became a Cultural Heritage of Humanity site. The city has an abundance of cultural and natural attributes. Its people maintain the culture and traditions. They are kind, friendly people who offer the best hospitality to visitors.

The members work in different sectors, which allow them to pay their household expenses. One of the members of the group is María Eugenia. She lives near the Catholic citadel in Cuenca. She is a 34-year-old, single mother of an 8-year-old girl who studies at one of the city's schools. She does not have her own home, so she lives with her parents who share the household expenses with her.

María Eugenia is a merchant. She sells various products such as electrical appliances and clothes. She sells by traveling to the outskirts of the city. She works Monday through Saturday, without a fixed schedule.

This is her first loan with the communal bank, to which she was invited by a friend. She will invest the money from the loan into buying clothes and some electrical appliances. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her products. 

The small photo shows the three members who were unable to make it when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy clothes and some electrical appliances

loans.name: Jorge Fausto

texts.es: Jorge Fauto soltero de 57 años de edad  de la  localidad de Chinandega, tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa ambulante y al crédito actividad a la que se dedica hace 14 años, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación de forma ambulante, la inicio como una alternativa de trabajo , el financiamiento lo está solicitando para comprar mercadería para satisfacer su cliente como: camisas, pantalones, bolsos, short, ropa interior, zapatos entre otros
texts.en: Jorge Fauto is an unmarried 57-year-old from the town of Chinandega.  He is a traveling vendor in clothing sales, a trade he has been dedicated to for 14 years.  He runs his business from his home and on sales rounds.  He began the business as an alternative type of work.  He is requesting funding  to buy merchandise to satisfy his customers, including shirts, pants, bags, shorts, underwear, and shoes, among other things.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, bags, shorts, underwear, and shoes.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong was born in 1976. She has two children who are in secondary and elementary school. Her husband is a driver who can receive 3,000,000 VND per month.  Mrs. Huong owns a small restaurant mainly serving breakfast from which she can earn about 3,000,000 VND per month. She joined the credit program of SEDA in 2006 and appears to be a good customer as she often repays the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she needs a loan of 8,502,000 VND so that she can have more money to develop her restaurant.

loans.use: to develop her restaurant

loans.name: Benita De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Benita, solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir trabajando en la venta de tostadas y pasteles ella está motivada ya que le parece bien el servicio que se le brinda en la institución, se comprará plátanos verdes, aceite, yuca, condimentos y bolsas para preparar la venta.
Ella espera obtener buenos resultados de este préstamo ya que con el anterior logró aumentar sus ingresos, mejoró el servicio los clientes y su negocio se encuentra más sólido, la estabilidad económica de su familia también sea ido superando a través de las buenas ventas.
texts.en: Benita is requesting a new loan so that she can continue in her business selling tostadas and pies. She remains motivated because she believes that the service she provides is good. She will use her loan to buy plantains, oil, cassava, condiments and bags in order to prepare her sales. Benita hopes to obtain good results from this loan because she was successful in using her previous loan to improve her income. She improved her customer service and her business is now more solid. Her family's financial stability is also now improving as a result of her improved sales.

loans.use: to buy plantains, oil, cassava, condiments and bags

loans.name: Tania Del Rosario

texts.es:
Tania es una joven de 27 años de edad, de profesion secretaria, casada y madre de un hijo de un años. Tania tambien vende ropa nueva en tiempo libres y con sus compañeros, ayudandose con sus pagos personales, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien labora como contador.
Su objetivo es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, ampliando un cuarto para tener mas espacio para su hijo, comprando materiales en piedra,arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Tania is a 27-year-old young woman. She is a secretary and is married and the mother of a one-year-old boy. Tania also sells new clothing in her free time with her colleagues, which helps her to pay for personal expenses. She counts on support from her husband, who works as an accountant.

Her goal is to improve the infrastructure of her house by expanding one room to have more space for her son. She will purchase materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron and begin the work.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand a room.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en: Aloys is 35 years old. He is married with five children. Only two of his children attend school. His wife works as a farmer. He sells beans and sorghum. He has requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum to resell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to sell beans and sorghum to resell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is thirty-four years old and married with two children. He runs a pig rearing and poultry farm and he has been in this business for twelve years earning a monthly income of twenty-four thousand shillings.

This will be his second loan with KADET and he plans to use it for purchasing more pigs for the business. He anticipates an increase in returns and hopes to use the profits from the business to purchase more poultry for his farm and become a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs for the business.

loans.name: Ocuituco Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo continúan en la actividad que estaban desempeñando desde el préstamo anterior. La  señora Celia tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos: una niña que estudia la primaria y un niño que  estudia la secundaria. Celia vende cecina en las calles de su comunidad y solicitó su préstamo para comprar carne y preparar la cecina. Ella inició su negocio hace 10 años, su esposo prepara la cecina y ella sale a vender. Esta actividad económica es muy importante para Celia porque es de gran ayuda para cubrir los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos y para comprar los alimentos básicos para su hogar. Ella se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio, aun más porque ha ido mejorando con el tiempo. Como mujer emprendedora, enfrenta los desafíos de costos elevados en la carne y la competencia de otros establecimientos. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos vivan mejor, con menos carencias. 

Las integrantes del grupo (Elena, Monica, Celia y Ana Lilia) quieren enviar a Kiva y a Vision Fund el siguiente mensaje "Gracias por sus préstamos, es una ayuda que nos dan y se preocupan por ayudarnos a crecer los negocios".
texts.en: The members of this group are continuing in the activities that they were involved in when they received their last loan. Celia is 33 years old, is married and has 2 children: a girl in primary school and a boy in high school. Celia sells cecina (dried, salted beef) in the streets of her community and is seeking a loan in order to buy beef so that she can prepare the cecina. She started her business 10 years ago. Her husband prepares the cecina, and she goes out and sells it. This economic activity is very important for Celia because it plays a large role in helping to cover her children's school expenses and her basic household needs. She is proud to have her own business, even more so because it has been improving over the years. As an enterprising woman, she confronts the challenges of the high price of meat, as well as competition from other businesses. Her hopes and dreams are that her business grows and her children will have a better life with fewer worries. The members of this group (Elena, Monica, Celia y Ana Lilia) want to send to Kiva and to the Vision Fund the following message: "Thank you for your loans; it is very helpful that you make them available to us and care enough to help us grow our businesses."

loans.use: to buy beef to make cecina (dried, salted beef).

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio trabajo como promotor para una fundacion y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien trabaja como docente en un centro escolar los dos junto han levantado su casa y cada vez mas han ido logrando su meta tener su casa propia. 
con este financiamiento compraran parte de materiales de construcion como: cemento, arena, ceramica, puertas, persianas ademas pagaran mano de obra. ellos se encuentran contentos por la oportunidad que Afodenic les esta brendando con este credito.
texts.en:
Silvio works as a promoter for a foundation and has support from his wife who works as a teacher in a school. Together the two of them have built a house and every time they have been able to get closer to their goal of having their own home.

They will use part of this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, tiles, doors and shutters and in addition they will pay for labor. They are happy to have the opportunity that AFODENIC is giving them with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase cement, tiles, doors and shutters.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 25-year-old single businessman. He has been operating a taxi transport business and dairy farming as a secondary business for the past two years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to cater to his basic needs. 
He is applying for his first loan term with KADET, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Antony will use the loan to buy a dairy cow and feeds. He will also service the pickup. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will save and continue with his education. 
He hopes to open a barber shop and a salon shop in Nairobi.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and feeds.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is forty-two years old and married with three children. She runs a hotel business and she has been in this business for fifteen years, earning a monthly income of seventy thousand shillings.

This will be her first loan with KADET and she plans to use it for purchasing more stock of rice, sugar and gas for fuel. She intends to use the profit from the business to educate her children and she hopes to have enough to meet the basic needs of her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of rice, sugar and gas for fuel

loans.name: Ingrid Del Carmen

texts.es: Ingrid a sus 21 años es una mujer emprendedora, esto lo demuestra por que en tan corta edad mantiene una tienda muy surtida. Vive en Duran, no está casada y no tiene hijos por el momento ya que se encuentra enfocada en su negocio. La tienda la inicio cuando tenia 18 años luego de terminar la secundaria, nos comenta que quería ganar dinero para ayudar en su hogar y como en el sector no había tienda decidió empezar por ahí. Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo recibido y a la institución que le abrió las puertas confiando en ella brindándole su primer crédito. Por ese motivo trabaja día a día desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche vendiendo productos de mayor necesidad como arroz, azúcar, condimentos, snack, colas etc. espera poder aumentar las ventas para cubrir todas sus obligaciones y ayudar a su familia como lo hace siempre.
texts.en:
Ingrid is an enterprising woman at the age of 21.  This is demonstrated by the fact that even at her young age she is able to maintain a well stocked shop. She lives in Duran and is single with no children; she is currently focused on her business.  She opened the store when she was 18 after finishing high school.  She wanted to earn money to help in her home.  Since there was no store in her area, she decided to start one there.

She is grateful to her parents for the help she has received and to Kiva partner Banco D-MIRO S.A., who opened the doors to her, having faith in her and offering her her first loan.  For this reason she works every day from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. selling staples such as rice, sugar, condiments, snacks, soft drinks, etc.  She hopes to be able to increase her sales to cover all of her expenses and to help her family as always.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, condiments, snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 39 years old. She has five children, four of whom attend school. She has been selling beans and sorghum for the past eight years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans and sorghum to resell. With the profits, she will build on a plot of land that she has bought.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to resell.

loans.name: Fredys Arsenio

texts.es:
Fredys, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo debido a la necesidad de seguir creciendo en su granja, se comprará un par de cerdos para engordar los y también alimento ya que considera que su gran tiene demanda por lo mismo quiere mantener siempre un buen número de cerdos, esperando a futuro realizar buenas ventas de la cual pueda obtener ganancias.
El préstamo anterior le permitió a Fredys, crecer con cerdos y poder seguir realizando su trabajo con el cual ha logrado mantener a su familia en este periodo y poderle ofrecer una mayor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Fredys has decided to apply for a new loan because he needs to continue growing his farm.  He will buy a pair of pigs to fatten.  He believes that he has a good demand for these animals and would like to maintain a good number of pigs because he would like to make good sales in the future which will make him good profits.

Fredys used his previous loan to grow his number of pigs and continue working in his business.  He has managed to support his family over this period and has been able to provide them with better financial solvency.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un préstamo porque tienen la intención de invertir en el negocio nuevamente comprándose ropa para niños trajecitos, ropa interior también juguetes y sombrillas, también se comprará ropa para adultos como blusa, faldas entre otras prendas de vestir que son necesarias para el negocio.
Ella manifiesta que decreto anterior le ayudó a mejorar sus ventas e incrementar la mercadería en el negocio sus clientes se ha mantenido en la demanda y esto le ayudaba ella para obtener mejores ganancias e invertirlas en su situación familiar.
texts.en:
María is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  She will buy children's clothing, outfits, underwear, toys and umbrellas.  She will also buy adults' clothing such as blouses, skirts and other items that she needs for her business.

María says that her previous loan helped her to improve her sales and increase her merchandise.  Her customers have maintained their level of demand and this has helped her to make more profits and invest in her family.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, underwear, toys and umbrellas

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 49-year-old mixed-crop farmer. She is married to Ignatio, who is also a farmer, and they are blessed with four children. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Anastasia will use the loan to purchase water pipes for her farm, as well as seedlings and fertilizer. With the anticipated profit from the business she hopes to start fish-farming activities. 

She hopes to educate her children up to university level and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes, seedlings, and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Natalia Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora Natalia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la Cultura y Tradiciones.

La Señora. Natalia tiene 21 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una niña de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora en una panadería, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Natalia nos comenta que se encuentra gozando de muy buena salud al igual que todos los miembros de su familia. Ella trabaja hace 4 meses en una papelería de lunes a viernes desde las 8 hasta las 9 de la noche,  pero para esto tuvo que dejar su trabajo anterior que era auxiliar de enfermería. También hace 2 años los fines de semana se dedica al comercio vendiendo varios productos como cobijas, sabanas, edredones, etc. Estas actividades las realiza para mejorar la economía de su hogar y sacar  adelante a su familia.

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando mercadería de la cual le dejo buenas ganancias, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando mas cobijas para continuar con su negocio. El banco comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que existe entre todos. 

Su sueño es tener un local propio para vende sus productos.
texts.en:
Natalia is a member of the 'Mujeres Triunfadoras' community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which is surrounded by four rivers.  These rivers give the city its name of 'Santa Ana of the Four Rivers'.  Since 1999, this city has been a World Heritage Center.  The locals are kind and preserve their culture and traditions.

Natalia is 21 years old, married, and has a 2-year-old daughter.  Her husband works in a bakery.  They do not own their own home but live in rental accommodation.

Natalia tells us that she is in very good health, as are the other members of her family.  For the past four months, she has been working in a stationery store from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 9.00pm.  She had to leave her previous job as a nursing assistant.  For the past two years, she has been selling items such as blankets, sheets, comforters, etc. on weekends.  Natalia carries out these businesses in order to improve her household finances and provide for her family.

Natalia invested her previous loan in buying merchandise.  This made her good profits.  She will invest her new loan in buying more blankets so that she can continue in her business.  She likes her community bank for the sense of belonging it provides.  Her dream is to own her own premises from which to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy blankets

loans.name: Sare Yoba Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 16 Mai 2011 au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Composé de  femmes très actives dans les activités génératrices de revenu, elles vivent toutes dans la même localité. Elles pratiquent dans leur majorité le petit commerce et la transformation. 

Madame Awa, (assise à droite dans la deuxième rangée), est vendeuse d’huile de palm et de bottes de balaies de tige d’huile de palme. C’est ainsi pour un bidon de 20 litres d’huile de palme acheté à 13 000 FCFA et une Botte de 100 kilogramme à 21 000 FCFA et des frais de transport environ de 5 000 FCFA, elle engendre un chiffre d’affaire respectivement de 26 000 et 60 000 FCFA.

Les bénéfices servent d’une part à aider son mari dans la gestion de la maison et d’autre part ses enfants et petits enfants.
texts.en:
This group was formed on May 16, 2011 at the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. Its members are women who all live in the same neighborhood and who work hard at their income-generating activities. For the most part, they work in small trade and processing.

Mrs. Awa (sitting on the right in the second row) sells palm oil and broom heads made from palm tree stems. One 20-liter jug of palm oil at 13,000 CFAF and one 100 kg bale of palm tree stems at 21,000 CFAF, and the transportation cost of 5,000 CFAF, will bring in sales reaching 26,000 and 60,000 CFAF respectively. 

She will use her profits to help her husband in managing the household and to provide for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and bales of palm tree stems for resale.

loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
Moleni, who in her early 40s, is married with five children; three are grown up and two are still at school. She has had a business selling bedsheets and tablecloths for three years now. She works from 9:00 am to 4:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to restock her business and for household expenses, and she has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy a roll of material for making more bedsheets and tablecloths to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Topi, which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a roll of material for making more bedsheets and tablecloths to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria, Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere invertir en la pupuseria, pues este negocio ha mejorado la demanda de los clientes, ella comprará con los fondos prestados aceite, tomates, chicharrón, maíz, condimentos, que le darán el aporte necesario para su producción. 
 
El efecto tuvo el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que con la inversión ha mantenido un buen nivel en las ventas, tambien sus ingresos, esto cambiado de alguna forma las circunstancias familiares, desde la última vez que sacó un préstamo a través de Kiva, ya que están más solventes.
texts.en:
Maria is requesting a new loan because she would like to invest in her pupusa restaurant.  She has improved her customer demand and will use her new loan to buy oil, tomatoes, pork, corn and condiments.  These products will give her the support she needs to produce her food.

Maria's previous loan had a positive result.  She made the most of her investment and was able to maintain a good sales level.  Her income changed the conditions in which her family lives.  Since she took out her previous Kiva loan, her family have been more financially solvent.

loans.use: to buy oil, tomatoes, pork, corn and condiments

loans.name: Juana Trinidad

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Cerezos  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Fuerza Y Valor esta es una zona urbana marginal muy poblada y trabajadora.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Juana, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene diez hijos, 9 mayores de edad y el último tiene 17 años, dos de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy luchadora que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar puso un pequeño negocio  en su casa, allí vende gas de uso domestico, colas, bidones de agua, caramelos, entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde la mañana hasta tarde en la noche ya que nos cuenta que a veces de tarde llegan sus clientes porque necesitan un cilindro de gas y ella tiene que atenderlos ya que esa su mejor manera de mantenerlos contentos y que siempre le compren a ella, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar gas, colas, aguas,caramelos entre otras cosas que vende en su local. Lleva un año  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y le ayudan mucho.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: In the citadel, Los Cerezos , a densely populated urban and hard-working area of the city of Portoviejo, the  Banco Comunal Fuerza Y Valor meets every two weeks.  Mrs. Jane, who is 58 years old and married, lives here.  She and her husband, a businessman, have ten children, 9 adults and a 17 year old, who is the youngest; two still live at home. Our friend, who struggles, put a small business at home to help with household expenses; she sells gas for domestic use, glues, water containers, candy, among other things. She works every day from morning until late at night since she tells us that sometimes customers come later because they need a gas cylinder and she has to serve them and it is best to keep them happy because they always buy from her.  She has had the business for more than 10 years and it is doing quite well. This loan is going to use to buy gas, glue, water, candy and other things to sell in her shop.  It is one year in the community bank and she likes it because the loans are fast and very helpful. Her dream is to move ahead and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy gas, glue, water, candy, etc...

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana vive en Duran con sus hijos, a sus 35 años es madre soltera ya que se separo del padre de sus hijos. Ana es manicurista trabajo que viene desempeñando hace 3 años atrás y le va muy bien. Nos comenta que le gusta mucho por lo que realizo varios cursos para aprender diseño y cuidado de las manos y pies. El trabajo lo realiza sola cuando la llaman sus clientes, en su casa también tiene un letrero en el que ofrece los servicios pero nos comenta que más la llaman. Como es madre soltera también se ayuda vendiendo prendas de vestir así aprovecha las visita que realiza a sus clientes y vende la ropa. Ana también nos indica que si alguien le desea comprar los productos para el cuidado de sus manos los vende sin problemas. Con el crédito que solicita comprara esmalte, acetona, algodón, exfoliantes, cremas y ropa para brindar un mejor servicio. Su meta próxima es arreglar su casa, te deseamos éxito Ana.
texts.en:
Ana lives in Duran with her children. At 35 years old, she is a single mother since she separated from her children’s father. Ana is a manicurist, a job she has been doing for three years and it is going well. She tells us that she enjoys her work a great deal and that she took several courses to learn design and how to care for hands and feet.

Ana does her work only when called by her customers. She also has a sign on her house which offers her services, however she notes that most of her work comes from the calls she receives. As a single mother she also earns income by selling clothing items, taking advantage of the visits she makes to clients: she not only gives them manicures but also sells clothes. Moreover, Ana says if someone just wants to buy hand care products from her, she will sell to them without any problem.

With the loan she is requesting, she will buy nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton, exfoliators, creams and clothing so that she can provide a better service. Her next goal is to fix up her house. We wish you luck, Ana.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail polish remover, cotton, exfoliators and creams.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and one is in school. She takes care of one additional family member (her brother’s daughter). 

Mary sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She also sells airtime as her other source of income. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last eight years. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas.  She generates additional income from rental rooms and selling airtime. 

Mary's major business challenges are transportation, thieves, and seasonality. She is aspiring of buying a delivery van to ease transportation and also would like to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Jose Agapito

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz y tambien atiende la ganadería, vive con su esposa y tienen tres hijos de 20, 22, 30 años de edad,  trabaja con dos de ellos en los cultivos, viven en casa propia, desde joven José está realizando cultivos, pues su padre le enseño, .
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de 5 sacos de abono, con esto espera tener lo necesario para aplicárselo al cultivo, y recibir una buena cosecha de sus tierras, el préstamo le ayudara para poder realizar su trabajo.
La aspiración de José es tener con su familia lo necesario, seguir trabajando al lado de sus hijos, cubriendo todas las necesidades.
texts.en:
José's business is farming.  He grows corn and also raises livestock.  He lives with his wife and has three children who are 20, 22 and 30 years old.  He works with two of his children on the farm.  They live in their own home.  José has been growing crops since his father taught him how.

José is requesting a loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer.  He hopes that this will provide him with what he needs for sowing his crops.  He hopes to obtain a good harvest from his land.  This loan will help him to carry out his work.

José's goal is to provide his family with what they need.  He hopes to continue working together with his children and to cover all their needs.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Dioselina Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Dioselina es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de  Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la Cultura y Tradiciones.

Doña Dioselina tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 18, 13 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y vive independiente, su segundo hijo  estudia en el colegio y su ultimo  hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Dioselina se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace 11 años, trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo y cuando tiene tiempo también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal en su segundo crédito y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando más mariscos.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dioselina is a member of the Mujeres Triunfadoras communal bank.  She lives in Cuenca, a city that is bathed by 4 rivers which give it the name of Santa Ana de los 4 Rios (Santa Ana of the 4 Rivers) and it has been a World Heritage Site since 1999.  Its people are friendly and gentile and they maintain the culture and traditions.

Dioselina, 41, is married and has 3 children: 18, 13 and 7.  Her oldest son works and lives on his own, her second son is in middle school and her youngest son is in a little school in the city.  Her husband is a salesman.  They don’t have their own house so they live in a rented one.

Dioselina has sold shellfish for the last 11 years.  She works everyday but not on a regular schedule and when she has time, she sells cosmetics.

This is her second loan with the communal bank and she will use the new financing to buy more shellfish.

Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy shellfish

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is twenty-four years old and married with one child aged two years. He runs a motorbike transport business and a retail shop business. These businesses have been running for two years, earning him a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings. 

This will be his first loan with KADET and he plans to use it to purchase another motorbike for business growth and use the profits from the business to save and add more stock to his retail shop.

He hopes to own at least three motorbikes and have a comfortable life in future.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike  for business growth

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is thirty-two years old and married to Beth. He runs a food kiosk, a business he has run for eight years.  He earns a monthly income of ten thousand shillings.

This will be his second loan with KADET and he plans to use it to purchase foodstuffs like flour, rice, sugar, and others. He plans to use the anticipated profit to start and grow a pig-rearing business. 

He hopes to be able to build a residential house and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as flour, rice, sugar, and others.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married and has two children.  He practices livestock farming to earn a living.  He has been in the business for four years. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business and employ people.  He has requested 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a pig.

loans.use: To buy a pig

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (2 relatives). She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She also rears poultry to get additional income. She works seven days a week. 

Justine has been in this business for the last seven years. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation of used clothes, ever increasing prices of used clothes, and seasonality. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow into wholesale basis and also hopes to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the  family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Bathseba

texts.en:
Bathseba is a mother of four children with three still of school-going age. She is aged forty-eight and has been in farming for six solid years in her rural home in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya. Her farm is run with the help of one farmhand and it produces mainly bananas, maize, cabbages and  French peas.

Bathseba has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She wants to venture into dairy farming to meet her family's daily milk requirement as well as earn income to meet other needs. She also plans to start a cereal-processing business within the local market by buying a milling machine in future.

Bathseba says animal diseases have been the main challenge to farming, coupled with natural calamities such as hailstorms.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto estado civil soltero de 43 años de edad, tiene por actividad económica la venta de medicamento naturistas, el negocio lo tiene ubicado  en su casa y ambulante , en la actualidad  ha incrementado sus utilidades y clienta gracia al apoyo que fundación le ha brindado tiene más de 7 años en su negocio, por lo que se siente muy independiente al obtener este medio de ingreso., sus clientes saben que el precio de sus medicamentos son muy favorables. Con este crédito el comprara vitaminas, suplementos, pastillas, pomadas, inyecciones entre otros productos que le solicitan a base de medicina natural como la sábila.
texts.en: Juan Alberto is single, 43 years old, and sells natural medicine for a living. His business is located in his own home. Recently he has added more utilities and his clientele has grown thanks to the loan the foundation offered him. He has been in this business for 7 years and feels very independent running it. His clients know that he offers reasonable prices. He will use this loan to buy vitamins, supplements, pills, injections, and other products with natural properties such as aloe vera.

loans.use: buy vitamins, supplements, pills, injections, and other products with natural properties such as aloe vera.

loans.name: G.s. El Buen Corazon Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario El Buen Corazón está conformado por Noelia, José Alberto y Lesbia.  Noelia tiene su negocio que es la venta de ropa, desde hace más de 3  años que tiene esta actividad, que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado obtener. Es una mujer muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan con las diferentes prendas. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior entre otras.
texts.en:
The solidarity group El Buen Corazón [The Good Heart] consists of Noelia, José Alberto and Lesbia. 

Noelia has a business selling clothing, and has been doing this activity for more than 3 years, and it has been obtained through great sacrifice. She is a very responsible woman and always mindful of what her customers are requesting in different outfits. She is asking for this credit in order to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear and other items.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, underwear, and other items

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Graciela ya tiene 6 años dedicándose a la alta costura pues desde que su marido falleció ha tenido que salir adelante sola, es una persona responsable y muy activa  que siempre busca la manera de mejorar, necesita que se le apoye para comprar materia prima como telas de diferentes tonos y texturas, listones, botones, agujas  y así poder seguir adelante con su negocio y con ello aumentar su clientela.
texts.en: Sra. Graciela has spent six years dedicated to high fashion. Since her husband passed away she has had to move ahead alone. She is a responsible and very active person who is always looking for ways to improve. She needs support in order to purchase basic materials such as different shades and textures of fabrics, ribbons, buttons and needles. Thus she will be able to continue succeeding in her business and expanding her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Nestor Julio

texts.es:
Néstor tiene 59 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su madre en un caserío del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Piura y ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se caracteriza por la producción de frutas como mango y limón y también porque la mayor parte de sus pobladores tienen una calidad de vida bastante precaria.

Se dedica a la agricultura para ganarse la vida, cuenta con una pequeña parcela de cultivo donde suele sembrar limón, el cosecha estos productos y los ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras que se encuentran ubicadas en la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente cuenta con ganado ovino, el cual cría para su posterior venta en el mercado de su distrito. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el se encarga de salir adelante y brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida.

Néstor desea brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos para asegurarse una buena producción de los mismos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de de fertilizantes para su cultivo y alimento para sus ovejas.

Anteriormente ha tenido un préstamo financiado por Kiva y le fue muy bien, el se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que colaboraron con el en ese entonces y agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con el ahora.
texts.en:
Néstor is 59 years old.  He is single and lives together with his mother in a small village in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.  This area is known for its fruit production (mangos and lemons) and for the fact that most of its residents enjoy a fairly precarious quality of life.

Néstor farms in order to earn a living.  He has a small plot of land where he grows lemons.  He harvest these and sells them to processing plants in his area.  He also has sheep which he raises and then sells in the market in his district.  He uses the income that he makes from this business to get ahead in life and provide his mother with a better quality of life.

Néstor would like to maintain his crops and enjoy a good production.  He has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to invest in buying fertilizers for his crops and feed for his sheep.  

Néstor's previous Kiva loan had positive results.  For this reason, he is grateful to the people who are cooperating in providing his loan.  He thanks his lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop and to buy feed for his sheep

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El Sr Miguel tiene 2 hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar y el trabaja como mesero en un restaurante de la ciudad, actualmente esta pagando su casa por lo tanto se le descuenta de su pago. Quiere que sus hijos sigan estudiando por lo que necesita se le apoye para brindarles la oportunidad de seguir estudiando para forjarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Miguel has two children.  His wife is in charge of the home and he works as a waiter at a restaurant in the city.  He is currently paying for his house, and his payments are being deducted from his paycheck.  He wants his children to continue with their studies, so he needs support which will allow them opportunities to continue to study and thereby forge a better future for themselves.

loans.use: pay for school fees.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 43 years old, married and has four children.  He runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  He has been in the business for two years.  He has employed three people in the business.  He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business and employ more people.  He has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy chairs and tables for his cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for his cafeteria

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en: Evanson used his loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy dairy cows.  With the additional cows in his farm, he was able to increase milk production in his farm hence made more profits.  He hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  He has now requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to repair his motorbike.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis casado, de treinta y tres años de edad, con tres hijos menores, tiene por actividad económica prestar servicio de transporte colectivo, experiencia que tiene desde hace cinco años, inicio este negocio con una liquidación de trabajo de la empresa donde prestaba servicio con la cual compro la primera unidad de transporte con el tiempo y las ganancias que le genero compro  la segundad unidad de trasporte las cuales el administra, en la actualidad los prestamos lo solicita para darle el debido mantenimiento a sus unidades ya que de eso depende par prestar las condición y servicio necesario a los usuarios de los cuales genera sus ingresos ,los sueños y metas en un futuro es terminar de construir su casa de habitación para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José Luis is 33 years old, married, and has three young children. He has a business providing transportation services as a part of a collective (a fleet of vehicles that travel pre-determined routes for a set fare). José Luis has five years of experience. He started this business using the severance pay from the job at the company where he worked. The money went toward the purchase of his first vehicle. Over time and with the revenue he generated, José Luis bought a second vehicle that he now manages.

At the moment, he is requesting a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicles. He depends on these vehicles being serviced and in good condition so that they can continue to generate income. His dreams and goals for the future include finishing the construction of his house so that he will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Aida Yanina

texts.es:
La Señora. Aída es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos los que le dan el nombre de Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la Cultura y Tradiciones.

Doña Aída tiene 31 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 12 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión pintor, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Aída nos comenta que se encuentra con muy buena salud al igual que todos los miembros de su familia. Nuestra socia se dedica al comercio desde hace 8 años, vende cosméticos de varias marcas. También trabaja en el negocio de comida que tiene su mamá. 

El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando varios víveres para el negocio de comida y esto le dejo algo de ganancia, está pidiendo un nuevo crédito pero esta vez para comprar cosméticos y así tener más variedad  de productos. La banca comunal le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos sin muchos trámites y papeleos ayudándoles a la inversión en sus negocios.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Aída is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Triunfadoras [Triumphant Women]. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city which is bathed by 4 rivers that have given Cuenca the name of Santa Ana of the Four Rivers, and from 1999 has been a World Heritage Site. The people are friendly, gentle, and still maintain culture and traditions.

Aída is 31 years old, married and from this relationship has conceived 3 children who are 14, 12, and 2 years old. Her first two children study at a school in the city. Her husband is a painter by profession. They live in their own house.

Aída tells us that she and the members of her family are all in good health. Our borrower has been in business for 8 years, selling various brands of cosmetics. She also works in the food business with her mother.

The money from her previous loan was used to buy various supplies for the food business and this left her some earnings. She is asking for a new loan now to buy cosmetics and thus have more variety of products. She likes the communal bank because loans are granted quickly without red tape and paperwork which helps them to invest in their businesses. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Zhidmad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhidmad está formado por 8 socias quienes viven en la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeado de montañas las mismas que le dan el toque pintoresco en donde se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente aun mantienen las tradiciones de sus pueblos como nuestras socias quienes laboran en la cría de animales, en la agricultura que muchas veces es solo para el consumo de su hogar, muchos diariamente laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas, son personas amables, gentiles, que luchan el día a día para mejorar su estabilidad económica.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Ermelinda, tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 14, 12, 8 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo pasa en casa ayudando en los quehaceres del hogar y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Rosa Ermelinda se dedica a la cría vacas, borregos, cerdos, pollos y cuyes. También trabaja como empleada domestica desde  hace 17 años pero solo días específicos, hace 14 años también se dedica a elaborar guaipe y esta actividad la realiza sin horario y de domingo a domingo.
 
Se encuentra varios años en el banco comunal siendo socia fundadora de su banquito, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir comprando pollos y tela para la realización de su guaipe.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The 'Zhidmad' community bank has eight members who all live in Zhidmad parish, Cuenca.  This city is surrounded by mountains which give it a picturesque setting where people can enjoy nature.  The locals maintain the traditions of their ancestors.  Our members raise livestock and farm. They often do this only for their families' own consumption.
