Many people also go to work in the city every day.  They are kind people who work hard every day in order to improve their financial stability.

One of the members of this group is Rosa Ermelinda.  She is 34 years old and a single mother of four children who are 14, 12, 8 and 6 years old.  Her eldest son helps her with the housework and her three younger children attend a local school.  They own their own home.

Rosa Ermelinda raises cows, lambs, pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.  She has also been working as a domestic for 17 years but she only works certain days.  She has also been making traditional cloths for 14 years.  She works irregular hours, from Sunday to Sunday.

Rosa Ermelinda has been a member of her community bank for a number of years.  She is a founding member.  She will invest her loan money in buying chickens and also fabric for making her cloths. 

Rosa Ermelinda's goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and fabric

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La Sra. Teodora trabaja como intendente en una Escuela Primaria del cual ya tiene 6 años laborando, su esposo trabaja en una constructora como maquinista. Ellos son personas  serias y trabajadoras necesitan solventar los gastos médicos de su hijo del cual se encuentra enfermo pero no le encuentran que es lo que tiene, por lo cual se le harán unos estudios generales y dependiendo de ellos se harán otros estudios.
texts.en: Teodora works as an administrator at an elementary school.  She has worked there for 6 years.  Her husband works as a machine operator for a construction company.  They are serious and hardworking people who need to cover the medical expenses for their child, who is sick.  They don't know what he has, so they will be doing some general tests, and depending on the outcome of these, they will do some other tests.

loans.use: to pay for medical tests for her child

loans.name: Elkana

texts.en:
Elkana has been in the farming business for  eight straight years in his rural home in Kisii where he lives with his wife and two children, aged eight and two years. His farm currently produces maize which goes to the local market.

Elkana has requested a loan of 57,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He wants to venture into dairy farming to spread his farming risk. He believes improved farming will help him adequately meet family basic needs like food and clothing for his children.

Elkana says the greatest challenge comes from poor road networks. He is however glad Juhudi Kilimo has made loans accessible to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and both her children  go to school. She does not take care of additional family members.

She operates a retail shop that she rents. She operates her business on retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this  business for the last two years.

Janet has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, flour, soap, and cooking oil. Her major business challenges are lack of enough capital and transportation. Her dream is to educate her children to university and also to own a wholesale business. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, flour, soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all her children go to school. She does take care of other additional family members (her little sister and brother). She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She also sells soft drinks from home so as to get additional income. She works seven days a week. 

Jesca has been in business for the last four years. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are increasing prices of clothes and seasonality. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger so that she can start importing used clothes.

Jesca lives in a rented house and  the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is married and has a nine-year-old child.  She runs a retail shop to earn a living.  She has been in the business for three years.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ people.  She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy juice, sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: To buy juice, sugar and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Mario Rene

texts.es:
Mario, solicita un nuevo préstamo ya que quiere continuar invirtiendo en el negocio, pues considera que entre más variedad de productos ofrezca así será la demanda por parte de sus clientes, invertirá este préstamo en la compra de boquitas, arroz, frijol, aceite, pastas, y otros productos no perecederos que son necesarios en los hogares de sus clientes, él considera que este préstamo le seguirá dando la oportunidad superarse en su zona.
El préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo al negocio y también su vivienda ya que le realizó algunas mejoras, su familia está en mejores condiciones ya que ahora tienen un lugar más seguro.
texts.en: Mario is requesting a new loan to continue investing in his business because he believes that if he has a larger variety of products he will be able to better satisfy his clients. He will use the loan to buy snacks, rice, beans, oil, pastas, and other products that are necessary for the household. He knows this loan will continue allowing him to improve his business. His last loan had a positive impact on his business and home since he was able to make some repairs allowing his family to live in better and safer living conditions.

loans.use: buy snacks, rice, beans, oil, pastas, and other products that are necessary for the household

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a mother of one child aged thirteen and has been in active farming for five years. She reiterates that farming, and more specifically tea, is her family's only source of livelihood. She lives with her family in their rural home in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya.

Teresa has requested a loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She wants to diversify her farming by venturing into dairy farming. She plans to own at least three dairy cows and start a cereals retail business. She reiterates that she will use the income majorly to send her only child to school.

Teresa says poor road networks remain a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosa Marisol

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande. La zona es conocida por su producción de mango y limón. El caserío donde vive solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza de ovejas, aves de corral y cerdos, los engorda y luego comercializa en el mercado local, cuenta con mas de cinco años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, por lo que conoce muy bien el mercado. Su conviviente es agricultor y ella lo apoya en las actividades que realice.

Rosa de encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que desea utilizar en la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales, así como en la compra de mas animales para ampliar su negocio, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo como comerciante y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ella es una mujer abnegada y bastante entregada a su familia, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucho cariño y estima. Rosa agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán a lograr su objetivo a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 36-year-old mother who lives together with her husband and three children in a small village in the rural part of Tambogrande district.  This area is known for its mango and lemon production.  The only basic service Rosa's village receives is electricity.

Rosa's business is raising sheep, farmyard birds and pigs.  She fattens the animals and then sells them in the local market.  She has been in this business for more than five years and so has a good knowledge of the market.  Rosa's husband is a farmer and she supports him in his work.

Rosa is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles as she would like to buy nutritionally-balanced feed with which to fatten her animals.  She would also like to buy additional animals in order to expand her business.  This investment will enable her to continue growing as a businesswoman and improve her quality of life.

Rosa is a selfless woman who is committed to her family.  Those who know her hold her in great esteem.  She is grateful to the people who will help her to achieve her goals through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy animals and nutritionally-balanced feed in order to expand her business

loans.name: Jose De Dios

texts.es: El Sr. José es casado y con dos hijos pequeños su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar y cuidado de sus hijos, él trabaja como operador en una empresa de mensajería, es una persona  honesta y trabajadora, él necesita proteger su vivienda con una pared por el problema de inseguridad tan grande que se vive en la actualidad  y así brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Joseph is married with two young children.  His wife is engaged in housework and childcare and he works as an operator for a courier company.  He is an honest and hardworking person who needs to protect his home with a wall because of the big security problem that currently exists, thus providing greater security for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a wall

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for ten years.  

She also rears pigs to earn extra income. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ people. She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 26 years old, married, and has a five-year-old child.  She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ people in the future.  She has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy cooking fat, sugar, and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, sugar, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard has continued with his transport business. He has witnessed growth both in the catering business and in his ability to pay for his children’s school fees from the first loan for which he had applied. 

Despite the challenge of fluctuating fuel prices, Bernard has been able to save and is now applying for a loan of 41,900 KES to add to his savings to purchase a second motorcycle. He believes the business will grow and help him fulfill his dream of purchasing a pick-up van for the transportation of goods.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early thirties, is married and has two children who go to school.  

She has two businesses, selling charcoal and local chicken.  She has had these businesses for two years now.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan for buying more sacks of charcoal and more local chicken to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to start selling rice at wholesale price.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Karibu View", which has a total of twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and more local chicken to resell.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is the mother of six children, two of whom are still schooling. She has been in farming for five years and currently produces and sells maize, beans, and bananas for the local market.

Monicah has requested a loan of 20,800 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the venture into dairy farming will provide milk for the family. She adds the income will help her in educating the two children.

Monicah says animal diseases remain the major challenge.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosadina

texts.es:
Rosadina es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos.  Reside en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola ubicada a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.  Rosadina y su familia son muy estimados por sus vecinos, quienes han dado buenas referencias personales.

Rosadina se dedica a la venta de tamales (plato típico de algunas regiones de Sudamérica preparado en base a una pasta de maíz rellena de carne, verduras y otras especias) desde hace 4 años.  Este producto es bastante consumido por los pobladores de la zona y también es bastante estimado a nivel nacional.  Por su amabilidad y buena atención a sus clientes es muy estimada y siempre la buscan para comprar sus productos. Con los ingresos que percibe ayud a su esposo a solventar los gastos de su familia.

Rosadina desea adquirir insumos para aumentar su producción y satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y ha obtenido muy buenos resultados de su inversión por lo que se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella en aquella oportunidad. Rosadina también agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con ella en este préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosadine is a 46-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three children. She resides in the district of Oyotún, an agricultural area located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque Department. Rosadina and her family are highly esteemed by their neighbors who have given them good personal references.

Rosadina has been selling tamales (a typical dish in some regions of South America, made of corn pasta stuffed with meat, vegetables and spices) for four years. This dish is widely consumed by the inhabitants of the area and is also greatly esteemed at the national level. Because of her pleasant demeanor and good customer service, Rosadina is very well regarded and sought after by customers wanting to buy her products. She uses her earnings to help her husband defray household expenses.

Rosadina wants to acquire supplies to expand her production and meet the demand that she currently has. Consequently she has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of S/. 1,000, which will help her meet her objectives.

She has already had a loan through Kiva and had very good results from that investment and is very grateful to the people who collaborated with her in that opportunity. Similarly, Rosadina thanks in advance those lenders who will collaborate with her on this loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials to expand her business selling tamales.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is aged 26. He has been farming for two successive years producing bananas and cabbages and selling them to the local market.

Daniel has requested a loan of 26,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to grow his dairy business to three dairy cows within 5 years and improve his farming income to meet his family's basic needs.

Daniel says animal and crop diseases remain the major challenges.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nelson Fabricio

texts.es:
Nelson, solicita un nuevo préstamo para realizar la siembra de maíz ya que está iniciando una nueva temporada de cultivo y por su parte preparará el terreno en estas fechas, comprará semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas, que son necesarios para poder iniciar el proceso.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le dio la oportunidad de recibir una buena inversion en su granja, obteniendo más utilidades ya que de esta misma logró realizar ventas para cubrir la alimentación en su familia, su condición económica es estable y espera poco a poco ir creciendo.
texts.en:
Nelson is requesting a new loan to plant corn, which is starting a new season.  He will do his part to prepare the land now with fertilizer, herbicides and buy the seed, which are the needed to start the process.

He believes that the previous loan gave him the opportunity to make a good investment in his farm, earning him more profits since he had more sales and because of this, he was able to provide food for his family.  His earnings are stable and he hopes to grow them bit by bit.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, herbicides.

loans.name: Mloganzila Group

texts.en:
William, who is in his late twenties, is married with two children who are still small. He has had a business of selling cosmetics for two years now. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy more cosmetics and for household expenses and has paid back his loan successfully.  

He hopes for a loan to buy more cosmetics and to start building a small house.  His dream is to one day be able to build and finish his small house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mloganzila", which has a total of sixteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and to start building a small house.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a father of four children aged between 13 and 4 years. His farm produces bananas and cabbages, which he sells to the local market.

Evans has requested a loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He is focusing on having three dairy cows. He hopes to earn enough income to educate his children and improve his family's standard of living.

Evans says the major challenges are capital and animal diseases.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anthony Erick

texts.es:
Anthony es un hombre de 26 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, él es muy jovial, entusiasta y trabajador; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo “Arroz con Pato con Papa a la Huancaína” para compartir gratos momentos con su familia,él es muy estudioso, con un gran deseo de superación y ganas de salir adelante, actualmente se encuentra cursando el tercer año de la carrera profesional de medicina humana.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Anthony trabaja como chofer de taxi, brindando servicios de traslado hacia el centro de la ciudad, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 6 horas diarias, él realiza esta labor ya que necesita obtener ingresos económicos para poder seguir estudiando su carrera universitaria. 
Anthony se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de instrumentos de medicina y libros de estudio para poder seguir cursando sus estudios satisfactoriamente; de esta manera Anthony podrá culminar su carrera de medicina y en un futuro no muy lejano podrá lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran buen médico pediatra.
texts.en:
Anthony is 26 years old, lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica, Santiago district, and is very youthful, enthusiastic, and hardworking. During his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors and occasionally likes to cook “Rice with Duck and Potatoes a la Huancaína” to share pleasant moments with his family. He is very studious with a drive to succeed and improve his life. At the moment he is in his third year studying Medicine. 
With lots of hard work and dedication, Antony works as a taxi driver offering his service across downtown. He works about 6 hours a day. He needs this job to continue affording his education.
Anthony is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because with their help he will be able to buy medical apparatus and books to continue studying efficiently. That way, Anthony will be able to graduate and have his dream of becoming a pediatrician come true.

loans.use: buy medical apparatus and books to study medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue and tools.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, recientemente le han instalado el servicio de luz eléctrica, su vivienda se ubicada en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Luz Marina se dedica desde hace más de cuatro años a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas)y aves de corral, cuenta con 35 ovejas y otro tanto de aves en su corral que se encuentra a unos minutos de su casa, los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales para que cuando lleguen a desarrollarse competamente puedan ser vendidos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar. 

Luz Marina se encuentra solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados y forraje para brindarlos a sus animales y lograr que se desarrollen bien para venderlos a un mejor precio. De ese modo espera progresar y salir adelante.

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y gracias a esa ayuda pudo aumentar su negocio por lo que se encuentra bastante agradecida, también agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con ella en esta ocasión.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a 41-year-old mother that lives with her husband and children in a house of their own. They have recently installed electric power in her house. Her home is located in one of the hamlets in the countryside of Tambogrande of the Piura department. This is a zone that is well known for its agriculture, cattle farming and handcrafts.

For more than four years, Luz Marina has raised and sold sheep and poultry. She has 35 sheep and an equal amount of birds in her barn, located a few minutes away from her house. She feeds them with natural grains and grass in order to sell them in the various local markets once they are fully developed, thus obtaining very good profits and being able to cover her household's day-to-day expenses. 

Luz Marina is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of $700 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed and forage for her animals so they can fully develop and she can sell them for a better price. In this way, she expects to progress and move forward. 

She has already had a Kiva loan, thanks to which she was able to expand her business. She is very grateful for that and would also like to thank in beforehand all the people that will be helping her this time around.

loans.use: to buy additional balanced feed and forage for her animals.

loans.name: Cristo Del Consuelo  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cristo del Consuelo está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mejoran la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, se caracterizan por tener ser personas muy amables, gentiles, carismáticas y siempre mantienen una sonrisa a pesar de las adversidades, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad por su situación geográfica es de clima frió, siendo privilegiada por su belleza natural sin igual, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta es una ciudad encantadora y su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propio y de sus visitantes.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María blanca, vive por el sector de Tutupali en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 13, 11, 5, 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian a distancia, trabajan ayudan y le ayudan económicamente, sus dos hijos siguientes están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su hijo de 11 años está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña María Blanca labora hace 19 años como comerciante informal, ella vende hortalizas y verduras, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, en su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos. A pesar de sus ocupaciones eso si nunca descuida el cuidado de su hogar. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando pollos, hortalizas y legumbres para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es surtir su negocio con frutas y ampliar con más verduras.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Cristo del Consuelo is made up of 8 female members and one male member. All of them work in different activities that allow them to improve their families' livelihoods. They are all very kind, gentle and charismatic people who are always smiling in spite of adversity. They preserve the culture and traditions of their hometowns. They live in different points in Cuenca, a city with a cold weather due to its geographical location. It is also privileged with a stunning natural beauty and since December 1999 has been part of the World's Cultural Heritage. This is a charming city whose culinary arts bedazzle both local and strangers.

María Blanca is one member of this bank. She lives in Tutupali in the outskirts of Cuenca. She is 41, married and with 7 children aged 18, 16, 14, 13, 11, 5 and 3. Her first two children attend school remotely, work and support her financially. Her two next children attend a private school in the city and her 11 year-old son attends a public school in town. Her husband is a construction worker and they live in a house of their own.
 
María Blanca has been working for 19 years as an entrepreneur in the non-formal sector. She sells vegetables and groceries. She works for Monday to Saturday from 7am to 5 pm and raises guinea pigs and chicken in her house. In spite of being a very busy woman, she always takes care of her household needs. 

She has been a member of the Communal Bank for one year and a half and will invest her new loan in the purchase of chicken, groceries and legumes in order to continue her business. 
 
Her goal is to stock her business with fruits and to expand her vegetable offerings.

The small picture shows a member that was not in the meeting when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: To purchase chicken, groceries and legumes

loans.name: Lucia Otilia

texts.es:
Doña Lucia Otilia es madre de cuatro hijos, trabaja arduamente para llevar el sustento a su familia, posee un negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo, está ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace 10 años.

Doña Lucia se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para realizar las compras de su producto al por mayor en la ciudad de Managua una vez por semana, para obtener mayores ganancias y lograr el crecimiento de su inventario y así tener un mejor nivel de vida de ella y de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Lucia Otilia is a mother of four. She works hard to provide for her family. She has had a clothing sales business located in one of the markets of León city for more than 10 years. 

Lucia came to ceprodel offices to request a loan for buying her product at wholesale markets in the city of Managua once a week, in order to increase her profits and expand her stock, thus increasing the quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase blouses and underwear

loans.name: Diego

texts.en: Diego, from Santiago Teoloyucan, has a small diversified farm, and lives off his corn crop and the animals he raises. He is constantly looking for ways to make his farm cost-efficient. With his Sistema Biobolsa biodigestor, he will be able to save money by eliminating his agrochemical fertilizer usage. By better utilizing his organic waste, he and his environmentally-aware family will reduce their impact on the environment while benefiting from the energy and fertilizer generated by his biodigestor.

loans.use: To purchase a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigestor.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
Maria tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos dependientes. Viven en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque

Desde hace 13 años, María tiene un Bar – Picantería, un establecimiento donde vende comida, piqueos y bebidas como cerveza, chicha y gaseosas. El negocio se encuentra en su propio domicilio. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel debido a la calidad de atención que brinda. 

Ella había solicitado un préstamo financiado a través de Kiva que le permitió hacer crecer su negocio satisfacer su demanda, por ello se encuentra agradecida con las pesonas que le ayudaron en aquella ocasión. Ahora se encuentra solicitando nuevamente a nuestra institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos para seguir atendiendo a sus clientes como siempre.

Con esta inversión, pretende seguir incrementando sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y hacer mejoras en su vivienda a futuro, María agradece de antemano a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old, unmarried, and has two dependent children.  They live in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area situated in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.  

For the past thirteen years, Maria has owned a Bar /Picantería (restaurant specializing in spicy dishes), an establishment where she sells food, snacks, and drinks such as beer, chichi ( a corn-based drink), and soda.  Her business is located in her home.  She is very well-known in the area and has regular, loyal customers because of the quality customer service she provides.

Previously, she had applied for a loan funded through Kiva that allowed her to grow her business and satisfy demand.  She is grateful to the people who helped her on that occasion.  Now, she is requesting a loan from our institution again in the amount of 500 nuevos soles, which she plans to invest in the purchase of supplies in order to continue attending to her customers as always.

With this investment, she intends to continue increasing her income and improve her quality of life.  In the future, she plans to make home improvements.  Maria thanks the Kiva lenders in advance for their support in helping her to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to grow her restaurant business.

loans.name: Aureliano

texts.en: Aureliano, a small farmer, represents a group of agricultural producers in his region. He trusts the Sistema Biobolsa technology since he has seen it functioning and wants to be a leader within his community in the implementation of new and more sustainable farming techniques. Through this loan, Aureliano will be able to purchase a biodigester, showing his colleagues an effective waste management tool that will help them reduce their agrochemical fertilizer usage and LP gas use. In addition to being an example for his fellow farmers, Aureliano hopes to show his children a more progressive approach to their traditional farming techniques.

loans.use: To purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a tent.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. The town is located on the road that links two Kenyan towns. She is a married mother of two children and runs a tailoring shop which has been in operation for the last three years. She began the business from her personal savings.

Salome is applying for a loan of Ksh 62,650 to purchase tailoring supplies, e.g. materials to make new dresses. Her aspiration is to open other tailoring shops, and she believes that the additional income from this loan will help her purchase some sewing machines which will help her achieve this dream. The challenge that currently faces the business is finding customers and some customers not paying on time.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring supplies, e.g. materials to make new dresses.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 53 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Nilda has a dressmaking business and she earns approximately 2,5000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for almost eight years. 

Nilda is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase material and other sewing accessories for her business. In the future, she hopes to establish her own dress shop.

loans.use: to purchase material and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 57 years old and married with four children. She lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. For many years, Marcelina has been a farmer who grows camote and other vegetables to earn a living. She has been a member of PMPC for two  years.

Marcelina is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm. In the future, she hopes to expand her garden and plant other crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la zona es de condición de vida bastante precaria y solo cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas a la agricultura, por un lado se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como ovejas y cerdos, los cuales vende a los negociantes de la zona una vez que se hayan desarrollado completamente. Además cuenta con una hectárea de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón que cosecha semanalmente. Estos ingresos le sirven para solventar su economía personal.

Rodrigo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y obtener mejores ingresos de sus ventas, así como adquirir fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Rodrigo agradece de antemano a los prestamistas de Kiva que le ayudarán a lograr su objetivo
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 29 years old, single and has no children. He lives in one of the hamlets in the rural agricultural area of Tambogrande, a very poor area in the district which only has electric service.

He works in activities related to agriculture. For one thing he works raising small animals such as sheep and pigs, which he sells to businesses in the area once they are fully grown. Also he has a hectare of agricultural land planted with a lemon crop which is harvested weekly. These earnings help him meet his personal expenses.

Rodrigo wants to buy animal feed to improve the growth of his animals and to obtain better earnings from their sales, and also buy fertilizer to cultivate his lemons. This is why he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 soles to help him achieve his goal.

Rodrigo thanks in advance the Kiva lenders for helping him reach his goal.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers in order to improve his agricultural businesses

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. The town is located on the road that links two Kenyan towns. She is a married mother of four children and runs a grocery stall shop which has been in operation for the last three years. She began the business with her parents’ assistance. 

Salima is applying for a loan of Ksh 41,850 to purchase cereals, e.g. maize, beans, etc. Her desire is to own a larger grocery stall in future. The additional income from this loan will help her purchase more stock of cereals to sell. The challenges that currently face the business are the seasonal business climate and the high cost of transportation, which in turn increases the cost of farm produce.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, e.g. maize, beans, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca hasta hace poco se acaba de pensionar pues trabajo muchos años en una maquiladora, desde que falleció su esposo se hizo cargo de sus hijos y ahora que ya están todos casados. Quiere realizarle algunas mejoras a su casa entre ellas arreglara el marco de la puerta y enjarrar el techo pues con la humedad se ha ido cayendo. Dice que si estuviera su marido eso ya estaría arreglado pero al ser ella la que sostiene la casa y no quiere ser una carga para sus hijos.
texts.en: Francisca recently retired after working many years in a factory. Since her husband died she has taken care of their children and now they are all married. She wants to make some improvements to her home, such as fixing the door frame and plastering up the roof which has been falling in due to the humidity. She says that her husband would have fixed it but now she maintains the house and does not want to be a burden to her children.

loans.use: to fix the door frame and to plaster

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
El socio Flavio nació en la ciudad de Chinchero pero actualmente vive en la comunidad de Huchuy Qosqo de la provincia de Calca.  

El socio Flavio tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. El socio Flavio es albañil y trabaja de forma independiente pero también en sus horas libres se dedica  a la ganadería y agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio de albañil y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio Flavio en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. El socio Flavio perteneciendo al banco comunal “Huchuy Qosqo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Flavio was born in Chinchero but currently lives in the Huchuy Qosqo community in Calca Province.  

Flavio is 36, married and with three children. He is an independent construction worker and also does cattle and crop farming in his spare time. He has been working at construction for several years and has done well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Flavio is asking for a loan for personal consumption, namely to feed and educate his children. He belongs to Communal Bank “Huchuy Qosqo” of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses, specifically to feed and educate his children.

loans.name: Chheourt

texts.en:
Chheourt is 59 years old. She is a mother of two children and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. For more than 20 years, Chheourt has been a farmer, earning approximately 4 USD per day. Her husband buys timber to resell and earns about 4 USD per day. Chheourt's children are employed and earn about 12 USD daily.

Chheourt is requesting a 1500 USD loan to purchase cattle to till her farmland and improve her farm. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use to till her farmland

loans.name: Faustina Eva

texts.es:
La Señora Eva Faustina, se dedica a venta de ropa de todo tipo en unos de los mercados de la ciudad de León y en su casa tiene una pequeña pulpería donde oferta distinto tipo de productos, realiza ese tipo de trabajo  para el sustento de  su familia. 

La señora se siente muy agradecida con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL, porque le ha permitido la apertura de un nuevo negocio, y así ha logrado un mejor nivel vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Eve Faustina sells all types of clothes in one of the markets in Leon city.  Her house has a small grocery store where she sells some select products.  She is in this line of work to support her family.  

She is very grateful for the loan CEPRODEL extended to her because it allowed her to open a new business and achieve a better way of life for herself and for her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, mens shirts and underwear for resale.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is married with 4 children. She is 32 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She runs a general store business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 52 years old and lives in Centro Hulpa, Tudela. She is single with 1 child. To earn a living, Cecil has a business selling barbecue in the local community. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients for her barbecue business. She has been a member of PMPC for a month.  In the future, Cecil would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en:
Delia is 56 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. Delia has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has a requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Delia hopes to engage in another type of business and hopes to expand her business. She is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
La socia Juana Angelica sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.  

La socia Juana Angelica sigue dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza como por ejemplo perfumes, aretes, collares y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Juana Angelica en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo perfumes, collares y otras cosas más.
texts.en: The member, Juana Angelica, still belongs to the Mujeres Unidas (United Women) Communal Bank, part  of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco. She continues selling beauty products such as perfume, earrings, necklaces, and other items.  She has been in this business for many years already and it’s going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Juana Angelica is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as perfume, necklaces, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as perfume, necklaces, and other items.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana is a subsistence farmer. She is married and has two daughters, ages 3 and 4. Tatyana works full-time as a clerk in a store and her husband is a full-time construction worker. Her husband's job is very demanding and he ends up working a lot of overtime hours. As a result, Tatyana is taking care of the land by herself. She grows various vegetables in small amounts for her family's consumption. Tatyana finds it difficult to farm and take care of the kids at the same time. To ease the load of manual labour, Tatyana is seeking help to purchase mechanized farming equipment.

loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Nelia's Group

texts.en:
Nelia is 53 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 2 children. Nelia has a general store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for 7 years. 

She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Nelia hopes to expand her business. Nelia is the leader of a 3 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 58 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. Vilma has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase feeds for her hog fattening business. Vilma has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to purchase additional piglets.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for her hog fattening business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 31 años de edad, es casado, y tiene un hijo de 6 meses de edad, vive en el Municipio de Morazan Yoro.
Roberto hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de mercaderia como Cargadores de celular, gorras, lentes para el sol, fajas de hombre etc. El siempre quiso trabajar lo propio y ganar sus propios ingresos los cuales le han permitido seguir adelante sosteniendo a su familia. manifiesta que que este negocio le ha generado buenas ganancias. le dedica a su negocio 8 horas diarias ya que es su fuente de ingresos.
Roberto solicito su primer prestamo de 8,000 lempiras para abastecerse de mercaderia que ya no tiene,  como ser: lentes, cargadores de celular, gorras, carteras etc. para seguir vendiendo y aumentar sus ganancias.
Su meta es seguir trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacion para mejorar la situcion economica para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto is 31 years old, is married and has one 6-month-old child. He lives in the municipality of Morazan Yoro. 

For two years Roberto has made a living selling merchandise like cell phone chargers, caps, sunglasses, men's belts, etc. He always wanted to work on his own and make his own income. This has allowed him to move forward in supporting his family. He says that this business has made him a good profit. He works at the business 8 hours a day as it is his source of income. 

Roberto is requesting his first loan of 8,000 lempiras to stock up on merchandise that he no longer has such as sunglasses,cell phone chargers, caps, wallets, etc., to be able to continue making sales and increase his profits. 

His goal is to continue working with a lot of effort and dedication so as to improve his financial situation for the well being of his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply his business, such as caps, sunglasses, cell phone chargers, men's belts, etc.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela es socia del Bancomunal Los Sauces de Compañía, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, es casada y se dedica a la fabricación de los ladrillos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace más de 5 años y en todo este tiempo ha aprendido mucho sobre los negocios. Le gusta mucho ahorrar y desea que sus hijos sean profesionales y con las facilidades de préstamo que le brinda la institución ya lo está logrando. Ella dice que gracias a las Capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ha aprendido a invertir bien en su negocio, a ser muy responsable y puntual. Ella desea seguir participando de su Bancomunal así como socia de FINCA Perú para que siga progresando al lado de su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en: Adela belongs to Communal Bank Los Sauces de Compañía. She is 42 years old and has 4 children. She is married and has a brick-making business. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for more than 5 years and during this time she has learned much about doing business. She likes saving very much and wishers for her children to become professionals, a goal she is achieving thanks to the convenience of the loans. She says that thanks to the training sessions she receives in her Communal Bank, she has learned how to invest wisely in her business, to be responsible and punctual. She wishes to continue participating in her Communal Bank and to be a member of FINCA Perú so she can move forward with her family. She is asking for a loan to purchase raw materials for making bricks.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making bricks

loans.name: Jose Encarnacion

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la siembra de productos como el maíz y el frijol, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 19, 15, 10 y 7 años de edad, él tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la actividad agrícola este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre y a través de ha logrado mantener a su familia, trabajar a tiempo completo con ayuda de sus hijos mayores.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de maíz y frijol para la siembra, con la que espera obtener una buena producción para la alimentación de su familia y también para formar ingresos.
Su objetivo es que través de su trabajo y esfuerzo sus hijos logren estudiar y llegar a ser profesionales también poderse construir una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
José grows products such as corn and beans.  He lives with his wife and four children, ages 19, 15, 10, and 7.  He has been engaged in this agricultural activity for thirty years and learned this work from his father. Through farming, he has been able to support his family, working full-time with the help of his older children.  

He is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizer as well as corn and bean seeds to plant.  He hopes to yield a good production to feed his family and also earn income. His goal is that through his work and effort, his children will be able to study and become professionals.  He also wishes to be able to build a decent home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer as well as corn and bean seeds.

loans.name: Cheok

texts.en:
Cheok is 24 years old and is married and blessed with a child. She lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. For more than ten years, Cheok has been selling souvenirs and she earns about 5 USD per day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about 4 USD per day.

Cheok is requesting a 900 USD loan to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight. Her loan will help her to start a new business and earn extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelors degrees. She also hopes to rebuild her present house and make it much stronger and comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
El socio Samuel nació y vive en la comunidad de Huchuy Qosqo de la provincia de Calca. 

El socio Samuel tiene 29 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. El socio Samuel es albañil y trabaja de forma independiente pero también en sus horas libres se dedica  a la ganadería y agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio Samuel en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal para alimentación y educación de sus hijos. El socio Samuel  perteneciendo al banco comunal “Huchuy Qosqo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Samuel was born and lives in the community of Huchuy Qosqo in the province of Calca.  Samuel is 29 years old and in a consensual union from which he has three children.  He is a bricklayer and works independently, but also works in farming and with livestock in his spare time.  It has been several years that he has worked with livestock and farming and he has been doing very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  On this occasion, Samuel needs a loan for personal use: to feed and educate his children.  He belongs to Communal Bank “Huchuy Qosqo” of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to feed and educate his children.

loans.name: Vilma Dinora

texts.es:
Vilma, administra un taller de corte y confección, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 26 y 28 años de edad, de estos solamente uno depende económicamente, Vilma tiene el negocio desde hace 10 años lo inició después de haber recibido algunas clases en corte y confección de prendas de vestir.
Ella solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de telas de diferentes colores y estilos, hilo broches, botones, entre otros que son necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo, este préstamo le ayudara a  fortalecer el taller y podrá mejorar su servicio los clientes.
El objetivo de ella es que a través del negocio pueda conocer otras zonas de clientes potenciales, con este desarrollo poder mejorar la vivienda donde habitan y ampliar el local del taller.
texts.en:
Vilma manages a seamstress business. She lives with her husband and two children ages 26 and 28. Only one of them is financially dependent. She has had this business for ten years and started it after having received some lessons on how to cut and make clothing garments.
She is asking for a loan to purchase various fabrics, threads, pins and buttons, among others, which she needs for her work. This loan will help her strengthening her workshop and improving her customer service. 
Her goal is to get to potential customers in other areas, thus having enough money for improving her house and expanding her workshop space.

loans.use: to purchase various fabrics, threads, pins and buttons.

loans.name: Teodoro Silvestre

texts.es: Teodoro tiene 53 años con 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Su actividad es venta de productos lácteos, el inicio este trabajo no tenía suficiente capital de trabajo, pero con la ayuda y la confianza que fundación león 2000 le ha brindado ha logrado alcanzar sus objetivos. Es así que decide realizar un financiamiento destinado para la compra de cuajada, crema, leche, queso y leche agria, cuajada,  Su meta es construir una pared en  el fondo de su casa.
texts.en: Theodore is 53 years old with 3 young children under his care. He sells dairy products.  When he started this type of work he did not have enough working capital, but with the help and trust that the Leon 2000 Foundation has provided, he has achieved his goals. He has decided to request a loan for the finance and purchase of curd, cream, milk, cheese, sour cream.  A goal of his is to build a wall at  the back of his house.

loans.use: to buy curd, cream, milk, cheese and sour cream.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es socia del Bancomunal Los Sauces de Compañía tiene 29 años de edad, es madre dos hijos varones y se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. Ella es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años y dice que es una experiencia muy bonita, le gusta mucho ahorrar y es puntual en sus pagos, su familia esta muy orgullosa de ella. Su meta es seguir progresando y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de arcilla para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en: Doris belongs to Los Sauces de Compañía Communal Bank.  She is 29 years old and the mother of two children.  She is engaged in the business of making bricks.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for five years and states that it is a nice experience.  She enjoys saving and is punctual with her payments.  Her family is very proud of her.  Her goal is to continue progressing and to provide her children with a good education.  She will use the loan she is requesting to invest in the purchase of clay for making the bricks.

loans.use: to purchase clay for making bricks.

loans.name: Neftali

texts.es:
Neftalí, es un agricultor, vive con su familia, cuenta con su propia vivienda, realiza su trabajo con el apoyo de su suegro, esto lo aprendió desde pequeño y ha ganado mucha experiencia.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de los materiales necesarios en la agricultura como lo son el abono y los herbicidas, que son aplicados al cultivo con el fin de mejorar la producción y de prevenir las plagas, espera tener buenos resultados con esta nuevo cultivo.
La aspiración de él, es sacar adelante a su familia a través del trabajo constante, poderle ofrecer una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en: Neftalí is a farmer and lives with his family in his own home.  He does his work with the help of his father-in-law.  He learned this work when he was young, and he has earned a lot of experience.  He is requesting a loan to buy necessary materials like fertilizer and herbicides, which he applies to his crops to improve production and to prevent pests.  He hopes to have good results with his new crop.  His aspiration is to take good care of his family through constant work to be able to offer them better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Unidos lo Lograremos”  perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la confección, específicamente en cortinas, buzos y arreglos en general. Se desempeña en este negocio desde hace 2 años y lo realiza en su casa.
Patricia se desempeña en sus labores de confección de lunes a sábado y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en distribuidoras, ya que son lugares en los cuales encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará telas para hacer buzos, hilos, cierres, botones para los arreglos que su clientela necesite.
Una de las metas de Patricia es crecer como microempresaria y continuar con su negocio para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Patricia vive junto a  sus 2 hijos y su nieta de 13 años quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños son llegar a tener un taller establecido en su casa para una mejor atención a su clientela y la vez incorporar gente que le ayude con las confecciones.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, lo cual la motiva a seguir participando en la institución. Comenta además que las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones le han servido para invertir mejor en su negocio.
 Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Patricia María belongs to the “Unidos lo Lograremos” communal bank, whose members live in the city of Talca.

She works as a seamstress, specifically she sews curtains and sportswear, and does general mending. She has been running her business for two years, and works from home. Patricia performs her sewing work from Monday to Saturday, and manages her work hours according to her availabilty.

She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago at distributors, as they are places where she finds her merchandise at low cost, so it is advantageous from a financial point of view. 

With the loan, she will buy fabric for making sportswear, and thread, zippers and buttons for the mending her customers need.

One of Patricia's goals is to grow as an entrepeneur and to continue with her business in order to generate greater income, and this way go for a better quality of life.  

Patricia lives with her two children and her 13-year-old granddaughter who is in school. Her dream is to manage to have a workshop in her home, in order to serve her customers better, and at the same time add people to help her with her sewing. 

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her, as the loan will allow her to invest in her business.

As well, she is comfortable with the communal bank group that she belongs to, which motivates her to continue participating in the institution.

She also comments that the training provided at the meetings has helped her invest more effectively in her business. 

Talca is part of the Maule region, located in the central area of the country. It constitutes the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region, as it is the most important city in the Chilean central valley.

Talca is the subject of a curious phrase in Chile: "Talca, París y Londres" ("Talca, Paris, and London"). Among the possible explanations for this are some that say it derives from a comment made by an Englishman: "Talca parece Londres" (which, in Spanish, sounds like "Talca, París y Londres", meaning "Talca resembles London"). Indeed, in the winter, an abundant fog often blankets the city, as happens in the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making sportswear, as well as thread, zippers and buttons for the mending work her customers need.

loans.name: Lucia Del Rosario

texts.es: Lucia del Rosario casada de cincuenta años de edad, tiene por actividad económica un servicio de transporte colectivo, con el cual recibe sus ingresos, p ara sufragar gastos económicos, lucia tiene 20 años de  tener su casa, en la actualidad ella necesita cambiar el techo de propiedad por lo cual está solicitando el financiamiento para hacerle las mejoras a su casa y comprar material como:  zinc, perlines, cemento, madera, clavos ,alambre de amarre, entre otros.
texts.en: Lucia del Rosario is married and is 50.  She has a fixed-fare and fixed-route transportation service, from which she earns income to pay for her economic expenses.  She has had her home for 20 years.  Currently she needs to replace the roof, which is why she is requesting financing to make improvements to her home and to buy materials like:  zinc, gravel, cement, wood, nails, wire, etc.

loans.use: to buy zinc, gravel, cement, wood, nails, wire, etc.

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijas menores de edad, él aprendió la siembra de granos básicos desde muy joven y también trabaja como jornalero y ayudante del técnico agrícola con el fin de mantenerse ocupado y generar ingresos para su familia.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, pues está iniciando la siembra de la temporada, se comprará abono, semilla mejorada, herbicidas, y pago de mano de obra, este préstamo le permitirá obtener lo suficiente en materiales para aplicarlos al cultivo y lograr una mejor cosecha.
El quiere crecer en los cultivos, tener cosechas abundantes y sanas para poder generar mayores utilidades y mejor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
José works growing corn.  He lives with his wife and two minor children.  He learned how to plant basic grains from a very young age and he also works as a day laborer and helper of the agricultural technician with the goal of staying busy and creating income for his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs since he is beginning the planting season.  He will buy fertilizer, improved seeds, and herbicides and pay farmhands.  This loan will allow him to obtain sufficient materials to apply to his entire crop and to achieve a better harvest.  He wants to continue growing his crops, having abundant and healthy harvests in order to create more utility and stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, improved seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Jose Patricio

texts.es: José Patricio casado de cuarenta y siete años de edad, tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de cerdo, tiene 25 años de experiencia, en la actualidad tiene mucha clientela y por lo tanto más demanda del producto , el negocio surge por la necesidad de poder sufragar los gastos de su familia, los sueños y metas  ingresar los ingresos de su hogar  y mejorar
texts.en: José Patricio, 47 and married, buys and sells pigs for a living. He has 25 years of experience in this business and currently has a large amount of customers and therefore a greater demand. He started his business out of the need to support his family, achieve his dreams and goals, increase his family income and improve his situation.

loans.use: to purchase, raise and sell pigs

loans.name: Cecilia Jeannette

texts.es:
Cecilia, atiende un comedor, ella vive en casa propia junto a su hija de 13 años, es una mujer divorciada trabaja para el sustento de su familia, ella es maestra y comerciante, junto con su hermana realiza la venta de comida y bebidas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de comida, aceite, arroz, carnes, frijoles, queso, así como también embebidas como jugos, gaseosas, este préstamo le ayudará a mejorar el negocio invirtiendo en los materiales necesarios para poder aumentar la producción de comida.
Su objetivo es a través de los préstamos poder crecer y ampliar el comedor a un pequeño restaurante, con su hermana superarse en esta actividad y mejorar la economía de la familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia has a small food stand.  She lives in her own home with her 13-year-old daughter.  She is divorced and works to support her family.  She is a teacher and a merchant.  Together with her sister, she sells food and drinks.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of materials to make food:  oil, rice, meat, beans, and cheese.  She will also buy drinks like juice and soft drinks.  This loan will help her improve her business by investing in the necessary materials to be able to increase her food production.

Her objective through her loans is to be able to grow and expand her food stand into a small restaurant, to improve her work along with her sister, and to improve her family's finances.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, meat, beans, cheese, juices, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Don Irene hace 10 meses  establecio su propio negocio. estubo viviendo por una temporada en el extranjero y con los ahorros que logro hacer, regreso e inicio su negocio. el vende productos como: cosmeticos, cremas para el cuerpo, productos dentales, gel para el cabello, ganchos,talcos shampoo, espejos etc.el vende en un pequeño local ubicado en el mercado del centro. el cuenta con su propia clientela y hasta el momento sus ventas han sido favorables, de alli ha podido solventar las necesidades de su familia. El le dedica a su negocio 12 horas diarias. 
Irene para comprar y seguir obteniendo los ingresos diarios para suplir las neceidades diarias de su familia y para crecer mas en su negocio  solicito un prestamo a Odef de 15,000 lempiras para la compra de variedad de cosmeticos, cremas, lociones,etc. Piensa que con esta inversion aumentara mas su capital y podra vender con suficiente producto.
Su meta en el futuro es seguir obteniendo financiamientos con Odef que le permitan crecer como comerciante, y poder extenderse en el mercado.
texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old, married and has one two-year-old child. He lives in the city of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. 

Ten months ago, Irene established his own business. He was living abroad for a while and with the savings he was able to accrue, he returned and started his business. He sells products like cosmetics, body creams, dental products, hair gel, clips, talcum powders, shampoos, mirrors, etc. He sells in a small stall located in the central market. He has his own customer base and up to now, his sales have been good. With this he has been able to pay for the necessities for his family. He works at his business 12 hours a day. 

In order to make purchases, continue making the daily income to give his family their daily needs, and to grow his business, he requested a loan from ODEF of 15,000 lempiras to purchase a variety of cosmetics, creams, lotions, etc. He believes that this investment will increase his capital and he will be able to make sales with sufficient product. 

His goal in the future is to continue getting loans with ODEF that will allow his to grow in sales and be able to expand within the market.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams, lotions, etc., to stock up on products for resale.

loans.name: Enma Leonor

texts.es:
Enma tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos ya son mayores, el menor tiene 17 años y actualmente esta estudiando, Enma vive con dos de sus hijas y el esposo de una de ellas en una colonia que corresponde al Municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña Enma tiene un negocio que logro establecer con capital que obtuvo de la venta de un solar. Motivada a trabajar para no depender de nadie inicio entonces su propio negocio de venta de calzado. ofrece calzado para damas, caballeros y niños como, Sandalias, tenis y zapatillas, vende en un puesto del mercado de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula, este negocio es fuente de ingresos y le ha ido bien aunque hay temporadas que las ventas son bajas, pero ella mantiene los precios cómodos y cuenta con su propia clientela sus ventas siempre son rentables,
dedica a su negocio 8 horas diarias.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para comprar calzado, con esta inversión lograra aumentar su inventario y ofrecer variedad de estilos de calzado a sus clientes.
Su plan es seguir invirtiendo y tener su negocio surtido y extenderse mas en el mercado.
texts.en:
Enma is 49 years old and a single mother of four children. Three of her children are already adults while the youngest is 17 years old and is currently studying. Enma lives with two of her daughters and the husband of one of them. They live in a neighborhood in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. 

Enma has a business that she was able to establish with the capital she made from the sale of a plot of land. Motivated to work so that she would not need to depend on anyone else, she started her own business selling footwear. She offers shoes for women, men, and children such as sandals, tennis shoes, and sneakers. She makes her sales in a stall in a market in San Pedro Sula. This business is her source of income and it has gone well for her though there are times when sales are down. Still she keeps her prices reasonable and with her own customer base her sales are always profitable. She works at her business 8 hours a day. 

Now she is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy footwear. With this investment she will be able to increase her inventory and offer a variety of styles of shoes for her customers. Her plan is to continue investing, have a well stocked business, and expand within the market.

loans.use: to buy footwear such as sandals, tennis shoes, and sneakers.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio Teófilo nació y vive en la comunidad de Huchuy Qosqo de la provincia de Calca.

El socio Teófilo tiene 38 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. El socio Teofilo se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio Teófilo en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera. El socio Teófilo perteneciendo al banco comunal “Huchuy Qosqo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
The member Teófilo was born in and lives in the Huchuy Qosqo community of the Calca province. Teófilo is 38 years old, and has a common law marriage from which he has 3 children. 

Teófilo makes a living in agriculture and raising livestock. It has been various years that he has worked in this business and it is going very well for him thanks to the effort he makes at work. At this time, Teófilo needs a loan to buy a dairy cow. Teófilo belongs to the Arariwa Association's communal bank "Huchuy Qosqo" in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay farmhands.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, sus hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a las labores del hogar y a la crianza de cerdos, este negocio lo comenzó gracias al apoyo de su madre, lo trabaja desde su casa y no tiene un horario establecido para atender las exigencias que tiene.
Solicita un préstamo para poder reinvertir en la compra de cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos éste préstamo le ayudará a mejorar la granja,  a crecer y a tener lo necesario para continuar trabajando por su familia.
La aspiración de María es tener un negocio rentable con capacidad para atender la demanda y poderle ofrecer a su familia una buena condición de vida.
texts.en:
María lives with her family, husband and children. She is a housewife who also raises pigs. She started this business with her mother's support, works from home and does not have a fixed schedule so she can fulfill the demands of her life. 
She is asking for a loan in order to reinvest in the purchase of pigs and animal feed. This loan will help her to improve her farm, to grow her business and to have what she needs to keep on working for her family. 
María aspires to own a profitable business that's able to satisfy the demand and to offer her family a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La Sra. María es soltera, trabaja como cocinera en un Restaurant de la ciudad del cual ya tiene 12 años. Actualmente esta pagando su casa pues aunque tiene hijos mayores vive sola. Empezó la construcción de un cuarto del cual poco a poco quiere terminar para utilizarlo como cocina, por lo que necesita el préstamo para los cerramientos. En un futuro ella quiere tener su negocio de comida y ser ella la anfitriona del negocio.
texts.en: María is single and has worked as a cook at a restaurant in the city for 12 years.  She is currently paying for her house.  While she has older children, she lives alone.  She started building a room, and little by little, she wants to finish it to use it as a kitchen.  This is why she needs the loan to close it off.  In the future, she wants to have her food business and be the hostess of the business.

loans.use: to close off a room in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Healthcare expenses

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La socia Zulma perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.  

La socia Zulma sigue dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza como por ejemplo ropa, perfumes, aretes, collares y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Zulma en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo pulseras, pinta labios, perfumes, gorros, collares y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
La socia Zulma perteneciendo al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.  

La socia Zulma sigue dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza como por ejemplo ropa, perfumes, aretes, collares y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Zulma en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo pulseras, pinta labios, perfumes, gorros, collares y otras cosas más.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Herlinda Fiorella

texts.es:
Herlinda es una joven de 22 años, vive en  la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pequeño hijo de 2 años, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias se separó de su pareja, ahora ella es padre y madre para su pequeño, ella es una mujer luchadora, entusiasta y muy perseverante, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos a trabajar para salir adelante en la vida; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión junto con su pequeño, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar la carrera de enfermería que tanto quería, pero sueña con poder hacerlo muy pronto. 
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de una amiga, desde hace más de 2 años Herlinda puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender buena cantidad de clientes, Herlinda cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a los buenos productos que vende, así como por su trato amable y respetuoso que brinda sus clientes.  
Herlinda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como perfumes, cosméticos, carteras, entre otros; de esta manera Herlinda tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales poco a poco espera poder ahorrar el dinero necesario para dar inicio a sus estudios y así asegurar el bienestar de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a 22-year-old young woman. She lives in the city of Ica, in the Santiago district with her little 2-year-old son. Unfortunately, for various reasons she separated from her partner. Now she is both parents for her child. She is a fighter, enthusiastic and very determined. She dedicates all her efforts to work to get ahead in life. In her free time she likes to watch television with her child. 

Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, Herlinda could not complete her nursing degree that she wanted so much, but she dreams that she will be able to very soon.

By her own initiative and thanks to the support of a friend, more than 2 years ago Herlinda started her small beauty product sales business. She works at her business about 8 hours daily, in which she attends to a good quantity of customers. Herlinda believes that her business runs well because of the good products that she sells, as well as because of the likable and respectful treatment she offers to her customers.

Herlinda is very grateful to Kiva lenders. Now thanks to the offered support she will be able to buy merchandise like perfumes, cosmetics, and purses among other items.
