She has been selling firewood for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed in APSARA Preservation Unit. He earns about $2 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $7 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Him is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new computer and better-quality printer

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvín, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, vive con su esposa y tienen cuatro hijos menores de edad, todos dependen económicamente, su trabajo lo aprendió de su padre desde muy pequeño y cuando formó su propio hogar decidió destacarse en esta labor, teniendo 18 años de experiencia en la agricultura y la ganadería.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de 10 sacos de abono, sies de sulfato, 4 de fórmula y 2000 plantas de Chile, con todos estos materiales Marvin se encuentra entusiasmado, porque podrá iniciar su trabajo, el cual incrementará la producción de granos básicos y de Chile.
El objetivo de Marvín es con su trabajo mantener a su familia en mejores condiciones económicas poder aumentar su producción y apoyar a sus hijos hasta su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Marvín makes a living in farming and livestock. He lives with his wife and has four children who are all minors and financially dependent on him. He learned his trade from his father when he was very young. When he started his own family he decided to make this his occupation as he has 18 years of experience in farming and livestock.  

He is requesting a loan to purchase ten sacks of manure, six bags of sulfates, four of fertilizer, and 2000 chili plants. Marvin is very enthusiastic about having all of these materials because he will be able to start his work and will increase the production of basic grains and chili. 

Marvín's goals are to work to support his family to have a better financial situation, increase his production, and support his children's development.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of manure, six bags of sulfates, and 2000 chili plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for upcoming projects through Veterans Affairs

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Savat (pictured here) is now a garment worker. Her husband, Chea, is a driver. He drives for a company. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh and have one young son. 

Savat’s husband would like to stop working as a driver in order to become a Tuk Tuk taxi driver. Hence, Savat would like to request another loan of $700 to add to her own money to buy a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a Tuk Tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Ramona Elizabeth

texts.es: Ramona tiene 35 años de edad, soltera, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto con sus padres. Ella anteriormente prestaba sus servicios de decoraciones para eventos especiales y se dedicaba al estudio.  Hace 7 años que Ramona recibió de parte de su madre el negocio de venta de verduras y frutas para que se independizara y lo administrara. Los productos que vende son: tomates, chiles, cebollas, papas, brócoli, limones,  y frutas de temporada. Le ha ido muy bien con el negocio ya que lo mantiene surtido y brinda buena atención a sus clientes. Actualmente solicita un préstamo de 20,000.00 Lempiras para comprar verduras y frutas y tener siempre producto fresco que ofrecer a sus clientes. Su plan es ampliar su negocio para que le genere ingresos que mejoren la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Ramona is 35 years old, single, and lives with her parents in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula. She previously offered decoration services for special events and also dedicated time to her studies. Seven years ago, Ramona received a share of her mother's vegetable and fruit business. She decided to manage it so that she could become independent. The products she sells include tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, potatoes, broccoli, limes, and seasonal fruits. Ramona has done very well in her business and wants to maintain her inventory so that she can provide good service to her customers.

She is currently requesting a loan of 20,000 HNL in order to buy vegetables and fruits so that she will always have fresh products to offer to her customers. Her plan is to expand her business so that she can generate income to improve her family's finances.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en: Khon is 37 years old and married with five children, four of whom are students. The main sources of income for her family are rice farming and cassava planting. They have been in these businesses for 15 years. The main constraint for their business is the drop in price of cassava. Khon has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and the other member of the group has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. After completely paying their previous obligations, they are now requesting another loan. Khon, as a leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her crops and seedlings. She really hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and sell those crops for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Shirley Del Rosario

texts.es: Shirley Del Rosario, casada, tiene 30 años, con hijos menores de edad se dedica a la venta de alimentos para animales. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Es una persona muy conocida en su negocio pues siempre está al pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan para no perderlos. Siempre se caracteriza por brindar un buen servicio. Ella solicita este crédito para aprovechar esta temporada lluviosa y comprar concentrado, maíz, trigo, sorgo pedigrí, entre otros. Sueña con establecer un negocio y vender al por mayor.
texts.en: Shirley del Rosario is 30, married, and has children at home. She has had a business selling animal feed for over 8 years. She is well known in her business because she is always aware of what her customers need so that she doesn’t lose sales. She is known for the good service she offers her customers. She is requesting the loan in order to take advantage of the rainy season and purchase animal feed, corn, wheat, hybrid sorghum, among other goods. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: Purchase animal feed, corn, wheat, hybrid sorghum, among other goods.

loans.name: Ramon Emilse

texts.es: Ramón, habitante de Diriomo un municipio de Granada, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de Ladrillos, es casado, sus hijos son mayores de edad, son independientes. El empezó su negocio con ayuda de su suegro el cual le dio material y un lugar donde exhibir sus productos. Actualmente tanto Ramón como su esposa trabaja para sacar a su familia adelante, ella es vendedora de abarrotes y el vende y hace ladrillos. Productos que vende en su casa de habitación. Antes el trabajaba para un fabrica donde la paga era semanal pero decidió poner su propio negocio para buscar una mejor manera de generar más ingresos. Sus clientes llegan  hasta su casa en busca  de ladrillos los cuales son fabricados de muy buena calidad. El solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima para elaborar ladrillos. Este crédito la ayudara a conseguir más materia prima y poder cumplir a tiempo los pedidos que le hace, el lugar donde el exhibe sus productos es de su suegro pero el tiene como
texts.en:
Ramón, an inhabitant of Diriomo, a municipality of Granada, makes his living producing and selling bricks. He is married; his children are adults and independent.

He started his business with the help of his father-in-law who gave him the material and a place to exhibit his products. Currently, both Ramón and his wife work to get their family ahead - she is a grocery store vendor and he makes and sells bricks, products which he sells in his home.

Before Ramón used to work for a factory where he was paid on a weekly basis, but he decided to set up his own business to find a better way of generating more income. His customers come to his home for bricks, which are produced at a very high quality. He seeks this loan to buy the raw materials to make bricks. This loan will help him to obtain more raw materials and be able to complete the orders placed with him on time, while the place where he exhibits his products belongs to his father-in-law, he treats it as if he were the owner.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make bricks.

loans.name: Chanthon

texts.en:
Chanthon (in the photo), age 33, is a primary school teacher. Her husband, Toeurn, age 38, is a tour guide. She has been married since 2007 and just has one son who is in grade 2. IN addition, she has one sister living with her. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Chanthon is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to teach.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Lang Eng

texts.en:
Lang Eng (pictured above) is 45 years old and her husband, Samnang, is 43 years old. They have been married since 1992 and they have two sons. The oldest son is a garment worker and the youngest is in school. The family lives 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
  
Lang Eng sells grocery items at home, while her husband is a motor taxi driver. She took a prior Kiva loan to buy a motorcycle for her oldest son to get to work. 

Lang Eng is now asking for another loan of $700 to purchase another motorbike so her youngest son can drive to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her youngest son to drive to school.

loans.name: Roeurng

texts.en: Roeurng is 54 years old. She is married and blessed with a son in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been running a food store for more than 10 years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 per day. Her son is a motor mechanic. He earns about $3 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Roeurng is requesting a loan of $500 to raise capital in her business to purchase more ingredients and utensils to use in her store. This money will help her expand her business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new kitchen to provide hygienic living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and utensils

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en: Sreyneang and her family live in a wooden house with a zinc roof located in a rural area of Kampong Cham province. She and her family have been planting cassava to support their two children for six years. Sreyneang and her group member have been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and they are now requesting another loan after paying back their fourth loan. As a leader, Sreyneang will use her portion of the loan to spend on farmland preparations and to hire others to clean grasses in her plantation. With this loan, Sreyneang hopes to grow a good yield of crops and sell them for a higher price so that she has enough money to get a proper house for the family.

loans.use: To pay for land preparations and labor fees

loans.name: Asy

texts.en:
Asy (in the photo) is 30 years old and her husband, Rasaly, is 35 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1999 and they have four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of the children attend school and the other two are still young. 

Asy and her husband are fishermen. They sell fish that they catch in the local market. Asy’s family is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Asy is applying for her first loan of $800 to repair her boat and buy a new boat motor because they are old and they break.

loans.use: To repair her boat and buy a new boat motor.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old, married, and has one child. She runs a hardware business to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  

She hopes to grow her business and employ people. She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cement, paint and nails.

loans.use: To buy cement, paint and nails.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is married with 3 children. She is 26 years old and lives in Panta-on, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Michelle owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 6 years and earns PHP 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 4,500 to purchase farm chemicals. Michelle has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Michelle's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Marijen

texts.en:
Marijen runs a fishing business with her husband. She lives in Dauis, Bohol with her family. She has 5 children, the oldest of whom is 8 years old.

Marijen sells her husband's catch to their community. She also buys more fish that she sells at a profit. Marijen works hard to help provide for her family's basic needs and send her children to school. She requested a loan to purchase a boat engine. She hopes to find an additional source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Edwin Jesús

texts.es: Desde muy niño Edwin aprendió el arte de la culinaria al ser criado por su abuela quien por mucho tiempo tuvo restaurante y a quien siempre le colaboraba en el mismo.  Hace aproximadamente 10 años, trabajó como cocinero en un restaurante del municipio, donde perfeccionó sus conocimientos y sus habilidades que lo llevaron a considerar abrir su propio negocio e independizarse. Fue así como creó el Restaurante “Donde Edwin”, utilizando inicialmente los utensilios de cocina de su madre ya que contaba con pocos recursos pero poco a poco fue comprando sus ollas, calderos y demás enseres para la producción, además de ir adquiriendo una clientela que ha ido creciendo a través de los años. A algunos de sus clientes les ofrece créditos quincenales para el pago de la comida, es por esto que necesita tener un capital de trabajo disponible que le permita comprar los insumos al por mayor para obtener descuentos y así poder seguir atendiendo su demanda.  A pesar de que Edwin tiene competencia muy cerca, esto no representa amenaza para el ya que su éxito lo atribuye a su sazón casera en los platos, donde utiliza principalmente muchas verduras frescas.  La especialidad de la casa es el pescado frito acompañado de arroz con coco, patacones, ensalada de aguacate y agua de panela, plato típico de la región costera donde se encuentra ubicado, muy cerca del mar.  Está aspirando a su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, siente que ha sido de gran utilidad para su negocio por ser una buena fuente de recursos.  Su mayor sueño es trasladar algún día el restaurante a un local para independizarlo de la vivienda y así brindarle mayor comodidad a su clientela y a su familia.
texts.en:
From a tender age, Edwin learned the art of cooking having been brought up by his grandmother who had a restaurant for a long time, and who he always helped with it. Roughly 10 years ago, he worked as a chef at a restaurant in the municipality where he honed his knowledge and abilities which led him to consider opening his own business and to become independent.

That was how he came about setting up the restaurant “Donde Edwin”, initially he used his mother's cooking utensils as he had little resources but little by little he bought his pots, cookers and other equipment for production, moreover, he acquires a customer base which has been growing over the years. He gives some of his customers a layaway plan (payments every two weeks) to pay for the meals that is why he needs an available working capital which enables him to buy the suppliers in bulk to obtain discounts and in that way continue to meet the demand. Despite the fact that Edwin has competition nearby, this does not represent a threat for him as he attributes his success to the homely taste in his dishes, where he uses mainly a lot of fresh fruit and vegetables. The house specialty is fried fish accompanied by coconut rice, avocado salad and agua de panela [sugarcane water], typical dish in the coastal region in which it is located, very close to the sea. 

He is seeking his second loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He feels that it has been extremely useful for his business as an excellent source of income. His great dream is to one day move the restaurant to premises to separate it from the home and make his customers and his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy the supplies and food in bulk to produce the dishes that he sells.

loans.name: Walter Oswaldo

texts.es:
Walter, es un agricultor, tiene 20 años, vive con sus padres, está soltero, él aprendió a los 15 años el trabajo agrícola junto con su padre desde hace cinco años está dedicado por completo, con el objetivo de obtener ingresos para apoyar a su familia y para cubrirse su propia necesidad.
Él solicita un préstamo porque está iniciando la siembra de Chile para esto deberá comprarse 1000 plantas, abonos, foliares, que son necesarios para aplicarlos al cultivo ayudándole mejorar y a fortalecer la plantación.
El objetivo de Walter es aumentar su nivel económico a través de una buena cosecha, para tener una mejor condición y apoyar a sus padres en las necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Walter is a farmer, he is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents. At the age of 15, he learned the ropes of the agricultural trade and along with his father for five years now he has worked full-time, all with the aim of generating an income to support his family and meet his own needs.

He requests a loan because he is starting to sow chilies, for which he needs to buy 1,000 plants, fertilizers and plant fertilizers absorbed through the leaves which need to be applied to the crops helping him to improve and strengthen the crop.

Walter's aim is to improve his economic situation with a good harvest, to have a better standard of living and support his parents in their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 chili plants and different types of fertilizers.

loans.name: Veraly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Veraly, administra una tienda de productos domésticos, vive en casa propia junto a su madre y a su padrastro, está soltera y el negocio lo tiene desde hace varios tiempo, lo aprendió de su madre ofrece productos domésticos y la venta de antojitos por las tardes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo porque necesita invertir en la compra de los productos para la elaboración de los antojitos, plátano, repollo, aceite, maíz, boquitas, entre otros que sean necesarios para el fortalecimiento del negocio, este préstamo le permitirá aumentar su inventario y asimismo mejorar sus ventas a los clientes, teniendo más productos para poder aumentar la producción.
El objetivo de Veraly, es a través de este préstamo poder mejorar el negocio, en un futuro construirse un chalet, y asimismo ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Veraly runs a shop selling domestic products. She lives with her mother and her stepfather in their own house. She is single and has had her business for several years, having learnt it from her mother. She sells domestic products as well as corn snacks in the afternoons.
She is requesting a loan because she needs to invest in products to make the corn snacks, such as bananas, cabbage, oil, and corn, amongst other things which are necessary to strengthen her business. This loan will allow her to expand her inventory and improve her sales, as she will have the supplies necessary to increase her production. 
Veraly's aim is to improve her business through this loan, so that in the future she can build a house as well as help her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cabbage, oil, corn and snacks.

loans.name: Sarath

texts.en:
Sarath, 30, is single, living with his old mother in a village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Cambodia. He earns a living through transporting rice and other items for a fee and farming rice. He supplements his income by planting morning glory as additional income. 

Sarath is a second cycle client with Kiva's partner, VisionFund and he completely paid back the first loan, which has helped him better support his relative to study in grade 12 and his living. The current business earns him around 120,000 KHR per day and he is able to save around 40,000 KHR each day for future needs. With clear planning, he is applying for a loan to purchase another plot of farmland so as to increase his rice farming business. He hopes this loan will enable him to prosper his business and earn a larger income so as to support his relative to go to higher education and save some money for his wedding in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another plot of farmland

loans.name: Karina Grey

texts.es: Con un pequeño capital que le prestó una amiga de su madre, Karina inicio hace tres años su negocio de venta de ropa, siendo aún muy joven pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  Así lo demuestra el hecho de haber culminado sus estudios de bachiller y simultáneamente fortalecer el negocio hasta el punto de vender variedad de productos como calzado, cosméticos, perfumería y otros artículos encargados a través de catálogos de una marca especializada a la que se encuentra vinculada; Karina realiza sus pedidos y aproximadamente cada 16 días recibe y distribuye la mercancía entre sus clientes del barrio donde vive llamado Siete de Abril y aledaños, ofreciéndoles créditos con pagos quincenales.  Solicita su primer credikiva para comprar un mayor volumen de mercancía ya que algunas veces mientras espera que le paguen, le hacen pedidos que no puede atender por falta de capital.  Vive desde hace 12 años con su compañero permanente que se dedica a administrar un negocio familiar de reciclaje y con sus dos hijas entre las edades de 1 y 4 años.  Son una familia muy unida y se colaboran entre sí, una muestra de eso ha sido todo el apoyo que se han brindado ante la difícil situación de sobrellevar la enfermedad de su suegra, tanto ella como su compañero dedican parte de su tiempo en su especial cuidado y atención, sin descuidar por otra parte los negocios.  Karina sueña con seguir creciendo a nivel profesional estudiando contaduría pública, a nivel familiar contribuyendo a que sus hijas crezcan con buenos principios y a nivel del negocio desea tener un gran almacén donde pueda vender toda clase de mercancía.
texts.en:
Using a small amount of money which a friend of her mother lent her, Karina started her business selling clothes three years ago, as she was still very young, but very keen to get ahead. This is proved by the fact that she finished her high school studies at the same time as strengthening the business to the point of selling a variety of products such as shoes, cosmetics, perfume and other articles ordered through catalogues for a specialized brand she has links with. 

Karina places her orders and approximately every 16 days, she receives and distributes the merchandise to her customers in the neighborhood and nearby areas where she lives called Siete de Abril, offering them layaway plans [to repay loans in 15 days]. She requests her first Kiva loan to buy a larger volume of merchandise as sometimes while she is awaiting payment, orders are placed that she cannot fulfill due to a lack of capital. 

For the last 12 years, she has been living with her long-term partner, who runs a family recycling business, and their two children between the ages of 1 to 4 years of age. They are a very close-knit family and they work together, an example of which has been all the support which they have shown in the face of the difficult situation of overcoming her mother-in-law's illness, both Karina and her partner spend part of their time giving her special care and attention, without neglecting the businesses.

Karina dreams of growing on a professional level, studying public accounting, on a personal level, helping her children grow up with good ethics and on a business level, she wants to have a large store where she can sell all types of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoes, clothes and perfume for sale.

loans.name: Andrea De Fatima

texts.es:
Andrea es de la comunidad las canoas Tipitapa casada tiene 3 hijos de 18, 14 y 3 años de edad, de los cuales solo él hijo de 14 años estudia la primaria. 
Andrea  tiene una pulpería también hace tortillas y cuajadas (queso) para vender ella empezó su negocio hace 3 años con dinero que obtuvo de la liquidación que le dieron en el trabajo que tenía anteriormente en un centro de hogar de niños. En el negocio de Andrea  le ayuda su hermana  y todo lo que realiza lo vende en su casa donde vienen los clientes a comprar, Andrea también recibe otros ingresos  ya que el marido trabaja como operador de maquina en minas. Andrea hoy solicita este crédito  para surtir la pulpería comprando arroz , frijol ,maíz y otros productos varios ella dice que este crédito será de ayuda ya que al surtir mas la venta tendrá mas ganancias  también dice que una vez que cancele este crédito sacara otro crédito para invertir en la venta y expandirse mas.
texts.en: Andrea is from the community of Las Canoas Tipitapa. She is married with three children who are 18, 14, and 3 years old. Only the 14 year old is in school. Andrea has a grocery store and also makes tortillas and cheese curds to sell. She began her business 3 years ago with money she received when she was made unemployed from her previous job in a childcare center. Andrea's sister helps her with the business and she sells everything from her house where the customers go to buy things. Andrea also receives other income as her husband works as a machine operator in mines. Today, Andrea is requesting this loan to supply her grocery store by buying rice, beans, corn, and other products. She says that this loan will help her to restock and have greater profits. She also says that, once she has paid off this loan, she will take out another loan to invest in sales and expanding more.

loans.use: to supply her grocery store by buying rice, beans, corn, and other products.

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y sus nietos, la vivienda es propia administra un molino y la venta de tortillas, desde hace 10 años está en el negocio, del cual ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Esta solicitando préstamos para la reparación del molino, comprándose algunos puestos ya que está presentando desperfectos para el momento de prestar el servicio, este crédito le ayudará a superar este problema y poder continuar brindando un excelente servicio a los clientes.
El objetivo de Ana es ganarse más clientes potenciales, crecer en el negocio, y ver por las necesidades en su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and her grandchildren in their own home. She runs a mill and sells tortillas and has been doing this for 10 years, and this has enabled her to help her husband with the household expenses. 
She is requesting loans to repair the mill and buy some parts as, at the moment, it has some damage that affects her service. This loan will help her to overcome this problem and to continue offering excellent service to her customers. 
Ana's goals are to gain more customers, grow the business, and see to her family's needs.

loans.use: to repair her mill.

loans.name: Rene Enrique

texts.es:
René, es un agricultor tiene 28 años de edad, está casado y es padre de un niño de un año de edad, viven en casa propia, él aprendió el trabajo agrícola con su padre desde muy pequeño, tiene cinco años de estar trabajando para su familia, hasta el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en la realización del cultivo.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas, pues está sembrando nuevamente el maíz y Chile para esto necesita seis sacos de abono una bolsa de herbicidas, semilla de maíz, 2,000 plantas de Chile, con este préstamo tendrá una mejor condición para realizar la siembra con el fin de obtener una mejor cosecha.
El objetivo de René y poder ayudar a su familia con su trabajo, salir adelante con ayuda de estos préstamos y desarrollarse más en la agricultura.
texts.en:
René is a 28 year old farmer. He is married and is the father of a 1 year old son. They live in their own home. He learned the work of farming from his father from a very young age. He has been working for his family for 5 years and, to date, he hasn't had any problems with his crops.
He is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies. He is sowing new crops of corn and chili and for this he needs 6 sacks of fertilizer and 1 bag of herbicides, corn seed, and 2,000 chili plants. The loan will give him better conditions for sowing with the goal of having a better harvest. 
René's goal is to help his family through his work, to get ahead with the help of these loans, and to develop more as a farmer.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of fertilizer, 1 bag of herbicide, corn seed, and 2,000 chili plants.

loans.name: Mente Positiva Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre “Mente Positiva” en homenaje a la oportunidad que les brinda la Fundación Paraguaya; ya que las mismas señoras tendrán nuevas oportunidades para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y así brindarle a sus hijos un mejor bienestar.
La presidenta es la Sra. Elvira quien cuenta que siempre trata de incentivar y ayudar a sus amigas a salir adelante, es por ello que ya están en el decimo tercer ciclo del programa. Elvira se dedica a la venta de ropas, y cuenta que le ha sido de mucha ayuda estar en el grupo por la oportunidad que representa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, con las cuales podrá surtirse para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group has the name Mente Positiva (Positive Mind) in homage to the opportunity that the Fundación Paraguaya offers them as the women of the group will have new opportunities to undertake better work, to contribute to the household income, and, thus, to offer their children better welfare. 
The president of the group is Elvira who says that she always tries to incentivize and help her friends to get ahead. It is because of this that they are already in their 10th loan cycle with the program. Elvira works selling clothes and she says that it has been a great help to her to be in this group because of the opportunities that it represents. 
She is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing to supply her business and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy winter garments to sell.

loans.name: Buenas Group

texts.en:
Julieta is 46 years old and married with three children. She lives in Buenavista, Pagadian City. For the past two years, Julieta has sold canned and dry goods in her store to earn a living. She makes 10,000 PHP each month and has been a member of PMPC for more than four years.

Julieta is reuqesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase more stock for her general store. In the future, she hopes to expand her store and make it a convenience store.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 49 years old and married with two children ages five and 19. She lives with her family in Antequera, Bohol, and earns a living raising hogs. Cresencia started her business to help provide for her family's basic needs and sustain her children's education. 

Cresencia is requesting a loan to purchase piglets and feed. In the future, she hopes to expand her small piggery.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet, age 22, is single, living with his parents in a village located in the Sa Ang district. He makes his own living through farming rice and planting cucumbers and he supplements his income by fishing in the village. This business enables him to earn around 50,000 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses, and he is able to save around 16,000 KHR each day. He has been in this business for several years.

This is the first loan for Chet with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. Now requesting a loan, he will use it to buy a boat with an engine for fishing and use a portion of it to buy fertilizer for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to grow his business and make a living better.

loans.use: To buy a boat with an engine for fishing and fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 46 years old and married. She has six children between 4 and 18 years old. 

She supports her family through raising hogs and selling baskets made of rattan. Flora works hard to sustain her family, especially her children's education. 

She requested a loan to purchase piglets, feed and basket-weaving materials. Flora hopes to be able to save more for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and basket-weaving materials.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 30-year-old married man with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been in banking for eight years, and with the savings of his salary he has now been able to set up a stationery shop. He has a personal goal of educating his children to attain master's degrees, and his business plan is to have one of the most efficient stationary stores in Kasese town.

Peter intends to use the loan to buy a photocopying machine.

loans.use: to buy a photocopying machine.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 40-year-old single mother of four children, living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been in a restaurant business for three years, and with the proceeds she has been able to provide for her family.

Her hardships are inadequate capital to purchase foods and high taxes levied on her business. 

Her personal goals are educating her children and buying a car. 

Her business goals are buying land to grow crops and moving the business to a more central location in town.

Violet wants the loan to buy food and drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ezdihar

texts.en:
Ezdihar is a 58-year-old divorced woman who opened in 2007 her own business. Ezdihar is a hard working woman with a very good reputation in her region.

Her store is not only a grocery shop, but she also sells children's toys and accessories, attractive enough for increasing her daily income.

Ezdihar applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to improve her business through increasing the quantities and items she sells.

This loan will also help provide good quality products with affordable prices for her beloved customers.

She hopes to stay in good health and to keep on making her own living in order not to ask for help from others.

loans.use: To improve her business through increasing the quantities and items she sells.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes vive en la zona del plan 3000, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta comida en su propio domicilio, también es portera en un colegio donde vende dulces, soda, panchito, asadito, alitas. El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de  insumos como papa, aceite, fideo para la venta de comida y  de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que este tiempo aumenta su clientela y necesita incrementar su capital para comprar mesas y sillas. Su esposo es camarógrafo editor y también le ayuda con la venta de comida, con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien sigue creciendo en su actividad  La Sra. Lourdes es una persona con muchas ganas de superación que al lado de su esposo se esfuerzan para darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos ya que su deseo es verlos profesionales. La Sra. Lourdes es un apersona muy trabajadora se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad bridada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Lourdes lives in the area of Plan 3000. She lives in her own  house with her husband and their three children. She is dedicated to making and selling food in her own house. Also, she is a caretaker in a high school where she sells sweets, soda, hot dogs, barbecue and wings. The loan that she is requesting is to buy ingredients like potatoes, oil, noodles for the sale of food and, in this way, increase her working capital since this time her customers are increasing and she needs to increase her capital to buy tables and chairs. Her husband is photographic editor and also helps her selling food. The previous loan went very well continuing to grow her work. Lourdes is a person with a lot of desire to get ahead. With her husband's at her side, they work hard to give their children a better future since it their wish to see them become professionals. Lourdes is a very hard working person who feels happy for the opportunity provided with the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy oil, noodles, rice and potatoes to make her food.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена – частный предприниматель из Новой Каховки. Она уже 9 лет занимается торговлей детской одеждой на городском рынке. На данный момент ее оборотный капитал составляет 15 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет около 5 000 гривен. 

Елене необходим кредит в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы пополнить ассортимент одежды на продажу на имеющиеся деньги и соответственно получить больше прибыли от реализованного товара. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Elena is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She has been working with trade of children's clothing at the village market for 9 years already. Currently her working capital is 15,000 hryvnia. Her net income is around 5,000 hryvnia. 

Elena needs a loan of 5,000 hryvnia in order to supplement the assortment of clothing available sale based on her current capital, and thus make more profit on goods sold.

loans.use: to supplement the assortment of children's clothing for sale

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 50 years old. She is widowed and blessed with a daughter in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her daughter is a garment worker who earns about $4 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Vanna is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and much stronger for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 34-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in commercial farming, dealing in rice and maize, for two years.

His hardships are price fluctuations and inflation, seasonal weather and inadequate capital to buy the necessary farm inputs.

His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent house and upgrading his studies.

His business goal is buying land to grow more crops and venturing into mechanized agriculture.

James wants a loan to pay workers who are weeding and harvesting his crops.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding and harvesting his crops.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 40-year-old married man with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been operating a stationery shop for seven years. He started with two million UGX and now he has ten million as working capital.

His hardships include customers not paying on time and price fluctuations. His personal goal is educating his children. His business goal is moving his business to a more permanent location.

Henry wants money to buy books to sell since he has won a tender to supply books to three schools.

loans.use: to buy books to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 42 years old and lives in the town of Antequera, Bohol, with his family. 

He runs a transportation business and a hog-raising business that enable him to support his family. George works hard to improve his earnings and sustain his family. 

He requested a loan to purchase piglets, feed and motorcycle spare parts. George hopes to increase his profit and be able to elevate his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей – из Великой Знаменки. Он уже 7 лет занимается ремонтом и торговлей компьютерной и бытовой техникой. Андрей выбрал для себя именно эту группу товаров, так как он хорошо знает бытовую технику и неплохо разбирается в компьютерных технологиях. По образованию он – физик-ядерщик, работал на АЭС в Энергодаре, ушел с того места работы по состоянию здоровья и занялся предпринимательством. В товаре у него сейчас около 210 000 гривен. 

Андрей планирует использовать кредит КИВА в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить бытовую технику для последующей ее реализации. Летом такой товар пользуется хорошим спросом и торговля всегда идет хорошо, поэтому Андрею и хотелось бы в это время увеличить количество товара, чтобы удачно его реализовать. Этот бизнес – основной источник дохода клиента. В его деле наблюдается хороший рост, есть планы на дальнейшее развитие. В ближайшем будущем Андрей планирует построить на рынке большой киоск для хранения и реализации бытовой техники. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Andrei is from Velikaya Znamenka. He has worked with repairing and selling computers and household appliances for seven years. Andrei chose this specific type of goods as he knows household appliances well and understands computer technology well. By profession he is a nuclear scientist, and he has worked at the nuclear power plant in Energodar. He went over to this type of work for health reasons and started to do business. He currently has goods worth around 210,000 hryvnia. 

Andrei plans to use the loan from Kiva, of the amount of 20,000 hryvnia, to purchase household appliances for selling in the future. In the summer this type of goods is in demand and the sale is always good, and therefore Andrei would like to increase the amount of goods at this time, in order to successfully get them sold.

This business is the main source of income for this entrepreneur. There has been a strong growth in his business, and there are plans to further develop it. In the near future, Andrei plans to build a large selling point at the market for storage and selling of household appliances.

loans.use: to purchase household appliances for selling

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 33 years old. He is a married and blessed with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

He has been a chef for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. His wife runs a business of purchasing maize to resell. She earns about $6 per day. 

Because his house’s land is flooded, Sok is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase dirt to fill up his land. This money will help him prevent floods. In the future, he would like to expand his business and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to fill up his land.

loans.name: Maria Edilberta

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y café, tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 14 y 20 años de edad, el negocio de María consiste en la venta de pan dulce y café tiene 10 años de estar dedicada a este negocio y lo realiza por las tardes con ayuda de uno de sus hijos.
Ella necesita invertir en el negocio, para esto solicita un préstamo que le ayude a realizar la compra del pan y café, además quiere ampliar el negocio ofreciendo también bebidas refrescantes, esto le ayudará a ir creciendo y a variar los productos en el negocio, aumentando la posibilidad de ganar mayores ingresos.
El objetivo de ella es ampliar el negocio, y sus hijos terminen sus estudios y puedan tener la oportunidad de un trabajo, también poder mejorar a futuro las instalaciones de la vivienda.
texts.en: Maria is dedicated to selling sweet bread and coffee. She is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children, 14 and 20 years old. Maria's business consists of selling sweet bread and coffee. She has been dedicated to this business for ten years and performs it in the afternoons with the help of one of her sons. She needs to invest in the business. For this, she is requesting a loan that will help her purchase bread and coffee. Additionally, she wants to expand the business by also offering refreshing drinks. This will help her to grow and vary the products in the business, expanding the possibility to earn greater income. Her objective is to expand the business and that her children finish their education and can have the opportunity to work, as well as to be able to improve, in the future, her house.

loans.use: to buy bread and coffee and refreshing drinks.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina es de la comarca llama La  Rita, Teustepe casada tiene 3 hijas mujeres.Guillermina se dedica a la compra y venta de carbón desde hace 13 años negocio que empezó con esfuerzo propio con pocas ventas, después fue aumentando su negocio con crédito que sacaba en otras instituciones también  tiene el apoyo del marido quien cultiva maíz, frijol y trigo además sus hijas le ayudan a vender ya que el negocio lo tiene en su casa. Hoy Guillermina quiere este crédito para comprar carbón ya que se acerca el invierno y se necesita tener bastante inventario de este producto.  
Ella  dice que una vez que pague su crédito lo que le quede de ganancia siempre lo invertirá en el negocio o comprar verduras para vender y así obtener  otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Guillermina is from the region called La Rita, Teustepe. She is married and has three grown daughters. Gullermina has made a living buying and selling coal for 13 years, a business which she started through her own efforts with very little sales. Afterwards she made her business better with loans she got from other organizations. She also has the help of her husband, who cultivates corn, beans, and wheat. On top of that, her daughters help her to sell, since the business is in their house. 

Guillermina wants this loan today for the purchase of coal, since winter is coming up and she needs to have a big inventory of this product. 

She says that as soon as she pays off her loan, she'll use the rest of her earnings to invest in the business or purchase vegetables to sell and in that way earn more income.

loans.use: to buy coal.

loans.name: Nina

texts.ru:
Нина – вдова. У нее две взрослые дочки. Нина живет в городке Королево, занимается продажей продуктов питания. Ее торговая точка находится в самом центре рынка, конкуренция небольшая. В этой сфере Нина работает только 2 года. В товаре у нее 50 000 гривен, валовый доход составляет 18 000 гривен, чистая прибыль – около 5 000 гривен. 

Нине необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент продуктовых товаров, а именно круп и мучных изделий. За счет увеличения объемов реализуемых товаров Нина сможет увеличить и свой доход. В ее дальнейших планах – постепенное расширение торговой точки и увеличение оборотов. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Nina is a widow. She has two grown-up children. Nina lives in the city of Korolyovo, and works with selling food products. Her retail outlet is at the very center of the market, and the competition is not large. Nina has worked in this area for only two years. She has products worth around 50,000 hryvnia, her gross income is around 18,000 hryvnia and the net income around 5,000 hryvnia. 

Nina needs a loan of 10,000 hryvnia in order to increase the assortment of products, mainly cereals and bakery products. By increasing the volume of products sold, Nina can also increase her income. Her further plans are to stepwise expand her outlet and increase her turnover.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of food products for sale, mainly cereals and bakery products

loans.name: Nason

texts.en: Nason is a 32-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for 16 years. His hardships are price fluctuation, inflation, high fuel costs, and inadequate capital to purchase  enough stock. Nason's personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house for his family. His business goals are to diversify his business to include farming. Nason intends to use the money from this loan to buy sugar, salt and soap to sell since the demand has now increased.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and soap to sell

loans.name: Ernesto Antonio

texts.es:
Ernesto, vive con sus padres en casa propia, está soltero, trabaja en la reparación y mantenimiento de computadoras, desde hace un año inició en su pequeño taller el cual surgió por su propia iniciativa y hasta el momento no ha presentado ningún inconveniente.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar repuestos y accesorios para las computadoras como lo son teclados, tarjetas de memoria, mauses, CD, y  otros, que son necesarios para realizar este trabajo espera que con este préstamo pueda brindar un mejor servicio a la clientela.
La superacion de Ernesto es tener un local propio y amplio donde atender a los clientes que sea más cómodo que le permita mejorar su apariencia, también poderles ayudar a su familia una mejor condición.
texts.en: Ernesto lives with his parents in their own house. He is single. He works on repairing and maintaining computers. A year ago, he started his small shop, which emerged by his own initiative and, until now, has not faced any challenges. He is requesting a loan to buy parts and accessories for computers, such as keyboards, memory cards, mice, CD and other things which are necessary to perform this work. He hopes that with this loan he can provide better service to his customers. Ernesto's wish is to have his own shop and expand where attending to customers is more comfortable and allows him to improve his reputation, as well as to be able to help his family be in a better condition.

loans.use: to purchase keyboards, memory cards, mice and CDs.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
Don Daniel, reside en el departamento de Masaya,  casado,  tiene la edad de 41 años, de oficio mecánico, con 22 años de experiencia, empezó como trabajor, pero con el tiempo el desidio poner su propio taller de mecánica en el que actualmente tiene ya 10 años de obtenerlo, su núcleo familiar es de 4 sus dos hijos y su esposa, cuenta con tres trabajadores sus dos  hijos y un trabajador  mas,  que le ayudan a dar el servicio de repacion de vehículos. Esta necesitando comprar unos materiales tales como alambre de cobre esmaltado calibre # 17, y calibre # 19.

Se acerca  a nuestra oficina para solicitar un préstamo que le permitirá abastecer su negocio en el material que mas necesita,  considera que este crédito le ayudara a dar un mejor servicio en su negocio y dará mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in the department of Masaya. He is 41 years old and married. He works as a mechanic and has 22 years experience. He started as an employee but after a time he decided to start his own mechanics’ workshop, which he has now had for 10 years. 

His nuclear family is comprised of four people, his two children and his wife. He relies on three workers: his two children and another worker, who help him to repair vehicles.

He needs to buy materials such as #17 caliber and #19 caliber enamelled copper wire. He approached our office to ask for a loan which will allow him to supply his business with the materials he needs. He considers that this loan will help him to provide a better service in his business and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: #17 caliber and #19 caliber enamelled copper wire.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.ru:
Виталий с супругой и двумя сыновьями живет в Ивано-Франковске. Он работает в одном из местных транспортных агентств, предоставляя транспортные услуги на территории Украины. Виталий занимается этим бизнесом уже 7 лет. На руки получает около 5 000 гривен чистого дохода. По специальности Виталий – бармен-повар. Раньше он работал поставщиком на строительной фирме, потом рассчитался и начал работать в сфере предоставления транспортных услуг, так как его устраивает неплохой заработок и гибкий график работы. 

Виталий хотел бы вложить кредит в 10 000 гривен в переоснащение автомобиля с грузового в пассажирский. Виталий некоторое время работал на грузовом бусе. Теперь он хочет переоборудовать свое грузовое транспортное средство на пассажирский минивэн, потому что минивэны пользуются большей популярностью среди клиентов-заказчиков и заказы оплачиваются в 1.5 раза выше, нежели грузовые автомобили.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vitalyi lives in Ivano-Frankivsk together with his wife and two sons. He works at one of the local transport agencies, offering transport services in Ukraine. Vitalyi has worked with this business for 7 years already. He receives around 5,000 hryvnia in net income. 

Vitalyi is a chef and bartender by profession. Earlier he worked as a catering supplier for a building company. Then he settled the accounts and started working in the area of offering transport services, because it gives a good income and a flexible work schedule. 

Vitalyi would like to receive a loan of 10,000 hryvnia for the refitting of his vehicle from cargo to passenger. Vitalyi has worked in with cargo for some time. Currently he wants to convert his cargo vehicle to a minivan for passengers, because minivans are more popular among the customers. The bookings give 1.5 times more money than for cargo vehicles.

loans.use: to convert his cargo vehicle to a minivan for passengers.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is 38 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately $15 per day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about $4 per day. All of her children are still in her care.

 In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sokhom is requesting a loan of $1250 to raise capital in her business to purchase more groceries to resell. By doing so, she would generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 39-year-old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For seven years he has been operating a barber shop and has been able to secure customer loyalty in the area. 

High fuel and inadequate capital to meet the various needs of his customers are the main hardships he is facing. However, his personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent house and buy a car while his business goals are to move his business to new markets and have a modern salon.

Robert intends to buy two standard shaving machines and a sterilizer since the number of customers has increased and he wants to serve them better.

loans.use: to  buy shaving machines and a sterilizer  for the salon.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
This is Cristy, 56, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Merwin, a tailor; and a mother to their child. By the grace of God, Cristy has managed to support her child’s schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cristy operates a door mat business. Her products are small rugs and larger doormats. She makes door mats out of excess textile cloth she buys from the factory. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway.She makes the mats by herself and she directly sells them to her neighbors and the local community, as well as to suppliers. She earns a minimum of Php 550 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric and thread. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cristy hopes that God will use her and her family in advancing His kingdom, just as she hopes to see her daughter finish college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for textiles needed in her business.

loans.name: Nancy Prudencia

texts.es: La Sra. Nancy es cliente antigua de la institución, en el crédito anterior también era cliente Kiva, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, en esta época se encuentra vendiendo locoto, limones y limas, pero ya llega la cosecha de naranja sy mandarinas, fruta que trae de sus propiedades de los yungas, por lo que solicita este crédito para realizar esa actividad y traslado de esa mercadería.  Su esposo tiene un  taxi que lo trabaja especialmente por la zona central, ambos con su esfuerzo y con los préstamos de la institución lograron construir su casa donde viven con sus dos hijos en edad escolar, y otros dos hijos mayores quienes formaron su propio hogar, la Sra., Nancy es una cliente responsable quien trabaja con nosotros desde hace diez años, son clientes muy responsables, con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Nancy is a long-time client of the institution. With her previous credit she also worked with Kiva.  She sells seasonal fruits.  Currently she is selling locoto (a type of pepper), lemons and limes, but soon the harvest of oranges and tangerines will arrive, fruit that she brings from her property in the "yungas" or warmer valleys.  For this reason she is asking for credit in order to accomplish this activity of transporting her product.  Her husband has a taxi and he works especially in the central zone.  Both with their effort and with the loans from the institution they were able to construct the house where they live with their two school-age children, as well as with two older children who form their own family.  Nancy is a responsible client who has worked with our organization for the past ten years.  Her clients are very responsible.  With her previous credit she did very well.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that the credit has brought.

loans.use: For the transport of oranges and tangerines from the locality of los Yungas to the city of la Paz.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase the assortment of household products to increase turnover

loans.name: Julanda

texts.en:
Julanda is a 44-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be an aggressive businesswoman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for more than six years.

Julanda's business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are passersby. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes.

Julanda, also does farming whereby earlier on she had taken a loan of Kes 20,000 which she managed to repay well.  Her business goal is to own business premises for selling clothes within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a succesful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a forty-four-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a health worker for twelve years. He works in a government hospital and he used his salary savings to start a clinic in his village since his community had no nearby health unit. His challenge is the inadequate capital to have a standard clinic and his dream is to have a fully fledged medical center. Charles intends to use the loan to buy lab equipment for his clinic.

loans.use: to buy lab equipment for his clinic.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 34-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been teaching for two years and is so proud of her profession, since she is able to interact with and inspire the young. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house to use as her residence, since she now has a semi-permanent house. Margret wants money to pay school fees and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to pay school fees and to renovate her house.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a married woman. She has a daughter who is 2 years old. She describes herself to be a principled woman. 

Stellah operates a poultry business where she sells chickens, etc.. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of chicken food. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more chickens. This is her second loan she is requesting from SMEP DTM. Her business goal is to be a supplier of poultry in her town area.

loans.use: to buy more chicks.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 2 to 11 years. She describes herself to be a diligent woman. 

Mercy operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 11 year and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located at a cool place near slopes of a mountain and her primary customers are local residents. Mercy is also a farmer where she gets additional income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy clothes for selling. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will use the anticipated profits in running more wholesale shops.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Ai Sas

texts.en: Ai Sas is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than two years and is successful in her career. She runs a rubber plantation. She earns about $20 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are still in her care. In order to improve her family's finances, Ai Sas is requesting a loan of $1,500 to pay for hiring farm workers to cultivate cassava plants. By doing so, she will earn more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to run the rubber plantation and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for hiring farm workers to cultivate her cassava plants.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 58, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is the mother of children who are now working. She, together with her children, manage their own household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alicia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Alicia earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in net sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alicia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to find time to travel and/or relax in a salon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kim Song

texts.en: Kim Song is 40 years old. She is widowed and lives with her two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Kim Song has been involved in agriculture for more than two years and is successful in her career. She grows cassava and mushrooms. Kim Song earns about $16 per day. Her children are still in her care. Due to a lack of funds, Kim Song is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase materials to use in mushroom cultivation. By doing so, she will be able to produce more mushrooms to sell and to earn more money. In the future, she would like to expand her business and to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase materials to use in mushroom cultiavtion

loans.name: Fyuduruva

texts.en: Fyuduruva sells fish for a living. She is 29 years old and married with two young children. She buys fresh fish from fishermen and sells the fish at a profit. She also makes salted and brined fish. Fyuduruva is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to increase her sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Helma

texts.en:
Helma is 41 years old and is a married woman with 7 children, ages between 3 and 24 years. Her husband works as a fisherman and a farmer.

Helma is also involved in fishing. She helps her husband sell his catch at the market. She also grows seaweed to sell. Helma wants to be able to help pay for her children's school fees. She also plans to make improvements to their house. She plans to use her loan to purchase straw, wooden pegs and materials for building a fishing boat. Helma hopes to increase her profits and be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase straw, wooden pegs and materials for building a fishing boat

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 34-year-old, hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house and and educating his children to attain better academic qualifications. Godfrey operates a retail shop and the business is very profitable despite challenges of customers not paying on time. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and owning a wholesale shop. Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar for sale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Jonnabel

texts.en: Jonnabel is 30 years old and married with 2 children, ages 7 and 8. She runs a fishing business with her husband. She sells her husband's catch at their town's market. She also processes dried fish to sell. Jonnabel works hard and only wants the best for her family. She requested a loan to purchase marine plywood, paint and other materials for building a fishing boat. This loan will help bring in more fish for Jonnabel to sell.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood, paint and other materials for building a fishing boat.

loans.name: Nena's Group

texts.en:
Nena is 68 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependent children. 
Nena has a goat raising, buying and selling business and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional goats to sell. 
Nena has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Nena hopes to engage in another types of businesses. Nena is the leader of a three-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to be used to purchase additional goats to sell.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 23 years old. Rolly is single. To make a living, Rolly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. Rolly has been engaged in his business for 13 years and earns 7,000 PHP a month for this activity.
In 2009, Rolly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Rolly is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer for growing corn. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for growing corn.

loans.name: Jojeta

texts.en: Jojeta runs a fishing business with her husband in Bien Unido, Bohol, where they also live. Jojeta has 2 children, ages 7 and 8. She works hard to increase their daily income and provide for their basic needs. She requested a loan to purchase nylon, fishing nets and other materials. Jojeta hopes for this loan to help improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase nylon, fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Gelva

texts.en: Gelva is a 34 year old man with one child living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a restaurant and has been in business for a period of 4 years. He started the business with a loan from a financial institution and now his restaurant has developed at a very commendable rate as he now provides outside catering at parties and funerals. He now intends to diversify his business and venture into hiring out tents and chairs for functions since he has already established good relations with a number of customers. Gelva intends to use the loan to buy outdoor tents and chairs for outside catering.

loans.use: to buy tents and chairs for hiring.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a banker, and he has been in banking for eight years. His personal goals are educating his children for the university and building a permanent house for residence. Rashid intends to use the money to cement his house, since his children are always suffering from the flu due to the dust.

loans.use: to cement his house.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a single man. He describes himself to be a visionary and a determined man. He operates a retail store where he sells cereals such as maize, beans, green grams, sorghum, etc. He has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a strategically placed area, and his primary customers are retailers and wholesalers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for a business expansion. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits for building a house.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Muvulo

texts.en: Muthui is a 42 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years old. He describes himself to be visionary man. He operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation services. In addition, Muthui farms and runs a hotel.  He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located at a very busy area and his primary customers are retailers businesspersons. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of fuel and poor infrastructure of roads. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs and seeds for the farm. His business goal is to run a transportation industry within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits to run a new hardware to increase on his income.

loans.use: to buy farm equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Jilyn

texts.en:
Jilyn is 34 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.
Jilyn has a general store that sells a variety of products, like soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many other things. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more stock for her general store
Jilyn has been a member of PMPC for two months.  Jilyn hopes to own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 25-year-old married man. He has a son who is two years old. He describes himself as social and talkative. He operates a welding shop where he sells items such as doors and windows. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs one staff member. His business is located along a commercial town area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy metal. His business goal is to run a hardware store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits in paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy metal for welding.

loans.name: Leakena

texts.en:
Leakena is 42 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a dish washer for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. One of her children is employed and earns about $2 per day. 

Leakena wants to rebuild her house. With this goal in mind, Leakena is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at her home to earn more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 49 years old and lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Julita owns and manages a sari-sari store business. She sells items like eggs, soy sauce, vinegar, toiletries and canned goods. Julita is able to help provide for her family's daily needs through her business. She hopes to increase her profits and improve her family's living conditions. She plans to use her loan to buy additional items to sell such as flour, gasoline and canned goods. This will help increase Julita's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as flour, gasoline and canned goods.

loans.name: Sophanny

texts.en: Sophanny is 29 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a security guard who earns about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sophanny wants to run an additional business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase dirt to fill up her flooded land so she can grow vegetables. By doing so, she would generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she wants to build a fence around her house and build a bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to fill up her flooded land for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Ingris Joana

texts.es: Con su credikiva, Ingris compró insumos al por mayor como arroz, aceite, granos, carnes, verduras, entre otros, necesarios en la elaboración de la comida que vende en su restaurante “Delicias del Rancho”.  Con ello obtuvo descuentos por volumen, ganando así un poco más de dinero e incrementando el valor de sus inventarios.  Está aplicando a un nuevo crédito con el fin de adquirir un enfriador para almacenar verduras y carnes que le permitan mantener estos ingredientes frescos y conservados, además de seguir comprando al por mayor ya que con esta modalidad le ha ido muy bien.  Su mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida, deseo para ustedes y su familia mucha prosperidad”.
texts.en:
Ingris used her Kiva loan to buy supplies wholesale like rice, cooking oil, grains, meat, and vegetables, among others.  She needs these items to make the food that she sells in her restaurant, “Delicias del Rancho”.  By using the loan she got discounts for volume, which gave her a little extra money and increased the value of her inventory.

She is applying for a new loan to get a cooler to store vegetables and meat.  This will allow her to keep these ingredients fresh and preserved.  Also, she will continue buying wholesale because this has gone very well for her.

Her message to her Kiva lenders is the following, “I am very grateful for the help I have received.  I wish you and your families much prosperity.”

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies and a cooler to store ingredients she uses in the food she sells.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina  is married with ten children. Catalina is 70 years old and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City.
Catalina is engaged in buying and selling to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 for additional capital for her buy and sell business.
Catalina has been a member of PMPC for 6 year.  In the future, Catalina hope to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase additional working capital.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 41-year-old married man, who has been working in house painting for the last twelve years. He is a hard worker, who sacrifices his whole life to provide for his family's needs. 

Hassan is well known in the region with his good quality of work and accurate business. To improve his work and to update his type of work with all the new painting techniques, Hassan applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary tools for his business. 

In addition to his painting business, Hassan is employed at the KFC to support his family's income, in case work wasn't stable. 

Hassan will also use part of the loan to support his son's travel to Germany in the coming weeks. 

He hopes that one day his business with develop and improve a lot in a way that he can bring his son back home, and afford his living expenses.

loans.use: To buy tools for his painting business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
