She owns one hectare of farming land where she grows mango. She frequently harvests this fruit to sell it to the wholesalers of her area. On top of this, she breeds poultry that she sells once they have reached a good level of development. Her eldest son helps her with both activities.

Adela wants to buy fertilizers to use them in her plantation of mango, and this is why she has deemed convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN that will help her achieve her goal.

Adela is a rather homely woman, and she is respected in her community, because she is considered a responsible and hard-working woman. She has received another loan, which has been founded through Kiva, and she has proven herself to be punctual and responsible with her repayments. She is thankful to the people who have helped them in that occasion, and she also thanks in advance all the people that will help her with her new loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Xaqani

texts.en:
Xaqani is a 32-year-old man who is married with two children. He breeds cattle and sells them for meat to local butchers. Xaqani has more than 5 years of experience in this field thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after cattle.

Xaqani usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months, and resells them for profit in the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings 260 AZN income per month. People use beef in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always in yoghurt sauce.
 
Xagani is the only person earning income in his family and his income is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Xaqani applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase three baby calves.

loans.use: to buy three baby calves

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is 49 and married with two sons. He has bred livestock from very young age. Thanks to his father, who taught him the best, he already has 20 years of experience. Over the years, Aziz has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

He purchases calves in the central livestock market and raises them. After fattening the animals he resells them for a profit at the livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.  

Aziz's business requires a lot of physical strength because he spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals. 

His monthly income is 150 AZN. Aziz wishes to increase his income. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to devote to his business and cover the market. For this purpose he has applied for 900 AZN. He will use the loan to buy one head of cattle and 5 sheep.

loans.use: to buy one head of cattle and 5 sheep.

loans.name: Jorum

texts.en: Jorum is 32 years old and from Nakuru, Kenya. He is married with three children who are all in school. Jorum has a cereals business that he has been doing for the past four years. This is the first time he has applied for a loan from Kadet Ltd. The loan will enable him buy more rice, beans, green-grams and other cereals to add to his stock. Jorum hopes to boost his business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, green-grams, and other cereals.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with four children and all of them attend school. She is looking after her sister and brother.

She has been selling charcoal from home for the last five years at retail, working seven days a week. She also sells piped water to the neighbors.

She has requested a loan of UShs 2,500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include the high costs she has to incur in transporting the charcoal from upcountry to the market and also thieves. 

Her dream is to make sure that the profits enable her to build rental houses and also to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation. She joined MCDT because of the timely loans and the good customer care and also the low interest rates. 

She lives in a family house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosalina tiene un negocio de venta de refrescos el cual está ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace 13 años siendo este negocio el sustento de su familia.

La señora Rosalina inicia a laborar los refrescos a las 6 am en su casa de habitación, posteriormente se traslada a su puesto de venta para su comercialización.
 
Cabe mencionar que la señora se siente muy agradecida con los créditos que CEPRODEL le ha brindado porque ha logrado incrementar su inventario con productos populares además de la venta de refrescos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalina has, for 13 years now, a business selling soft drinks, which is located in one of the markets in the city of Leon, to support her family.  Mrs. Rosalina starts to work the refreshments at 6 am at her home, and later moves to her stall for selling.   
It is noteworthy that she is very grateful for the loans because CEPRODEL has given her the opportunity to increase her inventory with popular products in addition to the sale of soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase chlorine, ace, soap, maggi soup, sugar, cocoa, seed, etc..

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 28-year-old mixed crop farmer. She is married to James who is also a farmer and they are blessed with three children ages 6, 5 and 2 years old, respectively. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family members. 

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Lydia will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings and she will also buy pesticides with the rest of the money. With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate her children. 

She hopes to build a better house for her family and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 62-year-old mixed crop farmer. She is widowed with two adult children. She has been in the farming business for the past 30 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mercy will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children up to university level. 

She hopes to export the farm's produce to other markets which will help her improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is twenty years old and married. He runs a business selling new clothes and shoes. His business has been in operation for four years and earns him a monthly income of five thousand shillings (KES).

This will be his first loan with KADET and he plans to use it to purchase more new clothes for resale. He hopes to expand the business with the profits gained from the business. 

In the future he would want to buy a plot and have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more new clothes for sale to expand the business.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is thirty years old and married. He runs a mixed farming business which has been in operation for five years. He earns a monthly income of eighty thousand shillings (80,000 KES). 

This will be his first loan with KADET and he plans to use it to purchase feed and piglets to rear and resell in the future. He will use the anticipated profits to add more savings to his KADET account and increase his stock of cows and pigs. 

He hopes to own a big farm of poultry and pigs in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets to expand his business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 58, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is the mother of seven children and is married to Oscar, a sidecar operator. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Evelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evelyn dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is a 35-year-old man who lives with his family in the outer ger (a type of wooden dwelling) district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. He has a son who attends secondary school. His wife works as a technologist while he works at local private company. 

In Mongolia the winter season is very cold, and the ger district last even basic infrastructure. The average winter temperature is -30 Celcius (-22 Farenheit) but sometimes it reaches -40 Celcius (-40 Farenheit) and Ganbat's current house is very old when the weather is cold outside. In both winter and summer the house loses warmth very quickly, so Ganbat needs to do some renovation oh his house.  

Ganbat is planning to install parquet floor, recover the ceiling, and add vacuum windows, all of which will help protect the family from chilling. He is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase essential construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase essential building materials in order to protect his house in the frozen season.

loans.name: Elbegsaikhan

texts.en:
Elbegsaikhan is a 31-year-old who has two children and lives with his family in the outer ger district, an area which lacks basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia.  

He is a very experienced builder and works as a head of his construction brigade. He has a few workers and he is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to give a salary to his employees and use for their lunch for few days. 

After he is done with the building, he will receive his salary from the subscriber who ordered the building.

loans.use: to pay salaries to his construction employees.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 40-year-old married man with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

For twenty years he has been operating a retail shop after diverting from selling clothes. Inadequate capital to purchase stock is the main hardship the client is facing. 

James intends to use the loan is to buy sugar to sell.

His dream is to build a permanent residential house and his business goal is to expand his business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy sugar to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
This is Narcisa, a married resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Together with her children she manages the household while working. She works hard to continually earn enough money to cover their everyday expenses.

Narcisa sells processed meats. What she basically does is buy processed meat from a wholesaler, then sell it piecemeal at retail. Products can range from ham, hotdogs, processed pork and other meats like this. Her neighbors and the local community buy from her due to her low prices and the many options she offers. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP a day.

To keep her business running, Narcisa is requesting a 18,000 PHP loan from CCT. She wants to buy a greater volume and variety of meat to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

All CCT community clients are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

Narcisa hopes to be able to expand her business soon, as she dreams of giving her children a good, high-quality education through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a greater volume and variety of meat to sell.

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo para surtir el negocio de la mercadería necesaria, como lo es utensilios de cocina, ropero, plancha industrial, plancha para ropa, vajillas de vidrio entre otros que son necesarios para ofrecer a los clientes, espera tener un buen resultado de la presente inversión.
El considera que con el préstamo anterior ha generado una mejor ganancia ha mantenido su hogar en buenas condiciones y con ello ha logrado pagar el préstamo anterior, en su familia sus condiciones están mejorando poco a poco y espera que a través del tiempo siga estando mejor.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to stock his business with necessary merchandise, such as kitchen utensils, a clothing wardrobe, industrial iron, clothes iron, and glass dishes,among other items which he needs to offer his customers. He hopes to have a good result from this investment. 

He believes that thanks to the the previous loan, he has generated better earnings and has maintained his home in good condition, and with this he has also been able to pay off the previous loan. Within his family, their conditions are improving little by little, and he hopes that over time they will continue to get better.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, a clothing wardrobe, industrial iron, clothing iron, etc.

loans.name: Genny Esperanza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Genny, Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 9, 7 y 4 años  de edad, los dos mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga  es una ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza los créditos para el negocio de él,  el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras  y legumbres, ventas que realiza de forma ambulante, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que tres días de la semana él se desplaza a la  ciudad de Manta donde  recorre en su triciclo vendiendo los productos que lleva, sus productos son frescos y recién salidos del campo ya que les compra a agricultores de la zona para luego lleva a Manta aunque también ciertos productos  los compra a mayoristas en Manta.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque para obtener los créditos no les piden tantos requisitos como en otras partes. 

Su sueño es tener una casa más grande.
texts.en:
La Sequita is a Communal Bank that meets up in the parish of La Sequita, which is part of Montecristi in the prosperous canton of Manabita. The residents are dedicated hardworking people who are proud of their roots. In the parish of La Sequita, the people are honest and know only how to work and take care of their families.

Genny lives here. She is 35 years old, she is married and she has three children aged 9, 7 and 4; her two older children go to school. Her husband is a retailer.

Our friend is a housewife who asks for loan to help her husband in his activity: he is a street vendor, selling fruits, vegetables and pulses. Our friend told us that he drives his three-wheel bike to the town of Manta three days a week to sell his products. The products he sells are always fresh and just harvested from the fields, as he buys them from farmers of his area to then bring them to Manta; however, he also buys some products from wholesalers in Manta.

The loan she is requesting will be used by her husband to buy fruits, vegetables and pulses. She is a founding member of her Communal Bank and she likes it because the requisites they ask her to grant her a loan are not as many as those asked by other institutions.

She dreams of owning a bigger house.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and pulses.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 30 years old. She has five children who all go to school. She has spent five years in the business of selling clothes. With the loan, she plans to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 45-year-old married woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She owns a shop she opened five years ago with her own savings. Her shop is well frequented as there are many tourists in the area. Inadequate capital to buy more stock and theft are the main challenges she faces.

Christine is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy more African fabric to sell. Her ambitions are to expand her business into new markets and hire employees to help out. She also wants to build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy more African fabric to sell.

loans.name: Aurita

texts.en:
This is Aurita, 38, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. Her husband is Mark, a laborer, and she is a mother to her three children. Together with her husband, Aurita manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Aurita operates a buy and sell business. She buys general merchandise (such as men's and women's clothes) from wholesalers, then sells it with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy from Aurita due to her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aurita earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Aurita hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and draw her family more closely to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory such as ready-to-wear men's and women's clothes

loans.name: Sonia Imelda

texts.es:
Sonia madre soltera de dos niños abrió hace 8 años su negocio propio en la parroquia de Rio Verde dentro de Santo Domingo, Ecuador. Santo Domingo es la tercera ciudad en tamaño de población después de Guayaquil y Quito, esta, durante los últimos 15 años ha experimentado un boom económico lo cual ha servido como motor para el desarrollo de la región donde se encuentra. Santo Domingo se encuentra en un lugar estratégico de ecuador que une la Sierra y la Costa a través de una carretera que empieza al nivel del mar cruza toda la cordillera y termina por sobre los 2600 metros de altura. Debido a esta ubicación céntrica, Santo Domingo ha acostumbrado a ser un punto de convergencia entre las múltiples culturas que conviven en Ecuador, Sonia comenta como el barrio donde vive es muy diverso ya que hay indígenas, afro ecuatorianos, mestizos etc.  Desafortunadamente no todo ha sido bueno para la ciudad en estos últimos años, acompañado de este crecimiento económico acelerado Santo Domingo también ha sufrido de los efectos del crimen y el narcotráfico.
De esta ciudad sale Sonia, ella trabaja en su taller de costura entre 8 y 10 horas al día y aparte de eso emplea a otras dos personas. Este es el primer crédito que Sonia solicita y piensa utilizarlo en la compra de telas, ya que utiliza estas como materia prima para producir una variedad de artículos y accesorios de vestir. Sonia considera que el crédito la ayudara a expandir su capacidad de producción y así no solo podrá abastecer a más clientes si no que también podrá emplear a otra persona más. Sonia realmente disfruta lo que hace y además es muy buena en ello, las destrezas necesarias las aprendió desde chiquita ya que su familia trabajaba en lo mismo. Si Sonia consigue el dinero necesario y cumple su sueño no solo mejorara la calidad de vida de ella y sus dos hijos si no también la de las personas a quienes ella contrata.
texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother with two children. Eight years ago, she opened her own business in the parish of Rio Verde in Santo Domingo, Ecuador. Santo Domingo is the third largest city in terms of population, behind Guayaquil and Quito. Within the last 15 years, this city has experienced an economic boom which has helped to drive development in the region. Santo Domingo is located in a strategic area of Ecuador with mountains on one side and the coast on the other. A highway links both areas by starting at sea level and stretches the entire length until it ends at about 2,600 meters above sea level. Due to its central location, Santo Domingo is accustomed to being a point of convergence among the various cultures that live in Ecuador. Sonia says that the neighborhood where she lives is very diverse and includes people with indigenous, Afro-Ecuadorian, Mestizo, and other ethnic roots. Unfortunately, not everything has been good for the city in recent years. Along with the rapid economic growth that Santo Domingo has experience, the city has also suffered from the effects of crime and narcotics trafficking.

Sonia is from this city. She works in her sewing workshop between 8 to 10 hours each day and employs two other people. This is the first loan she has requested and plans to use the money to buy fabrics. She will use these materials to produce a variety of garments and accessories to wear. Sonia considers the loan to be a help in expanding her production capacity, which will enable her to serve more customers and also hire another person. Sonia really enjoys what she does and is also very good at it. The skills she learned as a little girl have enabled her to work and support her family. If Sonia secures the necessary funds, she will be able to fulfill her dream of improving the quality of life for her and her two children, as well as for the people who work for her.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
This is Lucrecia, 51, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while working to earn enough money to cover her everyday expenses.

Lucrecia runs a mineral water station. She sells five-gallon containers of mineral water to her customers, who are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, Lucrecia is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan from CCT. She will use the loan to upgrade her facilities and buy more water to expand capacity. She expects a boost in her income as she grows her business year by year.

All CCT community clients are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to upgrade her facilities and buy more water to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a twenty-six-year-old single mother living in Kasese,Uganda. The sole responsibility of providing for the family rests on her. She has been dealing in crude salt for five years. The salt is extracted directly from the lake.

Her hardships are price fluctuations and inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and seasonal weather. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house. Her business goals are to diversify by buying land to grow crops and processing the salt. In the meantime, Jackline wants money to buy salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Nelly Victoria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nelly. Tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, solo su hija menor vive con ella en su casa. Su marido trabaja en un taxi que es de su propiedad en Manta.

Nuestra amiga es una ama de casa que para tener sus propios ingresos y ayudar con los gastos familiares decidió hace ya más de 6 años dedicarse a la venta de sabanas y edredones. Trabaja tres días a la semana vendiendo su mercadería, la misma que ofrece a sus conocidos o clientes nuevos que tengan referencia de los clientes que ya tiene, hace esto porque ella  deja a crédito y no quiere inconvenientes con los cobros, los mismos que realiza cada quince días. La mercadería la compra en Picoaza.
P>
Este crédito es para comprar más sabanas y edredones ya que tiene muy poco y necesita para los pedidos que tiene. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y está muy contenta por eso ya que gracias a los créditos que recibe de la Fundación ha podido mejorar su situación a través de su negocio.

Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
La Sequita is a Communal Bank that meets up in the parish of La Sequita, which is part of Montecristi in the prosperous canton of Manabita. The residents are dedicated hardworking people who are proud of their roots. In the parish of La Sequita, the people are honest and know only how to work and take care of their families.

Nelly lives here. She is 55 years old, she is married and she has 6 grown-up children; only her youngest daughter lives in her house. Her husband owns a taxi he works with in the town of Manta.

Our friend is a housewife who decided to sell sheets and duvets more than 6 years ago in order to earn her own income and to help paying for her family’s expenses. She works three days a week selling her products to her acquaintances and to new clients, provided that they have been recommended by her hold customers: the reason she does this is that she sells on credit and she doesn’t want to have problems when she cashes in once every fortnight. She buys her products in Picoaza.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more sheets and duvets because she does not have enough items to satisfy the orders she has received. She has been a member of her Communal Bank since it started its activity and she is very happy about it because thanks to the loans she has received form the Fundación she has been able to improve her standard of living and her activity.

She dreams of finishing building her house.

loans.use: To buy sheets and duvets.

loans.name: Zebra Group

texts.en: Joseph wants a loan to buy general merchandise such salt and sugar. He is 41 years old and is charged with a responsibility of taking care of his 6 children and wife. Price fluctuations, thieves and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock are his major challenges. He desires to buy land and grow his crops as well as educate his children. He is a member of Zebra group, where members guarantee each other in order to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 34-year-old widow with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the salon business for 20 months in which she started with 500,000 shillings and now has 3 million shillings as working capital. Her hardship is inadequate capital to meet the different tastes of her customers. Her personal goal is educating children and her business goal is hiring employees to help expand the business. Florence wants money to buy hair dryers and braids for the salon.

loans.use: to buy dryers and hair braids for the salon.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda, in a rental house with access to electricity and piped water. She is married with three children, and all of them attend school. She also looks after her father and mother. 

Betty has been selling wholesale African attire (bitenge) for the last 4 years from a shop that she rents, working six days a week. She generates additional income by selling women new shoes. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent, and her challenges include high, unstable prices and the seasonality of the market.

Betty joined MCDT because she did not have enough capital to do meaningful business. She has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more African attire to sell. Her dream is to be able to buy in bulk and enjoy the benefits of the economy of scale, and then to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy African attire for resale.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 31 years old. She sells dairy products and she has spent one year doing so. The loan will be used to buy more milk to sell. With the profits from the business, Alphonsine will provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is a 25-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling salt for 4 years. His hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goals are educating children, building a permanent house and upgrading in his studies, while his business goals are buying land to grow crops, moving his business to a more permanent location and expanding business into new markets. Bahati wants money to buy salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt for sale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 40-year-old single mother of four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling salt for 15 years. Her hardships are seasonal weather, price fluctuations and inflation. Her personal goals are educating children and building a permanent house for residence. Business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding business into new markets. Margret wants money to buy salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt for sale.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Doña Bernarda, reside en el departamento de Masaya, casada, su núcleo familiar lo conforman su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella es comerciante posee un negocio (pulpería) desde hace 15 años, el cual ha sido su medio de trabajo y gracias a eso ha sacado adelante a su familia junto con su esposo, comenzó con capital propio, las ventas que realiza son de contado. Actualmente esta necesitando invertirle al negocio en la compra de arroz, aceite, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, maseca, maggi, jugos, jabón marfil, papel higiénico, sardina, sal, entre otros. Por lo que se acerca a nuestra oficina ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo que le permita reabastecer más su pulpería. Ya que ella comenta que es un negocio que esta siempre en constante rotación.

Considera que esta ayuda que le da ceprodel le ha servido de mucho para mejorar su negocio,  ha obtenido un buen servicio, y ha logrado dar una mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Bernarda lives in the department of Masaya. She is married. Her immediate family is made up of her husband and her three children. She is a merchant and has owned a business (a convenience store) for 15 years. The store has been her means of work and thanks to that business, she and her husband have moved their family ahead. She started the business with her own capital and she makes cash sales. Currently she needs to invest in the purchase of rice, oil, beans, corn, sugar, corn meal, instant soups and sauces, juices, Ivory soap, toilet paper, sardines and salt, among other items for her store.  For this reason she went to the office of Kiva´s partner, Ceprodel to request a new loan, a loan that will allow her to better stock her convenience store. She needs to restock often, she comments, since hers is a business that always rotates inventory quickly. 

She believes that the help that Ceprodel has provided her has played a big role in improving her business. She has received excellent service from Ceprodel and has succeeded in making her family more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, beans, corn, sugar, corn meal, instant soups and sauces, juices, soap,  toilet paper, sardines and salt, among other items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 56-year-old woman widowed with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is into the transport business and she got money to buy a motorcycle after getting profits from fish sales. She has been in the business for two years and she has not met any major hardships. Her dream is to build a permanent residential house and to buy at least six motorcycles for the business. The purpose of the loan is to buy another motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for her business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima lives in Msambweni, Kenya, with her husband and their five children, whose ages are between 11 and 19. She has a retail shop business where she sells food, groceries, beverages and basic supplies that housewives buy in small quantities every day. She has had her business for 5 years and it is run by herself and her husband. One notes the store’s visible improvements due to this couple’s fine management. 

Their philosophy of service makes them very well known in the area they serve and their customer base is growing every day. However, their daily working capital is insufficient for the projected growth they have as their principal goal. This is the reason they approached Yehu Microfinance Trust so that they can buy a variety of merchandise that has the greatest turnover. Such a supply of goods would be significant for their daily growth.

Halima’s dream is to establish a branch of her business, since her experience indicates that her family can progress only in an orderly way. This is her plan so that her children will have the greatest sense of well being possible, thereby increasing their likelihood of a successful future. Her greatest challenge is the daily transportation of her products, since it is not easy to find an available vehicle to borrow; consequently in the future she plans to have her own.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise for her retail shop.

loans.name: Suyapa Isabel

texts.es: Suyapa tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y un hijastro con quienes vive en un barrio del municipio de San Marcos Santa Bárbara. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, siempre le ha gustado el comercio, actualmente vende ropa nueva y usada para adultos y niños, como ser vestidos, blusas, pantalones y ropa interior. Este negocio lo ha mantenido estable desde hace 4 años al que le ha invertido varios préstamos. Este préstamo que solicita ahora es de 12,000.00, con el cual va comprar mercadería nueva para vender y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. También le ayudara a expandir su negocio, ya que su sueño es aumentar sus ingresos para ayudar a sus  hijos  y a su madre.
texts.en:
Suyapa, age 48, is a single mother.  She has two sons and a stepson with whom she lives in a neighborhood in the San Marcos Santa Bárbara municipality.

She is a very hard-working person, and she has always liked commerce.  She currently sells new and used clothes for adults and children.  She sells things like dresses, blouses, pants, and underwear.  She has kept this business stable for four years, and she has invested several loans into the business.

She will use the loan for 12,000 lempiras that she is now requesting to buy new merchandise to sell and to fill her customers’ orders.  It will also help her to expand her business.

Her dream is to increase her income in order to help her children and her mother.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the University. He has been running a pub business for the last ten years and is facing hardships of price fluctuations and inflation. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and buying modern furniture for the pub so as to attract more customers. Lawrence needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Zepher

texts.en: Zepher is a 50-year-old married man with 8 children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling clothes for 13 years. His hardships are inadequate capital to meet the different preferences of customers, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating children and buying a car, while his business goals are buying land to grow crops and moving his business to a more permanent location. Zepher wants money to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie, 46, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Henry, her business partner, and a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosemarie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosemarie hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She takes care of additional family members (sister and grandchildren). She has been selling secondhand clothes retail in the market for the last 10 years, working seven days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to buy more bales of secondhand clothes for resale. Her major business challenges include the high costs of transportation and the ever increasing prices of used clothes.  She is aspiring of seeing her business grow by opening another outlet, to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She joined MCDT to be able to improve her standard of living. She rents a house with access to electricity but without piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en:
Bonefance is a thirty-six-year-old married man who has the personal goals of educating his children, buying a car and building a permanent house for a residence. He has a butcher shop and has also been a mixed farmer for eight years now. His main hardships are seasonal weather, high fuel and transportation costs and customers not paying on time. 

However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include a retail shop, expanding his business to new markets and hiring employees to help expand his business. Bonefance needs a loan to buy one heifer for selling in his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy one heifer for sell in his butcher.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a forty-five-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house for a residence. He is a motorcyclist and the business is lucrative despite the hardships of high fuel costs and mechanical breakdowns. 

He has a vision of buying land to grow crops and of owning at least three motorcycles. Peter needs a loan to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has 6 children. She lives in Samburu, Kenya. She generates her own income by selling farm products of maize and fresh vegetables.

She started her business approximately 15 years ago. As a mother, and the head of the household, her biggest challenge is to provide and meet the needs of her children until she achieves her dream of seeing them become successful people; they are the impetus for her to continually work. 

Her joy and dynamism help her succeed in her business, but she needs to increase her business capital to achieve her goal of generating more income. This is why she is requesting her first Kiva loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust, with which she will buy farm inputs to be used in farming and bulls for use in plowing. 

She needs disposable income to purchase her farm tools to enable her to produce more products and to offer her clients more products. This will result in the success of her investment and will be the advancement she needs to be able to achieve her dreams of the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to be used in farming and bulls for use in plowing.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman, and she has five children between the ages of 2 and 15. She sells charcoal from her home to her potential customers, composed of her neighbors, family and referred customers. Her business is an important source of income for her household, as is the income her husband earns through his farm produce sales. Martha always tries to meet her customers' demands. 

Her dream for the future is to open a store to the general public and diversify to other businesses. While she builds on her dream she will continue to make an effort to find sales that will impact her income, to generate a profit margin no less than 35%, and to keep her inventory rotation schedule of 10 days. 

Her Kiva loan is the second loan she has had with Yehu Microfinance Trust (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she plans to purchase sacks of charcoal. Her clients have placed orders and this predicts a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married and the mother of 1 child. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. It was there, 2 years ago, that Maria decided to set up her business of selling the kinds of products that her neighbors wanted. She sold wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. The earnings from the business have provided her with an independent income. 

She normally sells on credit and she can't always stretch her income to cover new orders, so she's applying to Yehu Microfinance Trust for a loan. This is her first loan, and it will provide the working capital she needs to support the business. She will buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and rice, and get discounts so that she can pass the savings along to her own customers. 

Maria's goal is to establish real estate houses. She also wants to provide her child with a good education so that he can be successful in the future. She is working hard to reach her goals, working no less than 30% of each day, because that's what it takes to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and rice.

loans.name: Kabende Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
Dennis is a twenty-nine-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house. He has been selling clothes for the last five years and the business is beneficial despite the hardships of price fluctuations, inflation and high fuel and transportation costs. He has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and owning a boutique in the city.

Dennis need a loan to buy more clothes for resale. He is a member of the above mentioned group. Some of the members needed larger loan amounts, so they graduated to individual loans. That is why there are fewer members than before.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en: Norman wants a loan to buy clothes to sell in Masindi-Uganda. He is aged 37 and charged with the responsibility of taking care of his two children and wife. Price fluctuations and thieves are his major challenge. He desires to educate his children up to the university level and hire employees to expand his business to new areas.

loans.use: to  buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a thirty-eight year old married man with four children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been driving a taxi for seventeen years. His hardships are seasonal customers, high fuel and transport costs. 

His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house. His business goals are to expand his business into new markets and diversify his business to include a retail shop. Ben wants money to buy tires for his taxi.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and lives with seven family members; two of  whom he works with.

Hasan is a sports trainer. In 2005 he opened his own bodybuilding gym. He has excellent experience in the field, a deep understanding of local customers, and he knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 youth loan in order to pay the annual rent for his gym. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his gym.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Marco, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que se le ha presentado inconveniente con su vehículo en el cual transporta la mercadería de su negocio, este préstamo lo utilizara a en el pago de la reparación del mismo ya que quiere contar con un buen medio de transporte seguro y cómodo para seguir trabajando.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior ha tenido un avance pues invirtio en la mercadería, de la cual ha surgido una mejor ganancia para mejorar la situación en su familia.
texts.en:
Marco is requesting another loan because he has had a problem with his vehicle, which he uses to transport merchandise for his business.  He will use this loan to pay for repairs because he wants to have a good and comfortable means of reliable transportation to continue working.

He says that he took a step forward with the previous loan because he invested in merchandise from which he got better profits to improve his family's situation.

loans.use: to repair his work vehicle.

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Máximo tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a uno de sus hijos que todavía depende económicamente de el. La localidad en donde reside es una de las poblaciones que conforman el área rural del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola ubicada en la región Piura.

Se dedica a la venta de miel, algarrobina y dulces de leche (tofees) de forma ambulante, recorriendo los caseríos aledaños a su zona. También se dedica a la crianza de ganado caprino y aves de corral, los cuales una vez que alcanzan el peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en mercado local. Su esposa lo apoya en todas estas actividades.

Máximo desea adquirir insumos para la elaboración de sus productos y también alimentos balanceados para sus animales. Con estas actividades el espera crecer como empresario y mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo Máximo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles.

Máximo siempre ha sido una persona trabajadora y responsable.  Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto. El agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con él a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Maximo is 65 years old.  He’s married and lives with his wife and one of his children who still depends on him financially.  The area where he lives is one of the settlements that make up the rural center of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone located in the Piura region.
 
He sells honey, algarrobina, and milk candy (toffee) on foot.  He also raises goats, and corral birds, which he sells them in the local market once they reach the ideal size and weight.  His wife supports him in all of these activities.

Maximo wants to buy balanced feed for his animals and supplies for making his products.  He expects to grow as an entrepreneur through these activities and improve his quality of life.  Maximo has requested a loan of 1,600 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

Maximo has always been a hardworking and responsible person.  Those who know him have a great amount of admiration and respect for him.  He appreciates those who have helped out through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
El Joven José Ramón  es casado y labora para una empresa de la ciudad de león como obrero en la planta de soplado desde hace 2 años, dicho  trabajo lo realiza para llevar el sustento de su familia.

El joven se acerco a las oficinas de CEPRODEL ya que tenia la necesidad de comprar un electrodoméstico para mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
The youthful Jose Ramon is married and has been a worker in a glass blowing plant in the city of Leon for the last 2 years. He does this work so that he can bring home the necessities to sustain his family.

The young man has approached the offices of CEPRODEL because he needs to buy kitchen appliances in order to improve the conditions of life in his home.

loans.use: to buy necessary kitchen appliances for his house.

loans.name: Gulsun

texts.ru: Гулсун 43 года, замужем, воспитала 5 детей. Гулсун в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, 1989 года начала  заниматься разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес с покупки 10 овец, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  Гулсун имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 20 овец, и 3 лошади,  что приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом. Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Гулсун обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец с целью откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Гулсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Gulsun is 43 years old, married, and has raised five children.  In 1989, Gulsun began breeding livestock as her family's main source of income.  Gulsun started her business with the purchase of 10 sheep, and thanks to her hard work, today she has two cows, 20 sheep, and three horses, which bring her a monthly profit of 8,000 som.  

Having come to the conclusion that this is a profitable business, Gulsun applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som for the purchase of sheep, which she plans to fatten and sell.  Gulsun plans to invest the income from the loan in further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Chynarkul

texts.ru: Чынаркул 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Чынаркул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1997 года начала  заниматься разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес с суммы 8,000 сом, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  Чынаркул имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 10 овец, и 1  бычка,  что приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков с целью откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Чынаркул планирует вложить в оплату контракта на обучение сына, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Chynarkul is 39 years old, married, and is raising three children.  Chynarkul started her livestock breeding business in 1997 as her family's main source of income.  She started her business with 8,000 som and thanks to her hard work, today Chynarkul has 2 cows, 10 sheep, and one bull-calf, which bring her a monthly income of 8,000 som.  

With the goal of further developing her business, Chynarkul applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som for purchasing bull-calves, which she will fatten and sell.  Chynarkul is planning to use the income from her loan to pay her son's tuition and to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jiydegul

texts.ru:
Жийдегул 52 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. Жийдегул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1990 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 1,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня  хозяйство Жийдегул насчитывает 1 корову, 1 лошадь, 5 овец. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жийдегул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Жийдегул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Jiydegul is 52 years old, married, and has two children.  Jiydegul began her animal husbandry business in 1990 as her family's main source of income.  Jiydegul started her business with 1,000 som and today she has one cow, one horse, and five sheep.  

In hopes of further developing her business, Jiydegul applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional cattle.  Jiydegul is planning to invest the income from her loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Розе 50 лет, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. Роза работает в управлении местного хозяйства села Тамга и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес в 2006 году с суммы 15,000 сом, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  Роза имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 10 овец, и 1  бычка,  что приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков с целью откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Roza is 50 years old, married, and has raised three children.  Roza works in the village of Tamga's local economic office and, as a source of additional income for her family, she breeds cattle.  She started her business in 2006 with 15,000 som and thanks to her hard work, today Roza has two cows, 10 sheep, and one bull-calf, which bring her a monthly profit of 10,000 som.

With the goal of further developing her business, Roza applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of bull-calves, which she will fatten and sell.  Roza plans to invest the income from her loan in growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 40 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей, младшему из которых 9 лет. Гулмира работает в школе села Ара-Кол учителем и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес в 1997 году с суммы 5,000 сом, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  Гулмира имеет в хозяйстве 3 коровы, 45 овец, 1 козу и 3 лошади,  что приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец с целью откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства, чтобы оплатить контракт на обучение старшей дочери Алтынай.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 40 years old, married, and is raising four children, the youngest of whom is 9.  Gulmira is a school teacher in the village of Ara-Kol.   Gulmira breeds cattle as a supplemental source of income for her family.  She started her business in 1997 with 5,000 som and, thanks to her hard work, today she has three cows, 45 sheep, one goat, and three horses, which bring her a monthly profit of 10,000 som.  

In hopes of further developing her business, Gulmira applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 130,000 som for purchasing sheep, which she will fatten and sell.  Gulmira plans to invest the income from her loan in increasing her herd in order to pay tuition for her oldest daughter, Altynai.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is aged 33. She sells clothes and has been a business woman for the past two years. She has requested the loan to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chhuon's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Thmor Koul district, Chhuon is aged 45 year old and married. She has five children, four of whom are still dependent on her and at school. Rice farming is her family's only source of income - which she has been in for almost twenty years. The main challenge for her family's business is the lack of working capital to support her business. 

Chhuon has been with VisionFund for ten loan cycles while her group member Kong has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the past loans, which have enabled her to better support her living. After having been with VisionFund for many years, she is confident she will make her living better. Now leading her group of two to apply for another loan of 1,000,000KHR each, Chhuon, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to make more rice and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Marigrace

texts.en:
This is Marigrace, 31, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pepito, a security guard, and mother of her children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marigrace operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Marigrace earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is also in her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marigrace hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Francisco Cesar

texts.es:
Francisco, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio ya que quiere comprarse los repuestos necesarios para reparar un freezer, el cual utiliza para almacenar el producto, este préstamo ayudará a mantener las condiciones de sus herramientas, que son el apoyo para que sus productos se mantenga en buen estado.
En manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior aumentó sus ganancias las cuales le ha generado una mejor condición económica para él y para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is requesting a new loan to invest in his business because he wants to purchase the parts necessary to repair a freezer which he uses to store his products. This loan will help to maintain the proper temperature of his freezer, which ensures that his products are kept in good condition.

He states that the previous loan increased his profits, which have created a better economic situation for himself and his family.

loans.use: to repair a freezer

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 37 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Гулмира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес в 2002 году с суммы 5,000 сом, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день  Гулмира имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 5 овец, 1 козу, а также 0,6 га земли, где она выращивает картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку минеральных удобрений и семян картофеля.  Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 37 years old, married, and is raising two children.  Gulmira breeds livestock and this is her family's main source of income.   She started her business in 2002 with 5,000 som and, thanks to her hard work, today Gulmira has two cows, five sheep, and one goat.  Gulmira also has 0.6 ha of land where she grows potatoes.  

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulmira applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and potato seed.  Gulmira plans to invest the income from her loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seed

loans.name: Minovar

texts.ru: Миновар 51 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Миновар в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается разведением скота. Начав этот бизнес в 2005 году с суммы 10,000 сом, благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день, хозяйство   Миновар приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц в продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Миновар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Миновар планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Minovar is 51 years old, married, and is raising three children.  Minovar breeds cattle and this is her family's main source of income.  She started this business in 2005 and, thanks to her hard work, today her business earns a monthly profit of 15,000 som from the sale of dairy and meat products.  

With the goal of further developing her business, Minovar applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional head of cattle.  Minovar plans to invest the income from her loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, two of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional members of the family. She rents a house with access to electricity but without piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent. 

Harriet has been selling passion fruits for the last ten years in the market and sometimes door-to-door, working seven days a week. She earns additional income from selling secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges include high unstable prices, seasonality in the supply of passion fruits and having to move from door-to-door when sales are low in the market. 

Harriet has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to buy more sacks of passion fruits and clothes for sale. Her dream is to be able to buy in bulk and become a wholesaler, and also to build her own house. She joined MCDT because the staff cares.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of passion fruits and used clothes

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es: El señor Medardo tiene 30 años oriundo de Santa Cruz, casado, es de ocupación carpintero, trabaja en su propio taller ubicado en el mismo barrio donde  vive, hace unos cinco años se dedica a esta labor, el destino del crédito es para la compra de madera al por mayor, el Sr. Medardo es una persona muy trabajadora el trabaja en compañía de su pareja quien le ayuda en el taller ya que esta es la unica actividad que le permite mantener a su famiulia, en la foto se encuentra en  compañía de su pareja, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Medardo is 30 years old, a native of Santa Cruz and married. He is a carpenter and works in his own shop, which is located in the same neighborhood where he lives. He has done this work for the past five years. 

His loan will be used to purchase wood wholesale. Sr. Medardo is a very hardworking person. He works with his partner who helps in the shop. This is the only job which enables him to support his family. In the photo he is shown with his wife. He is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided him

loans.use: to purchase wood wholesale.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, por que inicia una nueva temporada en la siembra de maíz y pipían, para ello necesita comprarse el abono, la semilla, los herbicidas y también preparar el terreno este dinero le servirá para cubrir estos gastos y continuar realizando su trabajo.
El efecto que ha tenido con el préstamo anterior ha sido positivo, porque realizó una buena inversión aunque sus cosechas estuvieron un poco malas debido al invierno, pero aún así está motivado y espera esta nueva siembra sea mejor, sus condiciones en el hogar se ha mantenido.
texts.en:
Ricardo is requesting a new loan because he is starting a new season with his corn and pipian [squash] crops. Because of this, he needs to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicides and also prepare the land. These funds will allow him to cover these expenses and continue doing his work. 

The effect that he has experienced with his previous loan has been positive, because he made a good investment, although his harvests were a little bit poor due to the winter, but he is still motivated and hopes that this new harvest will be better. The conditions in his household have stayed the same.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia esta casada,  su esposo trabaja como contratista y la esta apoyando en todo momento, sus dos hijos van en secundaria y la hija mayor esta en preparatorio. Su propósito es estar mejor y sin miedo a que le ocurra algo malo para poder estar con su familia.
La Sra. patricia necesita una operación de la vesícula ya que desde hace tiempo tiene problemas de salud y con la ayuda de esta operación su bienestar puede mejorar ya que cuenta con el motor de vida que son sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Patricia is married. Her husband works as a contractor and has always been very supportive of her. Two of her children attend middle school and her oldest, a daughter, is in high school. Her aim is to get better, and not to fear that something bad could happen to her, so that she can be with her family.

Sra. Patrica needs a gallbladder operation since she has had health problems for some time.  With this operation, her health will improve because she has her children, who are the engine of life for her.

loans.use: to pay for an operation.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María Santos tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y cuenta con un hijo de 17 años de edad, residen juntos en una de las comunidades que conforman la parte rural del distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, en la región Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de doce años se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a la venta de alfalfa. Ambas actividades las realiza en la zona donde vive y le sirven para sacar adelante a su menor hijo. Su clientela es fija y ella se esfuerza siempre por mantenerla.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales, específicamente aves de corral, asimismo desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de alfalfa, para alcanzar su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer luchadora que siempre da lo mejor de sí en las labores que realiza para sacar adelante a su menor hijo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño. María Santos agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán en esta ocasión  través de Kiva.
texts.en:
María Santos is a 48-year-old single mother who has a 17-year-old son. They live together in one of the communities that make up the rural part of the agricultural district of Cayaltí, in the Lambayeque region, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than twelve years, she has made her living raising young animals and selling alfalfa. She performs both activities in the area where she lives, and they have served to give her young son a good start in life. She has a regular clientele that she always strives to maintain.

María hopes to grow her business by acquiring more animals, specifically poultry. She also hopes to do some upkeep on her alfalfa cultivation. To reach her goal, she thought it would be advisable to request a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a determined woman who always does her best at the work that she does to help her young son get ahead. The people that know her have great respect and fondness for her. María Santos appreciates in advance the people who will help her at this time through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to grow her business raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es: Ramón es un padre de familia de 35 años que vive con sus dos pequeños hijos y compañera en el corregimiento La Playa, muy cerca al mar.  Desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio de frutas, motivado por su padre y hermana quienes se dedican también a la actividad, no solo vendiendo frutas sino verduras y tubérculos.  Inicialmente era su colaborador pero cuando tenía 20 años decidió vender limones puerta a puerta con un pequeño capital que le regaló su hermana y un primo.  Al ver que le iba muy bien con esto, alquiló un pequeño puesto en el mercado público donde también ofrecía variedad de frutas como papaya, mora, mango, guineo maduro, lulo, entre otras frutas tropicales. Con esto le fue muy bien, adquirió muchos clientes y su negocio se fortaleció, sin embargo, desde el año 2009 empezó a trabajar en una empresa privada en el área de oficios varios, razón por la cual le tocó trasladar el negocio para su casa.  Hoy en día utiliza una carretilla con la que vende el producto entre los vecinos del barrio, donde es ampliamente conocido. Tiene un horario laboral por turnos diferentes cada semana, por lo cual  su compañera le colabora cuando él no puede salir a vender.  Compra cada 3 días de contado en el mercado público pero algunas veces sus clientes le solicitan mayor variedad de frutas que por falta de capital no puede ofrecer, con el primer crédito en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pretende adquirirlo. Con el fruto de su trabajo desea sacar adelante a su familia y tener muy pronto su casa propia, ya está ahorrando para lograrlo. Ramón se siente muy afortunado por todo lo que ha logrado y las oportunidades que le ha dado la vida.
texts.en:
Ramón is the thirty-five-year-old father of a family. He lives with his two small children and his partner in the town of La Playa, very close to the sea. Since he was very young he has made a living selling fruit, motivated by his father and sister who make their living in the same way, selling not only fruits but also vegetables and tubers. He was their partner at first, but when he turned twenty he decided to sell lemons door-to-door with a little capital that he was given by his sister and a cousin. On seeing that this was going well, he rented a small stall in the public market where he also offered a variety of fruits such as papaya, blackberries, mango, ripe bananas, and naranjillos (little oranges), among other tropical fruits. He did well with this and acquired many clients, strengthening his business. However, since the year 2009 he has started to work in a private business in the business center, due to which he has had to move the business into his home.

Nowadays, he uses a wheelbarrow from which he sells produce around the neighborhood, where he is well known. He has different shifts at work each week and so his wife helps him when he can't go out to sell. He buys every three days in the public market but sometimes his clients request a greater variety of fruits, which for want of capital he can't provide. With the first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo he intends to acquire them. With the fruit of his labor he wants to help his family get ahead and to have his own house very soon—he is already saving for it. Ramón feels very fortunate for all that he has achieved and the opportunities that life has given him.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits for sale

loans.name: Mumbua

texts.en:
Mumbua is a married woman who lives in Msambweni, Kenya with her husband and two children, aged 3 and 19 respectively. 

She works in a retail shop selling stall, a business that she started three years ago. Her dream for the future is that her children should achieve a personal and professional education. She would also like to build a second floor so that she can separate their living and working spaces. 

Currently, her business has a weekly-day inventory turnover, because her product is purchased daily. She sells daily to her client base which is made up of neighbours and passersby. Her profit is still very small but the volume of sales allows her to sustain her business and expand to other municipalities. Her biggest challenge is insufficient working capital to achieve growth. That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first funding from Kiva Field Partner, Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use the loan to buy basic food products such as wheat flour, butter, eggs and cheese, thereby increasing her productive capacity and thus her income.

loans.use: to buy basic food products such as wheat flour, butter, eggs and cheese.

loans.name: Maximiliano Guillermo

texts.es:
Maximiliano, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo porque está iniciando las labores agrícolas para esto comprará abono y herbicidas y la preparación del terreno, este préstamo le dará la fuerza para poder iniciar una nueva siembra de la cual espera recibir buenos frutos.
El manifiesta que el efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que realizó su buena inversión, de la cual ha logrado mantener a su familia dandoles lo necesario para cubrir los gastos y también ha podido terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maximiliano has decided to request another loan because he is starting some agricultural work and needs to pay for fertilizer, herbicides, and the preparation of the land. This loan will give him the strength to be able to start a new planting from which he hopes to receive good profits.

He reports that the effect of his previous loan was positive; he made a good investment with which he managed to maintain his household, giving his family what they needed to cover their costs. He was also able to finish the construction of his house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is 27 years old. She owns a store selling tomatoes. She has been in that business for the past five years. With the loan, she plans to buy more tomatoes to sell. With the profits from the business, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
This is Cherryl, 31, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Santy, an OFW, and mother to 3 children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cherryl operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighbourhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Cherryl earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She also offers electronic loads for cellphones. She earns a minimum of Php 450 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Cherryl hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
