* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en: Jedida is a 48-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 18 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be leader. She operates a farm where she sells tea leaves, milk, kale and bananas. She has been involved in this business for twelve years and employs three staff members. Her business is located in a busy village and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to buy more tea farms for expanding her business within five years. Jedida plans to use the profits that will be generated to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento Las Águilas está  compuesto por diez integrantes nueve mujeres y un varón la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  María en la foto es la de buzo rojo con polera blanca, tiene 22 años y es soltera con un hijo que tiene la edad de cinco años, ella se dedica al comercio de ropa, su puesto de venta que se encuentra en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María usara  este préstamo para la compra ropa de temporada de invierno  para damas y niños para surtir su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es inversión de su capital de trabajo, la Sra. María  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería en ropa para damas, con el tiempo desea tener su propia tienda y vender variedad de ropa y accesorios, La Sra. María  es una persona muy trabajadora saca delante a su familia, esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene, se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Águilas is comprised of ten members—nine women and one man. María is the president of the bank. In the photo, she is wearing a red sweater with a white shirt. She is twenty-two years old and single with a five-year-old son. She makes her living selling clothing. Her clothing stand is located in one of the markets closest to the city of Cochabomba. This is her first loan sequence with the organization. 

María will use the loan to buy seasonal winter clothing for women and children in order to stock her business. Her reason for requesting the loan is to invest the capital in her business. María faces challenges in her business such as competition. She is going to use the profits to continue buying clothing merchandise for women. With time she wants to have her own store and to sell a variety of clothes and accessories. María is a very hard-working person who is carrying her family forward. This is the only business that supports them. She feels happy for the opportunity provided to her and her group members, since in some cases they single-handedly maintain their families.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for women and children

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 46 años de edad, viven en la ciudad de Itá, vive con su esposa la señora Lorenza, tienen 1 hijo pequeño que va a la escuela.
 El señor Juan tiene una carpintería en su casa donde se dedica a la fabricación de todo tipo de muebles como roperos, mesas, sillas, cómodas, otros y las vende a vendedores ambulantes y particulares sobre pedido. Cuenta que se dedica a esto hace 15 años aproximadamente y gracias a esto ya tiene una buena clientela. 
Juan comenta que por medio de su trabajo da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para el gasto de la casa y para mantener a su hijo.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas, ya que es su elemento principal a la hora de trabajar. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Juan is forty-six years old. He lives with his wife, Lorenza, in the city of Itá. They have one little son who goes to school.

Juan has a carpentry shop in his house where he earns a living making all kinds of furniture, including wardrobes, tables, chairs, and chests of drawers, among other things. He sells these to traveling salespeople and to particular customers by request. He tells us that he has dedicated approximately the last fifteen years to his work. Thanks to this he already has a good clientele.

Juan mentioned that, through his work, he is able to provide his family with everything they need for home expenses and to support his son.

He requests this loan in order to buy wood, since this is his principal element at the hour of building. He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy wood for carpentry

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Con su anterior crédito, Elizabeth compró mercancía como calzado, chancletas, ropa exterior e interior, entre otros artículos y una vitrina donde los exhibe.  Esto ha sido de gran utilidad para su negocio ya que sus ventas han aumentado, tiene una mayor infraestructura y un stock de inventarios que le permite satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.  Con las ganancias de su negocio también ha mejorado su condición habitacional ya que ha realizado unos arreglos a su apartamento lo que a su vez mejora su calidad de vida.  Actualmente solicita otro credikiva con el fin de invertir en la compra de 2 vitrinas más y otra variedad de mercancía tales como sábanas, perfumería y artículos de miscelánea ya que sus clientes se lo han venido solicitando, su mayor sueño es seguir ampliando su negocio para obtener mayores ingresos y poder hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales, hoy se encuentra muy complacida y envía un mensaje a sus financiadores así: “Gracias por el apoyo brindado porque con el he podido cumplir poco a poco los objetivos trazados”
texts.en:
WIth her previous loan, Elizabeth bought merchandise like shoes, flip-flops, clothing, and underwear, among other things, and a display case where she can exhibit it all. This has been extremely useful for her business; her sales have increased, and she has better infrastructure and a stock of inventory that allow her to satisfy her customer's needs. 

With her business earnings, she has also improved her living conditions; she made some repairs to her apartment, which in turn improved her quality of life. 

Currently, she is requesting another Kiva loan with the aim of investing in the purchase of two more display cases and a variety of other merchandise like linens, perfumes, and miscellaneous articles that her customers have been asking for. 

Her greatest dream is to continue growing her business to increase her income and be able to help her children become professionals. Today she is very pleased and sends the following message to her lenders: "Thank you for the support, because with it I have been able to reach the objectives I've laid out, little by little."

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like linens, perfume, shoes, and miscellaneous items, and two display cases to display them in.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 48-year-old woman with four children, aged six to 20. She describes herself as an honest woman. She operates a retail stall, where she sells plastic items, such as bowls, plates, etc. She has been involved in this business for a year. Her business is located within a shopping center, and her primary customers are those who regularly visit the shops. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power sometimes. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more plastic items, such as cooking pots, plates and basins. 

Gladys took an earlier loan of 20,000 KES, which she has repaid. Her business goal is to run a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to use her profits to build a permanent business structure.

loans.use: to  purchase plastic items, such as cooking pots, plates and basins, to sell

loans.name: Leokadia

texts.en:
Leokadia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).

She has been operating a pub for the last ten years in a shop that she rents, working seven days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerycans (packed in 20 liters) of local gin for sale. Her major business challenges include the high costs of transportation and defaulters. Her dream is to own a fully stocked pub and also to sell wholesale only. She joined MCDT to be able to improve her standard of living. She rents a house with access to electricity but without piped water.  Her major monthly expense is rent and school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer, soda and 20 litre jerycans of local gin

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
Vanna, 30, is single and living in a rural village of the Mongkol Borey district of Cambodia. She earns a living as a tailor and rice farmer, earning a daily income of around 25,000 KHR to spend for daily expenses but is able to save only around 6,000 KHR each day. She has been in this business for ten years. 

This is the first loan for Vanna's group of two female members. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy necessary items for her tailoring business and fix her sewing machine. She hopes this loan will enable her to prosper her business and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Darmaris

texts.en:
Darmaris lives in the community of Msambweni with her husband and four children aged from 20 to 35 years. She operates a food selling business, which has been operational for the past six years. She has profited from her extensive knowledge in the field, maintaining the stability of her business. This is reflected in the considerable number of steady clients she has. Darmaris' goal is to have her own store space, and this is why she plans on maintaining her business to its ideal and to increase her working capital. 

This is the first loan she has had with Yehu Microfinance Trust (Kiva Field Partner). Darmaris will purchase food products in large quantities, such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat oil. There is a projected increase in the price of these products and she wants to acquire them before this happens. Darmaris will also purchase other food products, grocery products, and soft drinks. She is very concerned with keeping her business well stocked with what her clients require.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is forty-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.She has been in the hotel business for seven years and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her hardships are price fluctuation, inflation and customers not paying on time. Personal goals are educating children and building a permanent house; business goals are diversifying the business to include a piggery, hiring employees to help expand the business and expanding to new markets. Joice intends to buy chairs and paint for the hotel.

loans.use: to buy chairs and paint for the hotel.

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is a forty-year-old single mother living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her current businesses are a hotel and beauty salon which she has been operating for the last six years. She started this business using her personal savings. Despite her progress, she faces the challenge of price fluctuations and inflation. Her dream is educating her children, building a permanent home and expanding her business into new markets. Peluce needs this loan to buy hotel bedding.

loans.use: to buy hotel bedding

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a forty-nine-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to university. He has a bar business, which he started using capital from his rental houses. George faces hardships of high taxes and breakage of bottles by drunken customers. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming. George needs a loan to buy beers and sodas for sale.

loans.use: to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is an enterprising man. He lives with his wife and their three children in Samburu, Kenya. He operates a retail shop business offering household consumables. He also does some farming where he sells farm produce to his neighbours. Samson installed his business in a good place. He sells his items by layby to his neighbors. Samson's dream is to convert his business into a main location with branches. It will help pay for the education of his children. He hopes for them to become professionals and successfully reach their potential. This loan from KIVA is the second loan that Samson has received from Yehu Microfinance Trust. With it he will buy bundles of household items, wheat flour, maize flour and sugar in order to offer a greater diversity of products.

loans.use: to buy household items, wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 23 years old, single and lives with five family members, two of whom work.

Ahmad has owned a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 as a youth loan in order to pay the annual rent and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity of providing a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Lampeshua

texts.en:
Lampeshua has been farming in Nakuru for the last 8 years. She is 44 years old and is married to Jackson. She plants cash crops which include maize, beans and potatoes, and it has been very profitable.

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings, as well as hire more farming land for planting. This will enable her to increase her harvest and also make more income.

In the future, Lampeshua hopes to grow her farming and also to buy a lorry to transport her farm produce to the market.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seedlings and hire farming land.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en: With her Kiva loan, Nzara bought food items of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil which she uses to cook food for sale at her cafe. It went very well and so she is applying for another Kiva loan  which she will use to construct her home, purchase iron sheets for roofing and more food items, with the aims of continuing to secure discounts, obtaining a new clientele and increasing her capital. Her message to the Kiva financers is as follows: "a special thanks, since the loan I used has served me very well to expand our portfolio and improve our family's living standards."

loans.use: to construct her home, purchase iron sheets for roofing and more food items

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a twenty-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has personal goals of building a permanent house and buying a car. He has been operating a retail shop for the last five years, and is facing hardships of customers not paying on time and price fluctuation. He has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and being the owner of a retail shop. Christopher needs a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and salt for sale.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as soap and salt for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old from Olkalou and is married with four children, all of whom are in school.

Joseph is a farmer and has been doing this for the past 4 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers and seeds for use on his farm.

He hopes to build rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a twenty-five-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house for residence. He has been a poultry farmer for the last four years, and his major hardship is limited funds to meet the demand of his customers. He has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and owning at least 600 chicks. Gilbert needs a loan to buy chicks for his poultry project.

loans.use: to buy chicks for his poultry project.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 28 years old, married to Jeniffer and they have one child. He owns a dairy milk shop in Nakuru town and has been in the business for the past two years.

This being his first loan he plans to use the amount to buy more stocks of milk for resale. He also plans to expand his business by adding more items such as cakes and bread, hence satisfying the needs of his customers.

In the future, Felix hopes to become a dairy farmer and supply milk in Nakuru town. He hope to earn more income and thereby build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of milk and expand his business

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 38 years old and married to Philip with whom she has four children aged 18, 14, 12 and 5 years old. She sells shoes in Nakuru town and has been in the business for one year. Besides shoe sales as her primary business, she also operates a nail art business.

This will be her first loan term and with it Rachael plans to buy more stocks of shoes for resale. She also plans to buy more accessories for the nail art business hence satisfying her customers' demands as well as making more income in both her businesses.

In the future, Rachael hopes to open a wholesale shop for both shoes and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of shoes

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno used her Kiva loan to buy more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and soap for her retail shop. With this new loan she wants to build her family house, expand her range of household items and once again stock her display case.

Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very grateful for the opportunity you gave me to invest in my business; it’s something one wants you to be aware of and that you continue supporting us so that we can get far and improve our family living standards."

loans.use: to build her family house, expand her range of household items and once again stock her display case.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah owns a retail shop in Nakuru town where he sells cakes, milk, soda and other refreshment drinks. He has been in this business for the past 7 years. He is 33 years old, married to Elmelda, and together they have two children aged nine and three years old.

This will be Jeremiah's first loan and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of milk, cakes and soda, thereby increasing his income. This will also enable him to meet the high demands of his customers.

In the future, Jeremiah hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale business, thereby making more income and improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more cakes, soda and milk.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 34 years old and she operates a rental housing business in Nakuru town. She is married to John and they have 2 children aged 12 and 19 years old.

She plans to use this loan amount to buy paint so that she can furnish and paint her rental houses and keep them in good condition. With the anticipated profits from her business, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Lucy hopes to invest more in her property business by buying a plot and building both residential and commercial houses. This will bring her more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To furnish and paint rental houses.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 26-year-old single man and he started working in agriculture twelve years ago.
He plants wheat, olives, cherries and apricots. His products are of a high quality and are highly requested in the market.
Haidar applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.
This loan will also help him in doing the necessary things to finish building his house.
He hopes to expand his business as much as he can in the future through reclamation of new agricultural lands.

loans.use: To buy necessary seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She is a 37-year-old single mother living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a tailoring business that she started ten years back. She faces a challenge in price fluctuations and inflation. Her dream is educating her children up to higher institutions of learning and also moving her business to a more permanent location. Enid needs this loan to pay school fees for her children since the new term has began.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Griselda Maricela

texts.es:
Griselda, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprarse algunos materiales que necesita en el negocio como maíz, cebolla, quesillo, chicharrones, y algunas frutas y verduras frescas para incrementar el inventario en su negocio, espera de esta inversión obtener muy buenos resultados y seguir trabajando con préstamos.
Ella manifiesta que el crédito anterior le ha ayudado mucho para crecer y desarrollarse mejorando el local del negocio y mejorando también los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Griselda has decided to ask for a new loan to buy some materials which she needs for the business such as corn, onions, farmer’s cheese, pork rind and some fresh fruit and vegetables to increase her business' inventory. She hopes that she will obtain very good results from this investment and to continue working with loans. 

She says that the last loan helped her very much to grow and expand, improve the shop premises and improve her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy corn, onions, farmer's cheese, pork rind.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been selling vegetables in Nakuru town for the last 22 years. He is 42 years old and married with three children.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use this amount to boost his business by buying more stock of cabbages for sale. With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy a plot and build a house for his family.

In the future, Peter hopes to grow his business and supply vegetables to other markets as well as schools and hotels and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy needs another loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell. He is a 39-year-old married man with five children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a retail shop that he started with 250,000 shillings and now he has six million as working capital. His main challenges include bad customer debts and ever-increasing rental costs. He used the previous loan to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell

loans.name: Chete

texts.en:
Chete is 23 and lives in Msambweni, where she operates a butcher shop business. She started the business three years ago, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Her first step was to study the market and make pre-sales visits to restaurants in order to start her business venture. She has managed to secure a market for her meat sales as her strategic location is her greatest strength. 

Chete is very enthusiastic about the growth of her business. She works every day, doing her best to increase her clientele, and she has managed to do so. Her greatest challenge is that her working capital is insufficient to meet her projected market demand. 

This is precisely the need she would resolve with her Kiva loan, her third with the Yehu Microfinance Trust. Chete will use it to buy 2 cows for meat sales to have a greater range of products to meet her customers' greatest needs. Her dream is to succeed in expanding her business, and keep it stocked at all times with meat products.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows for meat sales

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has personal goals of getting self education and educating his children.

He sells shoes and the business is profitable despite hardships of price fluctuation, inflation and bad debts. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops and moving to city markets. John needs a loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze used her Kiva loan to buy sacks of charcoal for sale at a retail shop. She’s now applying for another Kiva loan to expand her business, purchase sacks of charcoal and once again stock her store.

She is grateful to Kiva lenders and Yehu Microfinance for giving her an opportunity to invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and once again stock her store

loans.name: Oñondivepa 2 Group

texts.es:
Oñondivepa 2 es el grupo integrado por 14 mujeres de la ciudad de Asuncion. Ellas gracias a su trabajo y a su esfuerzo ya han logrado estar en el séptimo ciclo. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, con ganas de salir adelante y trabajar juntas y por medio de su trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Laura es miembro del grupo, y también es la presidenta, comenta que gracias al trabajo en conjunto que ellas hacen han podido salir adelante como grupo y ayudarse todas. Laura se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, jeans, pantalones, camisas y demás, gracias a lo cual puede ayudar en su casa y también mantener a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de camisas, camperas, jeans, abrigos y demás tipo de prendas, con lo que podrá seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Oñondivepa 2 is comprised of 14 women in the city of Asuncion.  Thanks to their hard work and consistent effort, they successfully completed their seventh loan cycle.  They are hard-working and entrepreneurial women with a strong desire to get ahead and work together.  Through their work, they help one another.

Laura is a member of the group and also the president.  She is thankful to be able to work with the women and that they have gotten ahead as a group and helped each other.  Laura sells clothing of all styles, such as shirts, jeans, pants, tops and other things.  She is thankful to be able to help at home and support her family.  She is asking for a loan so that she can buy shirts, jackets, jeans, coats and other types of clothing so that she can continue offering a good selection to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 34 years old and is married with two children, ages one and four. He is from Nakuru and has been running a clothing business for the past six years. 

Charles is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to buy more clothes to add to his stock. He hopes to own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to buy clothing to add to his stock

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes, es madre soltera, trabaja arduamente para llevar el sustento a sus 2 hijos; labora como profesora de una escuela de primaria del departamento de león desde las 7:00 am hasta las 12:30 pm

La señora maría solicito este crédito para realizar mejorar en el techo de su vivienda sintiéndose muy agradecida por el apoyo que CEPRODEL le ha brindado.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is a single mother that works hard to support her two children.  She is a teacher in a primary school in the León region and teaches from 7:00 AM until 12:30 PM.

María is seeking a loan so that she can improve the roof of her house.  She is very thankful for the support that CEPRODEL has given her.

loans.use: to buy zinc and perlines (horizontal structural parts of a roof).

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a 28-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past six years, he had been running a motorcycle transport business. Jonathan saved his start-up capital while working as a hawker. His business challenges include high fuel and transportation costs and mechanical breakdown. 

Jonathan is requesting a loan to service his motorcycle. His future vision is to diversify his business to include farming and to buy at least three motorcycles.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 29 years and is married with a two-year-old daughter. For the past four years, he has operated a motorbike business. He also has a secondary wood business.

James is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to service his motorcycle and buy spare parts. In the future, he hopes to expand his wood business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ana Eva

texts.es: Ana, Esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejorar el inventario actual y comprarse una nueva herramienta para su taller de costura, específicamente una máquina rana que le ayude a tener mayor agilidad en la confección de las prendas de vestir, este préstamo será un gran apoyo para poder mejorar en el negocio. Ella considera que el efecto que obtuvo del préstamo anterior ha sido positivo ya que ha mejorado el inventario en telas y ha producido mayor cantidad de ropa, también en su familia ha tenido mejores condiciones y un mejor ingreso económico.
texts.en: Ana is seeking a loan to improve her current inventory and to buy a new tool for sewing, specifically a sewing machine, which will help her to have more flexibility in making clothing.  This loan will be a great help to her so that she can improve her business.  She says that her previous loan made a positive impact and enabled her to improve her inventory of fabrics.  She has produced a greater quantity of clothing and her family's living conditions have improved due to an increase in her income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jovanis

texts.en:
Jovanis is a 48-year-old widow living in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of taking care of the family rests on her and her dream is to educate her children. Jovanis operates a used-clothing business and has progressed from her starting capital of 800,000 UGX to her current budget of 3,000,000 UGX. Her business challenges includes customer non-payment and inadequate capital to purchase stock.

Jovanis used her previous loan to buy clothing to sell during the Christmas season. She is requesting a loan to buy women's and children's clothing to sell. Her business dream is set up a boutique in her town.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José de 53 años de edad, es separado, vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla José es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde ha instalado maracuyá y limón, una vez que realiza su cosecha sus productos los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Lambayeque – Chiclayo y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su hogar.  También cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual trabaja ofreciendo su servicio en los pueblos y centros poblados de la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi, ya que el continuo uso ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas, adicionalmente desea comprar abonos y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. 

El ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y le fue bien, por ello se siente muy agradecido con las personas que colaboraron con el en aquella oportunidad. José también agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán en esta ocasión.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old, he is separated, he lives in his own home (which has plumbing and electricity), and his home is located in the district of Olmos in the Lambayeque area.  This area is known for its agriculture and livestock.

José works in agriculture on his own farmland where he grows passion fruit and lemon.  When he harvests his fruit, his products are sold in different marketplaces around Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  He earns enough income to cover his household expenses.  He also earns money with his moto-taxi (a motorized vehicle for transporting supplies and people) and he offers transport services to people in the towns and city centers.

He is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles so that he can pay for maintenance on his moto-taxi.  He has used it for a long time and it is beginning to suffer and break down.  He also wants to buy compost and fertilizer for his crops.

He already had a loan through Kiva, it went well, and he is very grateful to the people that gave him the opportunity.  José sends his thanks in advance to the people that will fund this loan.

loans.use: to pay maintenance and repair expenses for his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Gian Pierre

texts.es:
Gian Pierre es un joven de 21 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Pisco, a pesar de su corta edad él es muy perseverante, emprendedor y trabajador, él ha trabajado desde joven para apoyar a sus padres, Gian Pierre tiene un gran sentido de superación, actualmente acaba de terminar de estudiar satisfactoriamente la carrera técnica de electrónica que tanto deseaba.

Con mucho empeño y dedicación, Gian Pierre trabaja desde hace más de un año como electricista,  él se encuentra muy a gusto con la labor que realiza, ya que cuenta con la fidelidad de sus clientes, quienes siempre lo recomiendan por sus buenos trabajos y buen trato. 

Gian Pierre se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, puesto que desea poder techar su dormitorio, ya que estando en la época de invierno se están presentando muchas lluvias por la zona donde vive; de esta manera Gian Pierre podrá ir terminando de construir la casa de sus padres, ya que tiene el gran deseo de apoyarlos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gian Pierre is a young man, 21 years of age, who lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Pisco. In spite of his tender age he is very persistent, enterprising and hardworking. He has worked from a very early age to support his parents. Gian Pierre has a strong sense of overcoming and currently has successfully finished his technical studies to be an electrician which he so fervently wanted. 

With a great deal of effort and dedication, Gian Pierre has worked for more than a year as an electrician. He is very happy with the work he does, since his customers are faithful and always recommend him on account of his good work and manner. 

Gian Pierre is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, he will be able to make improvements to his living quarters. He would like to be able to put a roof on his bedroom as, being now the winter season, there is a lot of rain in the area where he lives. In this way Gian Pierre will be able to be finishing up with building his parents' home, since he is strongly motivated to support them and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out improvements to his living quarters.

loans.name: Matogo

texts.en:
Matogo lives in Msambweni, Kenya, with her husband and nine children. She owns a food stall located at the market. Matogo has been associated with Yehu Microfinance Trust for over two years and during that time she has seen her business grow thanks to loans from this organization.

Matogo is requesting a loan to pay the school fees for one of her children. She highly values education for her children and is looking for ways to provide for her youngest children, who are still under her charge. This is what motivates Matogo to operate her business as she wants to provide better education for her children. She is grateful to Yehu for the help it has given her. On a personal level, her business has provided her with independence and now provides her family with basic needs.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Veronica Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica  tiene 24 años y es soltera con un hijo que tiene la edad de dos años, ella se dedica a la venta de artefactos eléctricos y variedad de productos todos da a crédito  ya sea de forma semanal y quincenal, también entrega productos a pedido, este préstamo es su primera secuencias dentro de la institución, la Sra. Verónica utilizara este préstamo para la compra de  equipos de sonido y otros para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tiene un pedido para entregar, la Sra. Verónica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos, la Sra. verónica es una persona joven trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ms. Verónica, 24, is single with one child who is two years old. She earns a living selling electrical appliances and a variety of products, all on credit with either weekly or biweekly payment plans. She also provides products by special order. 

This loan is her first within the institution. Ms. Verónica will use this loan to purchase sound equipment and other equipment for her business. Her reason for seeking this loan is that she has an order to fill. Ms. Verónica faces challenges in her business such as competition and will use her profits to continue buying merchandise so as to generate more earnings. Ms. Verónica is a young, hardworking person. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of sound equipment and other items.

loans.name: Erwun Ely

texts.es:
Ely es un hombre de 45 años que nació en Luz de América una parroquia que pertenece a la ciudad de Santo Domingo. Santo domingo es una ciudad central estratégica de Ecuador que une a la Costa con la Sierra por lo que ha servido como un punto central de transito y comercio. La ciudad cuenta actualmente con unos 600 mil habitantes y tiene la particularidad de haber cambiado de provincia ya que paso de pertenecer de la provincia de Pichincha a la recién constituida provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. La provincia recibe su nombre debido a una etnia antigua que ocupaba el lugar, este grupo indígena se conocía como los Tsachila y acostumbraban a pintarse el cabello rojo utilizando el achiote. Santo Domingo tiene un clima promedio de 25 °C, y de manera muy interesante se encuentra a una hora de la playa por un lado pero por el otro a dos horas de la cordillera de los andes. 
Ely mantiene su hogar donde vive junto a su esposa Marianita, ellos tienen hijos 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 5 años. El se dedica a ser un vendedor ambulante de leche, negocio en el que va alrededor de 3 años. El sueño de Ely es mejorar las condiciones de su casa para hacerla más bonita y más segura, el cree que el hogar es clave para el desarrollo de los valores de sus hijos. Por esta razón Ely solicita un crédito para adquirir más tanques recolectores y leche para así expandir las rutas que cubre con su producto, para así vender en mayor volumen y poder mejorar sus ganancias. Actualmente los ingresos con los que Ely cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a toda su familia, especialmente porque él es la única fuente de ingreso para el hogar. Ely está confiado que él puede lograr este reto que se ha propuesto y que su sueño se cumplirá, el es muy bueno y muy dedicado en su trabajo pero necesita una pequeña ayuda para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Ely is a 45-year-old gentleman who was born in Luz de América, a parish within the city of Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo is a city that is strategically located in central Ecuador between the coast and the mountains. It has become a central point for transit and commerce. This city currently has about 600,000 inhabitants. It also has the unique distinction of having changed provinces. Santo Domingo was previously part of Pichincha Province, but then became part of the newly formed province of Santo Domingo de Los Tsachilas. The province takes its name from an ancient ethnic group that occupied this area. This indigenous group known as the Tsachila had a custom of dying their hair red using the pigment from the achiote tree. Santo Domingo has an average temperature of 25°C. What is very interesting is that Santo Domingo is an hour away from the beach on one side and is two hours away from the Andes mountains on the other side.

Ely maintains his home where he lives with his wife Marianita. They have three children (ages 13, 11, and 5). Ely is a traveling milk vendor and has been in business for approximately three years. His dream is to improve the conditions of his home to make it more beautiful and more secure. He believes that the home is the key to developing the values of his children. For this reason, Ely is requesting a loan to acquire more collection tanks and milk so that he can expand the routes that he covers for delivering his product. This will enable him to sell in greater volume and improve his earnings. The income that Ely currently earns is not enough to sustain his entire family, especially since he is the only breadwinner in his household. He is confident that he can meet this challenge before him and fulfill his dream. Ely is a good man who is very dedicated to his work, but he needs a little help in order to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy milk and milk collection tanks.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is 36 years old. She is from Nakuru and is married with four children who are between the ages of 22 and 8 years old. Sophia runs a grocery store, which she has had for the past seven years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to open a food kiosk. She hopes to open a wholesale shop to run alongside her two businesses.

loans.use: to open a food kiosk.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 42 years old and is married with two children, ages 14 and 16. Jane is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy more rabbits and poultry to add to her stock. She is optimistic that the business will do better after the loan. She hopes to venture into large scale farming in the near future.

loans.use: to buy rabbits and poultry.

loans.name: Kayed

texts.en:
Kayed is a 49-year-old married man, father of three children.

Kayed has been working as a taxi driver since a year ago. His business is improving because he is taking good care of his car. From his one year savings, he was capable of doing necessary maintenance to its body, because he wants it to be attractive to customers, especially tourists.

He applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new car engine to keep it fit.

Kayed has been an Al Majmoua borrower for seven cycles. He was a good standing borrower and at the same time the loans reflected positively on his social and financial life.

loans.use: To pay for the car's new engine.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 44 years old, from Olkalou, and is married. She has four children who are in college.

Hannah is a farmer and has applied for her first loan to enable her to buy fertilizers and seeds. She has been farming for the past 26 years and is optimistic that her farm will do well after the loan.

She hopes to build rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 31 years old. He is from Nakuru and is married. He has three children who are between 12 years and 2 years old.

Antony is a farmer and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy seeds and fertilizers to be used on his farm. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

In the future, he hopes to to venture into a motorbike business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 47-year-old married man and a father of four children. He has been working in the fish business for 26 years. He loves this business a lot and he adores the sea.

In 2004, Ali opened his fish selling shop, where he sells fresh, frozen, grilled, and fried fish. His customers like the good quality products he serves. Ali also works as a taxi driver after he finishes selling fish to make extra income to cover his family's expenses.

Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a big, new refrigerator to save fish in a good, healthy way, and to make necessary repairs to his car.  He hopes to open a fish restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To buy a big, new refrigerator to save fish in a healthy way, and to make necessary repairs to his car

loans.name: Ronald Amaury

texts.es: Con su primer credikiva, Ronald compró materiales para realizar sus trabajos de acabado en yeso y marmolería en viviendas y empresas donde lo habían contratado, de esta manera pudo responder a sus pedidos sin ningún contratiempo  ya que en todos los casos le toca comprarlos con anticipación.  En esta ocasión, Ronald invertirá en la compra de algunas herramientas para realizar su oficio, así podría realizar trabajos de mejor calidad y entregar un mejor producto.  Su mensaje para los fondeadores de kiva es el siguiente: “Ustedes tienen un gran corazón al querer contribuir a que nuestro futuro sea mejor con la financiación de nuestros proyectos, con el crecimiento de nuestros negocios mejora nuestra calidad de vida. ¡Gracias!”
texts.en:
With his first Kiva loan, Ronald bought materials for doing his plaster and marble finishing work in homes and businesses. He was therefore able to respond to his customers' orders without any problems; he always has to buy in advance. 
Now, Ronald will invest in the purchase of some work tools. This way, he will be able to do better quality work and create a better product. His message for Kiva lenders is the following: "You have such good hearts to want to contribute to improving our futures through financing our projects. Through our businesses' growth, our quality of life will improve. Thank you!"

loans.use: to buy tools for plaster and marble finishing work.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha owns a food stall that is located near her home. She lives in Msambweni, Kenya, with her husband and seven children. She has been associated with Yehu Microfinance Trust for over two years. During this time she has seen her business grow thanks to the loans from this organization.

One of her children is attending school and she is now requesting funding to pay for her child's school fees. She highly values education for her children and is looking for ways to provide for her younger ones, who are still under her charge. This is the reason why she is motivated to do her food selling business: to provide better education for her children.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.name: Malikie

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Malikie. He is married and has two children, age 3 and 7 years. 

Malikie dropped out of school as a result of his mother’s death, to enable him to take care of himself and his family. In 1995, he established his jeans, shirts, boots, shoes and shorts business. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Malikie has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now he requires a new loan in order to buy additional jeans, shirts, boots, shoes and shorts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. 

In the future, Malikie plans to open another shop for his brother who has come from the village. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for shoes, jeans, shirts and boots.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, and all her children go to school. She does take care of other additional family members. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees and rent.

She sells second-hand clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis and sells her products door to door. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last seven years. 

She has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to educate her children up to university and also to get a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu owns a grocery stall business that is located at her home. She lives in Msambweni, Kenya, with her husband and three children. She has been associated with Yehu Microfinance Trust for over two years. During this time, she has seen her business grow thanks to the loans from this organization.

One of her children is attending school and she is now requesting funding to pay for her child's school fees. She highly values education for her children and is looking for ways to provide for her youngest, who is still under her charge. This is the reason why she is motivated to do her grocery stall selling business: to provide better education for her children. 

She is grateful to Yehu for the help it has given her. On a personal level, her business has provided her with independence and now provides her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
With her Kiva loan, Rose bought bales of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar, which she used to boost her retail shop. It went very well and so she is applying for another Kiva loan. She will use it to purchase bales of shoes for resale, with the aim of continuing to secure discounts, obtaining new clientele and increasing her capital. 

Her message to Kiva lenders is as follows: a special thanks, since the loan enabled her to double her monthly profits and provide better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bales of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jeanneth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jeanneth, una humilde campesina, ama de casa, quien es originaria de la comunidad San Lorenzo en las afueras de Teustepe, es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo es agricultor. Ella tomo la iniciativa de sembrar arroz de riego,  sus hijos la apoyaron desde un inicio, al principio estaba temerosa de que le negaran el crédito por ser mujer pero aun asi lo hizo gracias a Dios todo salió bien MiCredito la apoyo desde el principio y decidió beneficiarle con un crédito Kiva. Su producción de arroz la vende  en la misma zona donde vive, algunos compradores viajan desde otras comarcas en busca de su producto, su cultivo no lo sale a vender fuera de la zona debido a que genere muchos costo pues sus área de siembras son pequeñas pero si le gustaría que a medida crezca su producción poder vender fuera de su comunidad. Su negocio ha sido muy rentable además tiene otros ingresos los cuales obtiene por cuidar la bomba de agua potable que abastece la comunidad.

Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para sembrar 2 manzanas de arroz de riego. Jeanneth trabaja muy duro para darle estudios a sus y poder prepararlos para que sean alguien en la vida, esa es su meta por lo próximo desea preparar para sacar adelante su siembra de arroz venderlo todo, pagar el crédito y seguir adelante trabajando cada día.
texts.en:
Jeanneth, a humble countrywoman, is from the community of San Lorenzo on the outskirts of Teustepe. She is the mother of 6 children and her husband is a farmer. She took the initiative to sow irrigated rice, and her children have supported her from the beginning. At first, she was afraid that she would be denied a loan because she is a woman; but despite this, everything went well, thanks to God. MiCredito has supported her from the start and decided to provide her with a Kiva loan. She sells her rice in the same area where she lives, and some buyers travel from other regions in search of her product. She does not leave the area to sell, because this would be expensive; her plots of land are small. However, she would like for her production to increase in time so that she could sell outside of her community. Her business has been very profitable, and she has other sources of income which she gets from tending to the water pump that supplies her community.
She needs a loan to buy products for planting two lots of irrigated rice. Jeanneth works very hard to provide her children with an education and to prepare them to be someone in life. This is her goal. At the moment she wants to get ready to bring in a good harvest and sell it all, repay her loan, and keep moving forward and working every day.

loans.use: to buy supplies for sowing two lots of irrigated rice.

loans.name: Noemi Yanira

texts.es:
Noemí, solicita un nuevo préstamo, ya que está en la temporada de sembrar el maíz, para esto necesita invertir en el abono, en los herbicidas, en la semilla de maíz, que lo necesario para aplicarlo y poder tener un cultivo frondoso, espera con este que préstamo puede realizar esta inversión de la mejor manera y tener buenos resultados al final.
Ella manifiesta que préstamo anterior también ayudó a a mejorar el negocio de merienda ya que compró los materiales necesarios para continuar brindando y realizando los productos alimenticios a los clientes, considera que ha tenido mayor oportunidad para generar ingresos y espera que de este cultivo también sea un gran avance en la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Noemí is requesting a new loan because it is now the season for sowing corn. For the planting, she needs to invest in fertilizer, herbicides, and corn seeds in order to have a bountiful harvest. She hopes that this loan will allow her to make this investment and to have better final results.
She says that her previous loan also helped her to improve her merienda [snack] business, as she bought the necessary materials for keeping it going. She says that she has had better opportunities for making an income, and she hopes that this harvest will result in a great financial increase for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and corn seed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 52-year-old single mother living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been a front desk officer at the national water and sewerage company for 18 years. With her monthly salary savings, she has been able to pay the school fees for her children and buy land.

Her hardship is a low salary in this current inflation crisis. Her personal goal is building a permanent home and she intends to start a business since she is almost retiring.

Rose needs the loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, con el objetivo de mejorar el negocio solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de más materiales de cocina, que le permita aumentar su producción y seguir generando buenas ganancias para su familia, comprará maíz, leña, aceite, condimentos, y vegetales, esperando tener lo necesario para la ejecución de su trabajo y mejorar el servicio a los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior ella logró una buena inversión que le dio una gran estabilidad en sus ventas, ya que produjo variedad de productos que fueron del gusto de los clientes, esto le ha dado a ella mejores ganancias.
texts.en: María, with the objective of improving her business, requests a new loan to invest in the purchase of more cooking supplies, which will allow her to increase her production and continue generating good income for her family.  She will buy corn, firewood, oil, condiments and vegetables, hoping to have the supplies necessary for carrying out her work and improving the service to her customers.  With the previous loan, she made a good investment that gave her great stability with her sales, since she produced a variety of products that her customers enjoyed.  This has given her greater income.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, oil, condiments, and vegetables.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child who does not go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members, her mother and father. Hellen raises poultry. She operates her business on a retail basis and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last two years. Hellen has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of animal and poultry feed and vaccines. Her major business challenges are transportation, ever increasing prices of feed and seasonality. Her dream is to own a fully stocked shop and also to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of animal and chicken feed.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más inventario para el negocio, comprandose una gran cantidad de pan tostado y también en variedad, este préstamo ayudará a brindar estabilidad en sus ventas y a ofrecer a sus clientes un buen número de pan.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo a su negocio ya que con esa inversión ha logrado superarse y seguir en mejoras con sus ventas y con mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan for the purchase of more inventory for his business. He will buy a large quantity of toasted bread and other varieties of bread. This loan will allow him to achieve stability in his sales and to offer his customers a good variety.
He says that his previous loan was positive for his business, since with this investment he was able to succeed and improve his sales and increase his number of customers.

loans.use: to buy bread; toasted and other.

loans.name: Hanisa

texts.en:
Hanisa lives in the Msambweni community and has seven children, three of whom still attend school. She started her business one year ago when she stopped selling fried fish and ventured into selling coconuts. 

Hanisa is requesting her third Kiva loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy 2,000 coconuts. In the future, she would like to strengthen and diversify her business and locate it in a strategic spot. While moving toward this, Hanisa continues to work intensely to reach her dreams which are her family’s as well.

loans.use: to buy 2,000 coconuts

loans.name: Sanije

texts.en:
Sanije is a 57-year-old lady who has been relocated to the outskirts of a major city in Central Albania. She and her family have built a house there and they also own two “dynyms” of land in their native village. One of Sanije's married sons lives on this land and takes care of the family's fruit trees and vineyards and plants and harvests crops, vegetables, and grains. Sanije has seven children and her oldest is 37 and her youngest is 25. At her current home, she has a cow with a calf and she sells milk to dairy farms to meet the demand in the city.

Sanije is requesting a loan to buy a cow. This will be her first loan and she thanks VFA and Kiva for the opportunity she has been granted. Her loan will be a great help to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bale of shoes and pay for transportation

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a wonderful, enterprising woman of 28. She is the driving force behind her family. She lives with her husband and four children at Mwambalazi, Kenya. Her business is operating a food stall, selling fried food such as chapati (flat bread), cooked beans, cooked rice, etc.  Through her hard work she has built up a strong demand for her products, and she has gradually been expanding and making a better income to reinvest in the items necessary to strengthen the business. Today she lives at her own family business; her husband and children are also involved. 

This Kiva loan is her second loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization through which she has acquired loans to boost her business and thus make a better income to continue improving her family's well-being. With this Kiva loan she will purchase basic materials and ingredients, such as corn, flour, oil, sugar and salt. Her greatest challenge is that her working capital does not turn over sufficiently to cover the growing demand. With her Kiva loan she will be able to purchase at discounted rates, in cash, and in a greater volume. With these permanent injections of capital, she will work in order to later achieve her greatest wish: to have an adequate restaurant in a good location.

loans.use: to purchase basic materials and ingredients, such as corn, flour, oil, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, cuyas edades comprenden 17, 13 y 7 años, por quienes da la vida y junto a su esposo se esfuerzan mucho para darles una vida digna y sobre todo para hacerlos personas de bien. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido, asimismo encontramos muchos atractivos turísticos como son las Líneas de Nazca, las cuales reciben a infinidad de turistas en todo el año. Cuando Luzmila tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión e especial ver sus novelas y en algunas oportunidades le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Seco de Res”. Debido a sus pocos recursos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Luzmila como agricultora, ella trabaja muy duro en su parcela la cual está sembrada de tunas, así como también se dedica a la venta de cochinilla, la cochinilla es un insecto el cual es usado para dar color a diversos productos, en especial textiles, ella trabaja alrededor de 6 horas al día, ya que tiene que revisar siempre su cultivo y también verificar si la cochinilla está madurando; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y trabajadora y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Luzmila está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá realizar una nueva infestación de cochinilla y dar mantenimiento a su cultivo, en especial abonarlo, regarlo, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá tener una buena cosecha y mejorara sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante y luchar para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 37 years old and has three children who are 17, 13 and 7 years old who are her reason for living. Together with her husband they work very hard to give them decent living conditions and above all to raise them to be good people.

Her house is located in the city of Nazca, which is characterised by its warm climate. It also has many turist attractions such as the Nazca lines, which receive an infinite number of tourists throughout the year. When Luzmila has free time she likes to watch the television and read novels and sometimes to eat her favourite dish which is “Seco de Res” (beef stew). Since she does not have many resources she only had a secondary education, but she would have liked to have studied at university. 

Day to day Luzmila works in agriculture. She works very hard on her plot of land on which she is sowing prickly pears, since she earns her living selling cochineal. The cochineal is an insect which is used to dye various products, such as textiles. She works around 6 hours each day, since she always has to look over her crops and check if the cochineal is maturing. She considers that her business is going well because she is very responsible, hard-working and above all because she has is keen to get ahead. 

Luzmila is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she can undertake a new cochineal infestation and maintain her crops, in particular to manure and irrigate then and in this way she will be able to have a good harvest and improve her income, which will allow her to continue working, improving her situation and fighting to make her biggest dream a reality: to finish building her house.

loans.use: to introduce cochineal insects to her prickly pear plants.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She also looks after her brother. For the past four years, she has been running a restaurant from her home. She works six days a week and does not have any other business. Mariam's business challenges include the high price of ingredients, failing at times to sell her cooked food, and failure to collect money. She joined MCDT because she did not have enough collateral to apply for a loan. Mariam rents a house without electricity or running water and her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent. 

Mariam is requesting a 400,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy ingredients such as bunches of bananas, Irish potatoes, cassava, cooking oil, dry peas, and beans in bulk. In the future, her dream is to open a second restaurant in a more lucrative area in order to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as bananas, potatoes, cassava, beans, and peas

loans.name: Rita Soraya

texts.es:
Doña Rita, reside en Nindirí municipio del departamento de Masaya, ella es casada, tiene 41 años de edad,  es propietaria de su propio negocio desde hace siete años, este consiste en la elaboración y venta de cosas de hornos, tres dias a la semana, que son los dias mas fuertes en venta, es  producto hecho a base de maíz. Comenta que con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos han sacado su negocio adelante  y también gracias a los financiamientos que ha obtenido por medio de Ceprodel. Cuenta también aparte de su negocio con dos bicicletas caponeras esto gracias al esfuerzo obtenido.

Se presenta a nuestra oficina para solicitar un nuevo crédito el cual considera que este crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas, de igual manera  mejorara su cálida de vida, dándole a su familia una mejor comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Rita lives in the municipality of Nindirí, in the department of Masaya. She is 41, married, and has owned her own business for seven years. She makes and sells cosa de horno, a corn-based product, three days a week on the best sales days.
She says that her business has become successful thanks to the help of her husband and children, and to the help of the loans she has received from Ceprodel. Aside from this business, she also has two moto taxis which she has obtained thanks to her hard work.
She has come to our office in order to request a new loan. She feels that this loan will help her to increase her sales and improve her quality of life, providing her family with better comfort in their home.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, firewood, and construction materials, etc.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: La Sra. Doris  tiene 41 años  y es soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 13 y 18 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes y variedad de horneados ella vende en su tienda que se encuentra ubicado en la zona el Retoño,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Doris utilizara este  préstamo  para la compra de un horno industrial  para mejorar su negocio ya que incrementa sus ventas y el horno que tenia no le permite hacer en cantidad, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la necesidad de satisfacer  los pedidos de su clientela, la Sra. Doris  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de utensilios va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando en su negocio, y así de esta manera generar más ingresos y por ende  mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia, con el tiempo desea tener una panadería mucho mas equipada, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Doris is 41 years old and is single with two children who are 13 and 18 years old.  She works making and selling breads and a variety of baked items.  She sells bread in her store which is located in the Retoño zone.  This loan is her third sequence with Kiva's partner institution.  Doris will use this loan to purchase an industrial oven in order to improve her business since her sales are growing and the oven that she had would not permit her to bake in quantity.  Her reason for requesting this loan is the need to satisfy the requests of her customers.  Doris faces challenges in her business, including the lack of utensils.  She plans to utilize the income to continue improving her business, and in that way generate more income with the goal of improving the quality of life for her family.  With time she desires to have a much more well-equipped bakery.  She feels happy and grateful to Kiva and its partner for the support given.

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo, age 50, is a retailer. She sells household consumption goods like wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, coconuts, etc. Ever since she started, she has considered it a good business opportunity. She started offering sale from home to her neighbours. Her dream is to have a wholesale shop to earn more profits and help her support her family's well-being.

Her goal is to improve her retail shop business and to respond to the demands of the market, but her working capital stands as a large impediment to achieving her goals. Currently, she is applying for a micro-loan, with which she will expand and diversify her business and establish a transport business, i.e., purchase a motorcycle for transport business. From there, she will really begin her road to achieving her greatest goal of becoming a wholesale supplier.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of other additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis and sells her products door–to-door. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last one year.

Susan has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to educate her children up to university and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: El Sr.  Adrian es divorciado y con tres hijos, trabaja como encargado de una lavandería desde hace ya ocho años laborando, persona seria y responsable, también arregla lavadoras y secadoras para aumentar el ingreso familiar. Necesita apoyo para pagar la escuela de sus hijos pues son tres y quiere que sigan estudiando. La falta de la madre a sido muy difícil para sus hijos y mas para el porque quedo con la carga de educar y mantener a sus hijos, él solo quiere asegurar la educación de sus hijos para brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Adrian is divorced and has three children.  He has worked as a manager of a laundromat for eight years and is a serious and responsible person.  He also fixes washing machines and dryers to increase the family income.  He needs support to pay for his children's schooling, since there are three of them and he wants them to continue studying.  The lack of their mother has been very difficult for his children and also for him because he became in charge of educating and maintaining his children.  He only wants to assure the education of his children in order to offer them a better future.

loans.use: PAGO DE REINSCRIPCION  Y CUOTAS ESCOLARES

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que tiene el objetivo de realizar la elaboración de redes de pesca para esto necesita este financiamiento comprándose hilo, cáñamo, y Marcos, que son necesarios para poder elaborar las redes.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le abrió las posibilidades para mejorar su actividad, esto le ha atraído más clientes y por lo mismo ha tenido mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que tiene el objetivo de realizar la elaboración de redes de pesca para esto necesita este financiamiento comprándose hilo, cáñamo, y Marcos, que son necesarios para poder elaborar las redes.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le abrió las posibilidades para mejorar su actividad, esto le ha atraído más clientes y por lo mismo ha tenido mejores ganancias.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all of them attend school. She does not look after any other dependents.  She has been selling tomatoes and other vegetables and raw foods at retail for the past seven years, working seven days a week. She has no other sources of income.

Cissy has requested for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to purchase more raw food. Her challenges include keeping them fresh, especially in the dry season, and reduced profits when other harvests are also abundant. Her dream is to accumulate enough profit to buy a piece of land and build her own house and also to buy a freezer. She joined MCDT because of their interest in serving the poor. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and other vegetables and raw foods.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both of them attend school. She is looking after her mother.

Halima has been operating a beauty salon away from home for the last four years, working seven days a week. She does not operate any other businesses.  

Halima has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her buy hair extensions and weaves for resale. Her business challenges include seasonality in the market and unstable power supplies. Halima's dream is to have a big salon in the city center where there is higher demand for her services. She joined MCDT because of the low interest rates. She rents a house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions and weaves for resale.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma used his previous Kiva loan to buy bundles of maize flour, sugar and washing detergents. He sold very well and he did very well, too. Since receiving his Kiva loan, liquidity has improved, allowing him to buy larger amounts of materials for cash which qualified him for many discounts.

He is currently renovating to a permanent house which makes him very happy because this will provide stability for his family. His goal is to attain a larger expansion of his market to reach higher sales than currently.

With the new Kiva loan he’s applying for, he will buy raw materials and baking supplies like wheat flour, sugar and fats, among others. His message for Kiva lenders is the following: “Continue helping small businesses and increase loan amounts.”

loans.use: to buy raw materials and baking supplies like wheat flour, sugar and fats, among others.

loans.name: Seray

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Seray.  She is married, and has 5 children aged 17, 16, 10, 8, and 6 years of age. She has no additional dependents living with her.   In 2010, Seray established her cosmetics business. She began her business to earn a living.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Seray requires a loan to buy 10 cartons of assorted cosmetics @Le 3,500,000, with Le 500,000 for transportation. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 429,000.  Seray is excited for the loan and she is planning to expand her business.  She also hopes to see her only daughter educated to university level.  Honest and hardworking, Seray thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of assorted cosmetics

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has two children, both of whom attend school. She sells food products, green vegetables, tomatoes, citrus fruits, and products as retail and to small-business customers and her neighbors. 

Rose began her life as a merchant three years ago with the goal of working on her own and contributing to the support of her household. With very little education, she thought that gradually it would become an option for self-employment that would allow her to get ahead and achieve growth for herself and her family. Her long-term goal is to educate her children so they become successful and happy people.

Currently, she plans to grow her business gradually. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first from Yehu Microfinance Trust. With this loan, she plans to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for her retail shop. Her investment will be successful because it is based on market demand and on her vast business experience.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Meshomari

texts.en:
Meshomari is married and has seven children. She lives in Msambweni with her husband and children. She has a fruit and vegetable business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. 

This is the third loan that Meshomari has requested from Yehu Microfinance Trust because she needs to buy a greater amount of fruit and vegetables. At the moment, she does not have enough working capital to increase her sales because she buys on a daily basis and in small quantities.
